Reviews.Title: “OMG THE MOST OUTSTANDING HOTEL IN SYDNEY!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra12blue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in at least 10 major 5 star hotels in Sydney and I can honestly say Sir Stamford is the best. Upon arrival we were given an automatic room upgrade!. It was offered to us we didn't have to ask for it. We were given room 905..... It was gorgeous and the verandah had unobstructed views. The package we booked was called the lazy day package and it is excellent value for money. The service in this hotel is the best I have seen in the world!!..... Yes and we are frequent travellers and this hotel obviously prioritises in service to hotel guests. I have never stayed in Sir Stamford hotels but now after my experience with this hotel in Circular Quay I will seek them out in my travels. MOST OUTSTANDING HOTEL :)) I would certainly stay in this hotel again. Congratulations on such a fine effort

Reviews.Title: “Stay with Morris the Wimbst at this well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: basmoon
Reviews.Content: The Dir Stamford is located a few minutes from the Opera House and is across from the Sydney Botanic Gardens, the hotel has recently been refurbished under new management. The rooms are large and comfortable with plentyy of power points to recharge cameras and phones. The window opens onto a small balcony (of a large one if you upgrade), the restaurant is well appointed and chef cooks terrific lamb, the bar is relaxed. A must do is the high tea which runs from 11am!

Reviews.Title: “A certain style”
Reviews.Author: Philostratus
Reviews.Content: I have read some reviews and can understand this hotel is not for all, but we find it charming and quirky and very comfortable. It is not as large or slick as most 5 star hotels, but it does offer a touch of luxury the huge places do not. The rooms are larger than normal, the breakfast is fine and warms dishes in old silver servers, like a rather good old English seaside hotel. The front desk staff were young, snooty and inexperienced - but this is common elsewhere in Sydney. It has THE BEST bar that we use even if we are staying some place else. Fantastic professional bar staff, reminds me of the best hotel bars in London. Oil paintings, open fire, piano, its a blast from the past that we adore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but underwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: TimandElisabeth
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be in a better location, but is not 5 star. There is a distinct lack of staff, had to wait almost half an hour for simple breakfast. One person on check out, with 100 plus rooms results in queues. Bedrooms are very comfortable and well appointed, which with the location could be a hotel I would recommend, but i have to say it is pricey for what it is. Concierge not very knowledgeable about routes locally.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: nikkg
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Sir Stamford was for 4 nights and it was great. We had great proximity to the Opera House and the Botanic Gardens. The breakfast was delicious though it wasn't free with the room. We got a two for one special deal which helped with the pricey food. The bed was comfy and the room was very clean. The pool is also really nice after a long day of sightseeing. A great hotel for a special occasion like our anniversary. Also we were able to check in earlier than normal check-in time which was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Sir Stamford Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: Margaret H
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford Hotel at Circular Quay is one of best in the Sydney CBD. It's location is perfect if you are visiting the Opera House, The Rocks and CBD. Walking into the Sir Stamford is like stepping back in time. You are greeted at the door with assistance. All staff greet you in passing. The rooms are fantastic! Extremely spacious compared to other hotels. The breakfast is delicious in a beautiful dining room. The Bar is a great place to just sit back and relax, with excellent service. All in all, I would highly recommend the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay as the perfect Sydney stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Sydney sights”
Reviews.Author: whimhill
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. Our room was large and bath was huge with a tub and a shower. It was quiet even though we were on the front. The plumbing needs to be updated, but the furniture was not worn. It's very old world style with a large sitting room on the third floor and the bar is like a gentlemen's club. We had a nice meal there when it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: 55truckn
Reviews.Content: Not only is hotel located at one of the best spots in Sydney, their customer service is outstanding. After traveling for 22 hours, we arrived at the Sir Stamford at around 8:00 in the morning. Our expectations was to dump our bags and walk around until it was check in time. They met us at the door, took our bags and gave us a key to the gym/locker room so we could shower and change our clothes. Our room was a Harbour View King and it was very comfortable and clean. The views were great and the service superior.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but average otherwise”
Reviews.Author: Leisuretraveller11
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was located within walking distance of the opera house, circular quay and the rocks, making it an amazing location. However the property seemed to be in need of refurnishing with the furniture looking worn. The hotel is advertised as 5* however the feel is that of a 4* at best. There was no ceiling lighting in main part of our room and you had to individually turn on/off the 3 lamps in our room. Furthermore the double bed was made up of 2 single beds made up together. The service was average, when I checked in at 11pm the staff seemed uninterested. However given all the other hotels in the surrounding area rated as 5* they were at least >$140 AUD a night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: yrinsyde
Reviews.Content: I took my elderly mother on holiday to Sydney - her first visit, and I wanted to choose a comfortable but lovely hotel that was intimate but had great service. I have stayed in Stamford hotels in Singapore and Adelaide and going by previous experiences, I hoped there would be one in Sydney. The staff were wonderful and looked after our every need. The breakfast spread had lots of variety and the room it was served in was delightful with lovely decor and beautiful green views. The only down point I had was the tricky shower arrangement which my mother wouldn't have been able to manage, so I recommended her have a bath instead (and the bath was lovely). I visit Sydney every so often on business and will be staying here next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old-style hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: alanderson1987
Reviews.Content: Great old-style hotel in circular quay. Takes less than 5 minutes to walk to shops as well as the Sydney Opera House. Beautiful room with a huge bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “what a gem!”
Reviews.Author: travelbc707
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The location and the decor are fabulous. The highlight for me is definitley the staff. We were travelling with our 2 young boys and the staff were always polite, attentive and friendly. We ate breakfast in the restaurant every morning, and once again the staff, food and service were commendable. We had a room with 2 double beds and it was a good size for our needs. This is the only place I will stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Gem”
Reviews.Author: deejohnUk
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable and comfortable four day stay. Not your glass and chrome monolith, medium sized and in an excellent location a few minutes walk to Circular Quay, Opera House and The Rocks. 15 minutes walk to main shopping. Deluxe double overlooking Botanical Gardens. Room a good size and well equiped, particularly appreciated tea and coffee making facility. Bathroom large, clean, separate bath and shower. Bar area in Hotel served reasonably priced food and drinks and had good entertainment on Friday evenings. Used Restaurant once for breakfast, not impressed so did not use again. Perhaps the most impressive thing about this Hotel is the quality of its staff. I have stayed in many hotels around the world and I can honestly say the staff at this hotel are the best I have experienced anywhere, well informed and pleasantly helpful. Well done to them all.

Reviews.Title: “the top of the TOP”
Reviews.Author: armanddebrignac
Reviews.Content: i dit spend more than 1000 night in Asia Hotel in the last 10 yearsbut this hotel is the most confortable best service and good location. super good managment well trained staff' keep up the good job

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shez060
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, lovely room, big in size. Only problem air condition room next door, the constant hum was annoying at times when trying to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jph2010
Reviews.Content: I spent SO much time researching hotels in Sydney and finally settled on this one. Glad I did. The beautiful decor and professional, friendly staff reminded me of some of the nicest hotels in Europe . . . very upper class but however, without being the least bit stuffy. We felt perfectly comfortable coming and going in our casual clothes, and simply enjoying the peaceful atmosphere of beautiful oriental carpets, era oil paintings, fresh flowers, old-fashioned constant courtesy. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. There is a restaurant where we had breakfast, and a bar that looked quite appealing. From the covered arch entranceway and doorman to the lovely view (from the 10th floor) it felt magical. There are several shuttles from the airport to the hotel at $14 each way, and once at the hotel just about anything worth seeing is walking distance. Even in heels, it was an easy walk to 100 year old stairs leading down to the outdoor cafe area and the Opera House. The price was reasonable for the area. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms had all the amenities one could hope for (see the bedside tables for coffee pots and safe). Our room didn't have a balcony but it had stunning views over the harbor. We could only see the back of the Opera House, but a great view of the bridge, the sailboats, etc. We were going to originally stay in a hotel that had an (expensive) full view of the Opera House but realized it was quite a walk and so opted for Sir Stamford instead. Turns out to have been the far better choice. The Royal Botanical Gardens (which are breathtaking) is right across the street from the hotel, too.

Reviews.Title: “large and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballygirl123
Reviews.Content: First thing I noticed was the size of the room - it was very spacious and loved the juliette balcony! Beds and pillows were very comfortable, location ideal and staff friendly. This is my partner's hotel of choice whenever he travels to Sydney because of the spacious and clean rooms. Will be staying here again, although the decor isn't what I would call modern, more like old english style.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: dazman2210
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and found this hotel to be very comfortable. The size of the rooms are great. They are very clean and very spacious with the most comfortable king size bed that I have ever slept in. The bathroom is also spacious and would have to be the most beautiful hotel bathroom I've seen. The staff are very friendly and very helpful also the staff in 'The Bar' were very nice. The hotel is in a great location. A minute walk to Circular Quay and a 10-15 minute walk into the main shopping area of the city. We highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: x2go
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 7 nights, what a beautiful place. Requested an early check in and was able to do so after arriving at the hotel before noon. It was in a great location for all the things I wanted to do. This hotel was in walking distance to Circular Quay, where I found great restaurants, shopping and many great sights. Kudos to Kieran, Dean, Drew, and Kylie,they were so pleasant and helpful during my stay, can't thank them enough.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....”
Reviews.Author: Peter D
Reviews.Content: Arriving at Circular Quay by trian with an 11 & 8 year old we were thrilled to find the Sir Stamford was only a short walk away. We arrived well before check in and the Concierge were more than happy to look after our bags whilst we toured the city. We arrived back after our day out to find a terrific sized room with a view of the park opposite the hotel. The bathroom was luxurious and much to my wife's delight a hair dryer with some oomph. Beds were comfortable and the room very clean. We opted for breakfast in the hotel on both days and were very pleased with the quality and selection of the food available. The staff could have been a liitle more attentive but that is about all we could pick if we had to find a negative. Overall we would recommend the Sir Stamford to our friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ... we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLover006
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, old-world hotel, great, polite staff who are very helpful. Beautiful comfy bed, hotel in fabulous position, around the corner from Circular Quay. Best hotel we have stayed in in Sydney, just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: Kris_K_D
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay my first-ever two nights in Sydney at the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay because after a long-haul flight I wanted peace and comfort -- and the Sir Stamford did not disappoint. I'd requested an early check-in, which is always subject to availability, but the room was not quite ready when I arrived. This was no problem, however, because I was granted access to the 5th floor fitness room and pool where I could shower, change and/or use the outdoor pool while my room was readied. The pool is quite tiny -- not too much bigger than a large hot tub -- and is only 1 meter deep all around. But -- oh, heaven -- did this help! While my husband took a post-shower nap in the patio's filtered shade, I showered, swam about, and lounged poolside... and the room was ready after an hour-and-a-half. Room 312 overlooked the main entrance and the Royal Botanic Gardens -- or what we could see through the trees that is. [The third floor is noted as a Lounge (Club) floor in the elevator, but I was told that the perks that came with the floor no longer apply.] Our room was spacious and spotless with plenty of natural light. The bed and furnishings were comfortable -- perfect for some much-needed rest. There was a little bit of road noise, but not much considering our busy streetside location. The bathroom was elegant and clean, comprised of mostly marble. There was a double vanity, soaking tub, shower and a a toilet room. Amenities were plentiful and of good quality. Within the hotel, all of our staff encounters were pleasant. We utilized the concierge's advice a few times; he was friendly and good-natured to boot! From my research I found that rooms at the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay can be on the pricier side for travellers on a budget. Typically, a room here would be more than I'd prefer to spend unless I were splurging for a special occasion. However, I booked this room about a year in advance and was able to secure an excellent rate (south of $250/night) -- a bargain, considering the room and hotel class, location, and the splendid service! The one oddity we experienced was a mid-stay change of furniture! I'm not sure if this happens often, but it was a first for me. When we returned from a long day of sightseeing, I noticed the couch and chair were a different color. My husband didn't believe me until I showed him the picture I'd taken upon our arrival. He inquired at the front desk and he thought the gentleman was surprised we'd noticed. Apparently, we happened to be in a room where the furniture was cycled out for cleaning and they'd replaced it with a set that was just cleaned. This was no bother to us, just an unexpected event.

Reviews.Title: “Does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: caran275
Reviews.Content: At this hotel, I get the best sleep ever - this time and during previous stays. This time my room overlooked Macquarie St and the gardens - just delightful. Last time it was a harbour view. I enjoyed both equally. The fact that the aircon can be turned off and balcony doors opened to breathe in Sydney's air is, to me, a huge plus. I dislike hotels where windows and doors are fixed and I feel cooped up. So well did I sleep here, I want to replace my home bedding with that similar to this hotel. Staff courteousness is fantastic. Nothing seems to be any trouble at all. Wi-fi is available gratis (with one's own laptop) in the lounge. The hotel is just so close to transport -train, buses and Sydney Harbour ferries: five minutes walk to the Sydney Opera House and the stunning views of Sydney Harbour. And, to shop it's only 10 minutes walk along Macquarie St to David Jones and the central business district. I cannot speak too highly about this hotel. Nothing about it disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel if you are from overseas”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJan
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the heart of Sydney, walking distance from pretty much anything. Friendly staff with a nice restaurant. The whole place is very old world. We were impressed with the service when you needed a cab, they run out of their way for you.

Reviews.Title: “"AWESOME, AWESOME, AWESOME"”
Reviews.Author: dfh679
Reviews.Content: The PERFECT LOCATION FOR Circular Quay. BEAUTIFUL facility with helpful, friendly staff. We are so very happy we stayed here. I will now be looking for Stamford Hotel where ever we go!!!!!!!!!!!!! Debbie in Louisville Kentucky, USA

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION- EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: BillyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our twin bedded room was on the 6th floor and had a "french" balcony looking toward the harbor. (see photo) We had a partial bridge view. The french windows opened. The room was spacious, air conditioning worked well and the room was beautifully appointed. The bathroom was very spacious too and had a tub shower. Bathrobes were provided without our asking. I appreciated that there was ample counter space for all the medications and toiletries seniors may bring with them! The hotel wifi was problematic and unreliable even in the lobby. It didn't work in our room. The room's hard wire computer connection was the old fashioned Ethernet type and wouldn't work with our modern laptop. Hotel staff service was excellent everywhere and there was no charge for printing boarding passes in the business center. The computer in the business center was free - very nice! The concierge desk could become busy at the usual times, morning and evening; and sometimes it seemed slightly understaffed. Breakfast was wonderful in the hotel. I couldn't have asked for a nicer experience or better hotel location prior to sailing. We could walk to the ship had it not been for all our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep and room service meal ever!”
Reviews.Author: Katemx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had two nights here in room 816 with the intention of winding down after a busy month. We had the best sleep we have had in years. That may have been partly due to having no cats climbing over us but I think it was more to do with the beautiful, cloud-like bed, luxurious pillows and the quietness of the room. There is something about the Sir Stamford - I imagine it is the age of the building and the quality of the unpretentious service - we both felt so contented and relaxed. We ordered room service because we were too tired to go out. i did not have very high expectations - our experience of room service meals is that they are rarely something to write home about. We noticed that, as well as the usual fare they had a Singaporean menu so we thought we would give that a try - again, not usually a big fan but we had recently queued for nearly an hour outside Mamak to try their famous roti's and were interested to compare. All I can say is, from the moment I tasted the the roti dipped in lamb curry my eyes widened with surprise and we just kept saying "Wow" over and over. We also ordered curry puffs and satay sticks. All of it delicious - flaky, buttery rotis and fragrant, juicy curry. Apparently the Wonton Soup is also amazing but we will have to keep that for next time. Other comments - our room felt spacious with King bed, desk, couch and armchair, also a Juliet Balcony so you can have fresh air. Service very prompt, understated and friendly. Very close to Opera House. Bit of a walk to the shopping district and there didn't seem to be many cafe's close by. Room service was reasonably priced. Room very clean and cosy. Spacious marble bathroom. Value wise, it was a bit of a special treat for us but one that we will repeat given the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Value of money certainly”
Reviews.Author: LeadallaAsia
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, clean, large rooms, not exagerated expencive. We got the upgrade for 90 aud a night in one suite but that one not deserved because also a stardard room is really nice. The breakfast is generous. The consiergery friendly. Beds really confortable. Bathroom big The location is only 5 min walk to the Opera House, close to the botanic garden and Sydney museum

Reviews.Title: “The KEY location for Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Easily the best semi-boutique hotel in Sydney's high end hotel market, private, well appointed, personal service, a rare & large working fireplace in winter in Lobby, a skip to Botanical Gardens & Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time for a great experience”
Reviews.Author: gplim
Reviews.Content: Spent a Friday night at the "Sir Stamford". This hotel has lots of charm, and has lots of Art on the walls and large chandelliers. The staff are just great. Often in top hotels the staff can be a bit "up them selves" but not here. We had a drink in the Bar before going out to dinner chatted with the Head barman and tried out their famous curry puffs - very nice. In fact while at the bar we met the Manager, a Lady, that has also run some hotels in New Zealand which is where we were from. I talked to the some of the staff later and they said she is a great person to work for and I think it shows in the friendly and helpful manner the staff have. The rooms are large and the beds comfortable. The hotel is very close to the Circular Quay area of Sydney where alot of the tourist action happens especially if you need to catch ferries or the train or are going to the Sydney Opera House (walking distance). There are lots of cafes and restaurants close by as well as the hotel's own restaurant. The large Botanic Gardens are just across the road, and a few blocks up you are into the main shopping areas. If you like the charm and beauty of older luxury style hotels and modern friendly service, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: KTJ058
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to Sydney and enjoy staying in the CBD. We book a different 5 star hotel each time we visit in the attempt to find the hotel which is perfect for us. Most 5 star hotels are much the same when it comes to decor, facilities etc but differ enormously when it comes to customer service. We found the perfect mix at the Sir Stamford, a beautiful smaller 5 star hotel which has amazing personal, friendly yet professional service. The larger 5 star hotels are slightly sterile, mass produced and impersonal, this is where the Sir Stamford has the definate edge. From the moment we drove up outside we were greeted with genuine smiles and a sincere friendly welcome. We were made to feel special from the very beginning and this feeling didn't stop until we left. The staff here genuinely appear to love their jobs which shows in the way they treat their guests. Our suite was large, inviting and spotless and the bathroom was huge! The furnishings created a relaxing ambience. It was lovely to be able to step out onto the balcony, something which is quite rare in an innner Sydney hotel. We couldn't hear a sound from adjoining rooms even though they were occupied, another rarity these days in most hotels!! We thoroughly enjoyed and appreciated the personal service at breakfast, never having to wait or queue for anything.We weren't rushed and the staff were happy for us to linger as long as we wanted, topping up our coffee without having to be prompted. Overall we thorougly enjoyed our stay at the Sir Stamford and will be making this our hotel of choice when visiting Sydney. Also I was pleased to see that the hotel proudly displays its Tripadvisor award in the lobby. The Sir Stamford far outclasses the larger well known five star hotels in the same area. Well done!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: ADELAIDE_PHIL_A
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, despite a pretty grumpy check in person, the rest of the staff we encountered could not have been more helpful especially the concierge team. We had 3 rooms in the group on different sides of the hotel. We all found the road noise to be particularly bad. I understand the hotel is in the centre of a big city, but for the price charged similar standard hotels have much better noise reduction in the rooms. If you are a heavy sleeper, no problem, if not, then I would advise trying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Sir Stamford is a haven of excellence in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on Sunday 19th February for our 40th wedding anniversary. The entire experience was outstanding. The hotel even laid on perfect weather for us! Our room was large, spotlessly clean and comfortable, with lovely views over Circular Quay. Being able to open the little French doors to enjoy a drink of sparkling wine (compliments of the hotel), was awesome. The proximity to so many iconic Sydney attractions such as the Art Gallery of NSW, the Botanic Gardens, Circular Quay,the Opera House, the Rocks and many historic buildings, was ideal. Our family joined us in The Bar for drinks before going out for dinner, and the service was excellent. On the Monday morning, breakfast in the dining room included fresh fruit, lovely smoked salmon, properly cooked eggs, and many other options. We were also given a generous parking allowance which well and truly exceeded the number of hours spent in the hotel. Our visit to the Sir Stamford was at the recommendation of our daughter and her partner, who have stayed on four occasions. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We will definitely be booking a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Robyn L
Reviews.Content: Excellent location when attending a function at the Opera House. Our standard room was excellent with a view over Circular Quay. Dinner at The Bar was excellent in value and taste. The decor is old world, calm and relaxing. We would certainly not hesitate to stay at Sir Stamford again and booking early ensures a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Pat0409
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel, great location and friendly service. Ideal for Opera House and Circular Quay ferries, and the city shops. Great restaurants around the hotel too. Rooms are immaculate and large, bathrooms huge. You will never be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: anna00747
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sir Stamford on a few occasions and it never disappoints. It is ideally located a stone's throw from Circular Quay, Ferries, trains, the opera house and many restaurants and bars. It does not strictly overlook the Quay so people expecting wonderful views from every room may be disappointed. It is reminiscent of a boutique european Hotel in both size and look, except that the bedrooms are much bigger than the European boutique Hotels i have visited. I loved the size of my room, the very comfortable bed, the pillows and sheets, the standard of cleanliness and their breakfast that in my opinion is fit for a king. They also have a fabulous afternoon tea with some of the most delicious cakes and sandwiches in the City. The reservations man whose name I cannot recall was very helpful and quick to confirm my booking. I found all their staff very attentive and gracious like the whole Hotel. I would highly recommend this Hotel to people who love fresh air (they have opening doors on to juliette balconies) who appreciate fine old fashioned service, and who want to be in a prime location. Sydney is expensive but I find that the Sir Stamford always has very competitive rates and offers much more in space and comfort than many other Sydney Hotels in this price range. During the week it seemed to me that this was very much a business hotel so the lovely pool area was devoid of people which was great. It was almost like having a private pool!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be More Helpful”
Reviews.Author: jeremys30
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney with half our luggage missing and Qantas not being any great help. The concierge, Keiron was brilliant, even offering to keep logging onto the website to keep us informed of any progress, and finally letting us know when they arrived. Great location, close to Opera House, Circular Quays and not too far from The Rocks and Harbour Bridge. Great size room and breakfast was delicious, they even opened up the restaurant for us 15 mins early on the Saturday so we could eat before going out on a trip. Now that's what I call service!!

Reviews.Title: “Old-world charm”
Reviews.Author: FlyingGirlLB
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. It has a very romantic, old-Europe feel to it. The concierge could not have been more friendly or helpful, any time of day or night, and they gave fabulous restaurant recommendations. Bed and pillows were soft and plush. Location is just perfect - right on a park and a block away from the Opera House. It felt like such a treat staying here, but it was actually not that expensive either. We stayed for 5 nights and did not want to leave. This hotel deserves every one of its great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Sydney if you're a tourist!”
Reviews.Author: joelsss44
Reviews.Content: The location simply cannot be beat! You are short walk from most of the major Sydney tourist attractions. For example, it is less than a 5 minute walk to: -Opera House -Botanical Gardens -Circular Quay train station and bus station (with a free bus that takes you most other places a tourist would want to go) -Circular Quay shops and restaurants -Ferry docks (for ferries to Manly, etc.) -The Rocks -- a district with excellent shops and restaurants And it is about a 10 minute walk to the Harbour Bridge if you want to walk across it to take pictures, go to the museum about the bridge, or climb to the top of the bridge (which I highly recommend). The bottom line is this: The Sir Stamford is in the best possible location for a tourist in Sydney! In addition, the hotel staff is extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating. We arrived at 9 AM, and they let us use the facilities to shower and change (from our long flight from Los Angeles) before our room was ready. The concierge desk was also very helpful. The hotel itself is SLIGHTLY worn. It was all in good condition, but it seemed lightly used. This did not detract from our stay at all, as it was clearly well maintained. Our biggest complaint was with the in-room internet. They purport to have wired and wireless access (for a fee) in the room. I am a techie so I can almost always figure out hotel internet issues. Though my computer was technically connected to the internet, it operated at a snail's pace (for example, it took about 15 minutes for Google to load). I ended up calling the third-party internet help line, and, after 2 hours on the phone, the problem was NOT resolved. As I mentioned, I am a techie, so I simply could not believe that this problem could not be resolved. In any case, if you go to the lobby, there is free wifi and there are free internet terminals. Alternatively, walk across the street to the McDonalds at Circular Quay or go to the Circular Quay train station for free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel with First Class Service!”
Reviews.Author: SallBell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sir Stamford for two nights in October 2011 and it was a first rate experience. The hotel has an old world charm to it with lovely little nooks to sit and soak up the atmosphere. The rooms are furnished nicely with very large marble bathrooms and quite large a room overall. I ran a small event here as well which was the purpose of my visit and the meeting space and staff were fantastic. I would not hesitate to book here again. Also do yourself a favour and try the breakfast...amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely retreat in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: wimcee
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Sir Stamford on a quick trip to Sydney and loved the hotel. It was smaller than other places we have stayed in Sydney, with a wonderful spacious suite, and very personal service from all staff with whom we dealt. The location was perfect for us too - almost every thing that we had planned to do was in walking distance and obviously the ferries and train are all virtually on the doorstep at Circular Quay for further afield. We ate in The Bar one night, which was quiet and restful (like a Club), and had breakfast in the dining room each day which was also adequate without being earth-shattering as breakfasts go.

Reviews.Title: “If you like great location, quiet rooms and charm.......”
Reviews.Author: narellesinclair
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Sir Stamford Circular Quay and both visits have been ideal. At $320 a night, its not a budget hotel by any means, but as soon as you walk down the red carpet to the automatic doors, you feel that you have stepped into luxury, but old fashioned luxury. They have a bit of an English 18th century antique theme and is in a building that dates back to the 1800's. None of the cardboard walls you get in hotels of the 21st century! We stayed for 4 nights and had neighbours but I slept like a baby every night. The restaurant and bars are good too, nice food. The locations is fantastic though, very close to everything in the CBD and parks right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Edward D
Reviews.Content: We booked due to its great reviews. And we did find the hotel to meet and even exceed our expectations. What made the difference for us was the care and attention to detail by the porters and lobby staff. In particular there were 2 that stood out Dean and Stu: Short story, my wife and l had arrived early at 9am and check in was (of course) after noon, yet our bags were taken and secured for us. Then we mentioned casually that we had plans to go to Bondi Beach and got out our beach wear. What made it for us was the question: would you like some towels for the beach? Wow! Not on the hotel grounds plus the great consideration .... And they really came in handy otherwise we would have had to buy or be uncomfortable. Thank you gents!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional and Excellent in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Captainmommy
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay at the Sir Stamford and it was more than I hoped for or expected. It was like staying at a private English estate. The staff were warm and friendly and most helpful. The rooms were about the largest I have ever seen anywhere, and very well appointed and comfortable. This hotel was not cheap, but a good value considering the location, appointments, and breakfast was included for us as well. Location wise it could not have been better...5 minute walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House and directly across from the Botanic Gardens. I think it has the best Bar in Sydney, with beautiful original artwork and comfortable chairs and couches. I know I can't say what I paid, but it was in the neighborhood of what the Marriot, Sheraton etc. were charging, maybe even a little less...but then those hotels did not include breakfast either. Hard to understand how other reviewers think this place worn...it was full of antiques, but the rooms and bathrooms were all updated in the two rooms we had. I guess it is a matter of taste. I for one, would definately stay here again. It was a short trip for us, but staying here made the experience even more memorable than it would have been otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JojoT06
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for my mums birthday. We were so pleased with the location. It was 2 minutes walk from Circular Quay train station. It was also so close to all the attractions we wanted to go to. The room was a twin room which was a really good size and the bathroom was massive! We had two twin beds and both of us agreed we were very comfortable in them. It was very quiet considering how close we were to the traffic and trains. The room was very clean and we had a bit of a view over to the bridge but not much! We didn't eat at the hotel, but the bar was nice and again all staff were friendly. I would use this hotel again if staying in Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Just The Best”
Reviews.Author: 77Stag
Reviews.Content: Spent many a night here, each time always gets better. Always your welcome with open arms, nothing is a problem. The "Bar" is a must to spend time in. Art work is a must to view, every floor has something different. So close to transport and the central city..... Planing our next visit soon !!!! We call this " Our Special Place"

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with incredibly good service”
Reviews.Author: salvatoreolmo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty close to the city center. The service in both the hotel and the restaurant is excellent..

Reviews.Title: “USED to be the best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Citikitty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a shadow of its former self. I can remember staying here 5 years ago, and it was just lovely. Now, it's run like a 3-star with low care factor. The good things: having been Sydney's best hotel, the rooms are large and the bathrooms handsome; but the fittings and fixtures are worn and the rooms themselves are tired. But you can still see glimpses of grandeur in the sustaining hardware. The worst part about this place is the service. From the cursory and under-trained reception, to the breakfast room staffed by a man who looked like he should be taking the rubbish out the back with, wait for it, ripped trousers, this is where the decay shows most. I probably won't return here unless the price is so good that I can turn a blind eye to the hotel's many deficiencies; I just can't stand the hypocrisy of hotels that rely on former owners' style but deliver a poor product themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: VenusNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Wow, simply amazing is all I can say about this place!!! Right from the beginning from email contact to check-in, concierge, housekeeping everyone in this place was awesome. The customer service was simply exceptional from everyone & all the time and certainly the best service I've ever experienced! The room was gorgeous with a small balcony and a small view of the opera house and the botanic gardens right across the road. The bathroom was marbled and amazing. We had organised for canapes, champagne & chocolate dipped strawberries on arrival and these were already waiting in our room for us. It was simply just a perfect place, perfect location with perfect staff. I'd love to return but the only downside is it's too expensive for us in the peak season but we can't wait to return in autumn & spring later this year! I wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem”
Reviews.Author: JulesItaly
Reviews.Content: Best location near CQ, friendly concierge, lovely spacious rooms, decent breakfast all set in a historical building. This one is a definite repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lillystu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here July for a very special Birthday with my 2 sisters. It is an older style hotel - tucked away. It is gracious & grand & historic & - and the rooms - for a city hotel are large. The bathroom all lovely marble. The beds were comfortable. If you are looking for slick & modern - this is not for you. The best thing is the location - directly across from the botanical gardens, 1 min walk to Harbour Bridge, & Circular Quay & all city resturants. Excellent value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Sydney Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: ReflectiveTraveller
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel gem by accident, but now it will always be our preferred Sydney digs. The Sir Stamford offers old world elegance and a perfect location for visiting Sydney sights as it's a couple of minutes from Circular Quay, the main transport hub for ferries, trains and buses. A free city bus operates from here too. The rooms are very spacious. We'd recommend the third floor as the place to stay. The rooms come off a spacious foyer with lounges, tables etc. It's an ideal meeting place for friends and fellow travellers away from the busy reception area of the hotel. We entertained wedding guests and captured lovely pre-wedding photos in the delightful surrounds in March. It was a brilliant location for guests to catch the ferry across the Harbour to the wedding venue at Mosman. The pool offers a lovely escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. City lights and the views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge offer lasting memories of the city you are visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great Sydney location”
Reviews.Author: r0ckinn
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is in the perfect location to enjoy downtown Sydney by foot. Our deluxe room was large and beautiful and had a great balcony that overlooked the botanical gardens and had a view of the opera house! The gorgeous bathroom was all Carrara marble with double sinks, separate bath tub and large marble shower, and a separate room for the toilet. The common rooms were beautifully decorated with fine oriental rugs and other lovely furnishings. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. It was obvious that they are interested in their guests having a great experience, not only at their hotel, but in the city as well. The internet was complimentary in the lounge on the lobby floor - if you want it in your room, you must pay extra. The restaurant is fine but the food is not extraordinary. We would definitely return to this hotel when in Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 friends and myself were fortunate to complete our stay on the 30/31 Dec 11 and 1/1/12. The rooms were clean and the staff overall were pleasant and friendly. All requests were attending to with a smile. Our friends room was ready at 10 and they were more than happy to let us check-in. Unfortunately we weren't so lucky and were told they would contact us when it became available - we didn't receive a call but due to the time of our visit, new year and the size of our room when we did check in this was a minor detail.While we were there we experienced 'High Tea' general consensus 'best scones ever' and everything else was delightful - not cheap but a lovely special treat if you can afford a little spoiling! Breakfast although also 'not a bargin ' Sydney-circular quay - position - food - was also lovely. If I had any complaint at all about our stay it would probably be the staff in the breakfast room were not very friendly or helpful which was sad as this did not reflect all other areas of the fine establishment. Overall a wonderful experience and I would thoroughly recommend staying here and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: seaview088
Reviews.Content: Stamford hotels area world wide brand with an image associated with excellence in the hotel industry. Unfortunately this Stamford hotel lets the branding down badly. Arrived with my bags only to help the cab driver unload them myself. No concierge staff anywhere and eventually when it was obvious no one was appearing to help my partner and I took the bags in ourselves. The first thing I noticed was that the fittings, although quaint and old world are beginning to look worn with e carpet at reception frayed and tired. Our room was no where near a 5 star quality room. The furniture was frayed and worn and the wallpaper in the bathroom stained and lifting from the wall. The bed was comfortable enough but we were woken at about 8 the next morning by our room door being opened. Fortunately the security latch was across the door but there had been no knock - just a bang as the opening door was caught by the latch. When we were checking out we waited so long for the staff to collect our bags that we just ended up taking them down ourselves. We walked out the door and hailed our own cab. This lovely old hotel has so much potential but is very sadly in need of a makeover if it it is going to be a presence in the prestige hotels of Sydney. The duty managers need to really work on the staff service as well. The staff and the hotel itself need a lot of work.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB!”
Reviews.Author: Guy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sir Stamford for three nights over the New Years Eve period in December 2011.The location is fantastic being literally 150metres from the Opera House which allowed easy acess to the Harbour when all the roads and acess to the harbour side over the NYE period was restricted. Location apart the hotel itself is the epitome of good taste in terms of it's fabric and furnishings resembling a grand English country house. But it's greatest asset is it's staff who are just superb. From top to bottom (and we did meet the General manager briefly) the staff were just great. The incomprable Vickram,the concierge,was outstanding with his courtesy, advice and assistance and the front of house staff were always ready to help, all indicative of well trained and motivated staff. Our room was also well appointed and comfortable, well worth the premium Seasonal rates. If you wish to visit Sydney there's no better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place.”
Reviews.Author: Geoff P
Reviews.Content: Sir Stamford Circular Quay is a great hotel, in a very convenient place for the botanic gardens, harbour, opera house and cbd. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A charming boutique hotel excellently located !”
Reviews.Author: HarryEncinitas_CA
Reviews.Content: I hate all the glass, metal and plastic of the large chain hotels so i was delightfully surprised to find this charming hotel in probably the best location within Sydney ... near everything. The harbor and opera house views are a tad over-rated but the rooms are spacious, well-appointed and really quite luxurious. The breakfasts were delightful - and it seems at the going rate for most of Australia as we subsequently found out. Before settling in in the afternoon, we enjoyed the luncheon harbour cruise on Majistic Cruise lines ... and recommend the delightful 'al fresco' sitting on the prow of the boat - especially after a long flight in a stuffy airplane. The staff at the note - to the man and woman - were thoughtful and considerate ... allowing for some less than attentive service by our waitress during breakfast - an aberration to the general conduct of everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: fandm12
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one week during my visit to Sydney. The rooms are beautiful, clean and spacious. It is an elegant hotel-- love the Victorian bathtubs!! The beds are extremely comfortable and they have a pillow menu so you could choose which pillow suits you best! The staff is superb! So friendly. Since I stayed there for 7 days, the doormen and front desk staff knew us by our first names and were so friendly. The hotel is 5 minutes away from the Opera House and just in the heart of Sydney. It is off to the side so there are so rooms that give you a good view of the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and close to Opera House”
Reviews.Author: louluvslabs
Reviews.Content: Room 503 was awesome, large room, large full marble bathroom and big courtyard with views to the Overseas Passenger Terminal. Wish the weather was nicer so we could swim in the lovely pool and make use of the courtyard area. Within walking distance to the Opera House and the Quay. Only negative was we had to wait 15 mins for a table at breakfast, because they were so busy. Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place”
Reviews.Author: MikelSydney
Reviews.Content: I am a regular here. Ilove the olde world charm, the fire place cackling during colder months, the relaxed yet efficient staff who are so courteous yet helpful; the views over the gardens and harbor; the generous room sizes, and classic furnishings and so on. Ok.... Australia does not seem to be able to compete with five star hotel levels of say the USA or London, and the four seasons ic Cairo would look down it's nose at this place, but comparing apples with apples this is the best in town at the moment, The only aspect which is uniform with all five star hotels in Sydney is in room dining. Standard pub fare really at inflated prices, but Sydney hotels just have to be accepted s failing here

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: baliaricus
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Sir Stamford, Circular Quay and I must say we were very impressed. The room was lovely and the breakfast excellent. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and I we loved the location. We both prefer small boutique hotels so the Sir Stamford was perfect for us. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Yet to have a bad experience at this hotel! :D”
Reviews.Author: Chrisch79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times, and this hotel never fails to exceed one's expectations. The food is always lovely (both room service and at the restaurant), and the staff are very friendly and welcoming. I always find the concierge staff to be fantastic - they go out of their way to help you, even when you don't request it. As an example, the staff knew from a previous conversation that I was planning to walk to the opera house for a show that afternoon, and when I was on my way out, they informed me that although the weather looked clear now, the forecast showed rain later in the afternoon, and suggested that I borrow one of the hotel umbrellas. Sure enough, after the performance had concluded it was pouring quite heavily - I returned to the hotel completely dry thanks to the concierge staff! :) As a Senators Club member, I am entitled to a complimentary late check-out where hotel capacity allows, and this was requested on check-in (on presentation of the membership card). The staff member originally tried to charge me for this, however the other receptionist quickly said that it was "free for him (me)". Unfortunately, the staff must have then forgotten to enter the request into the system, as we received a call the next day (at the standard check-out time) asking why we had not yet checked out, and asking when they could expect us to leave (spoken much more politely of course). Eventually this was sorted out, however this isn't the first time that this has happened (and it has happened at other Stamford properties too), so perhaps better staff training across the various properties with regard to Senators Club benefits would prevent this from happening to other guests in the future. Also, staff in the restaurant should be remided that when a couple asks for one dessert item "to share", it is a request for the item to be served on one plate with two sets of cutlery as appropriate (we were only given one fork between the two of us, and had to specifically request a second one after ordering the item "to share"). All in all, the issues with check-out and the restaurant consumed all of 5 minutes during our multi-day stay, and the quality of this hotel (and the staff) still warrant an "excellent" rating. I look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: BattleOfBarnet
Reviews.Content: You could be at Circular Quay in 2 minutes from the hotel. Location was excellent. Room were good but nothing special. We had an Exec. room on top floor which had a reasonable view but would have been better if the window had opened as the room had a small balcony. Wifi area should be extended. Swimming pool was great. Gym was great - one of the best we had seen recently.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Mattred74
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was perfect for us to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We had a celebration package from the hotels website which included High Tea and breakfast in the dining room. Both meals were fantastic. Our room was large, clean, well appointed and very comfortable. The king size bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms very clean. All of the staff were welcoming, helpful and friendly. The hotel has its own bar that is well stocked and provides a nice quiet place for a drink. The hotel is located perfectly in Sydney. It is easy walking distance to the Rocks, across the road from the Botanical Gardens and there was no street noise on a Saturday night. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoDavids
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just the perfect place to stay in Sydney. The staff, cleanliness, location and rooms were excellent and we could not fault this hotel. After spending three weeks staying with family, we were looking for an hotel where we could relax during our last 4 days in Sydney. The location was right beside Circular Quay, SOH, botanical gardens, and access to the Harbour Bridge via the pedestrian walkway on Cahill Expressway. We stayed in room 1016, which had great views of the Botanical Gardens and we could just see the Opera House. The rooms were clean, spacious and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The pool was a bit on the small size but nicely heated, so you could watch the world go by. Unlike a lot of hotels, there was no over the top fussing, which can be a bit over powering. The staff were extremely polite and reception organised an extension to our checkout so we could enjoy our last morning and freshen up, prior to our flight back to UK. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kay036
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a tour around AU and NZ and this was one of the best hotels we stayed at. The location couldn't be better, the rooms were large and well appointed, bathrooms were large with both a tub and shower stall, closets had plenty of hangers, staff was pleasant and helpful, including the concierge! Our buffet breakfast was included and had plenty of choices for everyone. Some of our group tried the restaurant for dinner and said the food was good and prices reasonable. Everything seemed within walking distance - the opera, the cathedral, ferries, shopping and loads of restaurants. The hotel is right accross from the botanical gardens though you have to walk a block or so to cross over the avenue.

Reviews.Title: “awesome everything”
Reviews.Author: quinnment
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is fantastic! The rooms are beautiful, warm & peaceful, yet pleanty of space. Staff were friendly, attentive, knowledgable, and nothing was too much trouble. Location is great, restaurant is first class, from dinner to breakfast to the bar & high tea! If you want a few days in Sydney & would like to feel special, stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look anywhere else in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: welshwizardCanberra
Reviews.Content: My lovely lady and I return to this hotel twice a year for a time of resite from the mad world so we basically know what to expect. However this place continues to surprise us with the extra touches. I lifted on ecase out of the taxi and by the time I turned around to get the second the porter was there to help. Check in with Marty was seamless and he even made sure we had the room we liked - 10th floor looking at the Harbour Bridge. His welcome smile and good humour set the tone for the stay. The room big, welcoming, clean and ready for us. We bathed and then made our way to theBar for a coffee. Relaxing ambience you probably would be hard pressed to find anywhere else in Sydney and great coffee. Try The Bar at around 6.00 pm when the two bar men are outstanding. Nothing is too much trouble for them and the service is quick and effortless. Well done guys. While we were there the General manager came to speak with us to make sure we werehappy with our room, arrangements etc. - what other hotel GM would do that? After dinner out a night cap and then to bed to sleep a very peaceful sleep in the huge bed. A nice touch was a birthday card and a cheese plate for my gorgeous girl. Thank you . We did not eat at the hotel but we know from experience that the food in the dining room is very good. We have breakfast at Circulr Quay to watch the world rushing to work. The weather was against us to use the pool but we have in the past and it is relaxing with the sounds of the city all around. We walked up and down the hill to Circular Quary several times, me at 67 and my lady in high heels so no problem. Trains, buses, ferries to everywhere. A taxi to the airport is about $35 I am surprised that this hotel is currently rated at 10 in Sydney - it is far better than that. Go and visit and see the old world charm instead of the glass, concrete, rush you get elesewhere. Higjly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, close to Opera House and Circular quay”
Reviews.Author: caz1950
Reviews.Content: Everything about our three night stay at this hotel was excellent. Reception and particularly the Concierge, were very helpful, friendly and courteous. The location is marvellous with just a short walk to the Sydney Opera House and Circular Quay with its many quayside excellent restaurants. Our room was very nice with views over both the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, which of course included views over Sydney Harbour. One of the best things about the hotel room is how quiet it was, despite being almost adjacent to the Cahill Expressway which we have found very noisy all night long in other hotels. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: DeanandJakki
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location this is, you feel at home as soon as you walk through the door. The staff are great, the room was excellent and although not ready when we arrived (we got there at 07:30) we were given access to showers and able to freshen up before we hit the sites. The atmosphere and ambience is akin to being at home, so relaxing and informal, yet with style and grandeur. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will certainly be going back. It is great value for money and although more expensive than some of the "pack them in, chuck them out" hotels in Sydney it is such a wonderful place it fits the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: pj1290
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better. The staff were helpful and friendly. The room was spectacular. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ermione81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our 23-days trip around Australia. Both the first two and second two nights were great! The staff is very helpful. both times we were assisted by this guy Vekram i think was his name. Very nice and quick! the rooms were very good. the first was bigger but the second too was spacious. the best part is breakfast. The continental type costs 25AUD$ but it is worth every penny! you have very good fruit cereals and bread to toast. milk tea and coffee. and everything is of superb quality. really a good place. The location is very good as well. it is close to circular quay station. from the airport we took the train to get there since it's cheaper (15AUD$ per person) and above all quicker (17 minuter from internatinal terminal) than a taxi and the stop is really close, although there is a bit of a steep uphill street before you arrive at the hotel but it's really just a five minutes walk. The 555 bus (the CBD free shuttle bus in sydney) stops just around the corner of macquaire street and takes you to the shopping district of queen victoria building, the strands etc.. The opera house is five minutes walk and the royal garden are just in front of you when you walk out of the door. we had a view on them in our first room. we never dined there but they have a restaurant as well as an afternoon tea (around 50AUD$). we were very satisfied with hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Secone to None!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: titibalou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sir Stamford in May 2010 (although travel date in review says 12/10). Hotel is expensive, but I got an amazing deal (~$110/night) that I couldnâ€™t pass up. This hotel is really nice (former Ritz Carlton), and the quality has not declined since. The quality of this hotel is surpassed by its location: across the street from the Royal Botanical Gardens, 2 blocks from Sydney Opera House, and 1 block from Circular Quay. What more could you ask for (OK, not in Darling Harbor or other districts)! After a 15 hour flight from LAX (including a 2 hour unscheduled fuel stop in Brisbane), and 8 hours originating from Washington DC, I hopped on the metro at Sydney International which quickly took me (~30 minutes) to the Quay, and 1 block further (literally), voila! My room was not ready yet (I was early), and I suppose I looked worse than I felt because the staff tactfully suggested I go to the spa and â€˜freshenâ€™ up. So I did. Overall, excellent hotel and staff, and I highly recommend it (canâ€™t wait to go back). Shop around for prices; when I was searching, rates were $250 a night and up. And then one day I saw it advertised for $110. Again, shop around. The pros: Amazing amazing amazing location!!!! Canâ€™t say enough. 180 seconds from metro, 180 seconds from Sydney Opera House, across the street from botanical gardens! Spotless hotel, attentive staff, nice bar, nice restaurant. Cons (nobody is perfect): Hotel restaurant is a little expensive; then again, so is Sydney. Some might find this hotel to be a little â€˜stuffyâ€™. If you like classical dÃ©cor, are low key, â€˜old moneyâ€™â€¦ then youâ€™re at home. If you like flashy districts, go to places to be seen, like modern decor, party atmosphereâ€¦ then this hotel isnâ€™t for you. Recommendations: Go to the gardens across the street. One word of caution though: giant golden orb spiders everywhere! I lived in Africa and forgot about those guys. Theyâ€™re huge (by US standards); some reach 5â€� in diameter, but theyâ€™re totally harmless. They have this nasty habit of spinning webs where people walk, so watch where you go and donâ€™t freak out if you look above you and 6â€� above is a 5â€� spider! Also, Sydney has a healthy indigenous population of lethal funnel-web spiders. They are very dangerous, but I never saw one, so donâ€™t believe the hype about those nasty critters. Alsoâ€¦ Donâ€™t pay for internet! Go to McDonalds (3 minute walk away) for free internet; or any other McDonalds. Go to Fortune of War pub; Sydneyâ€™s oldest pub. Not tacky at all; in fact, when you walk in you feel like youâ€™re in a Cheers episode. Australians love their alcohol, and this bar is fun and wonâ€™t let you down :) Do the touristy local attractions stuff (Sydney tower, Manly beach, Bondi beachâ€¦). Visit the country side. I didnâ€™t have much time, but I did a day-long winery tour. Was fun! Check out the aquarium in Darling Harbor. Do hop on/hop off tour of area. Eat Croc and Roo! As a foodie, here are my thoughts regarding restaurants there: I love sushi, but Iâ€™d skip sushi restaurants in Sydney. Yes, theyâ€™re good, but theyâ€™re no different than your US sushi restaurants. BUT-Sydney has amazing seafood and really good Chinese restaurants, so research what you want and go for. On one particular day, I had a really good meal in a Chinese restaurant for lunch. Then an hour later I saw this amazing Chinese seafood restaurant. No and food, together, are not in my vocabulary. They have a whole wall filled with aquariums with exotic seafood. I had shark fin soup, fresh steamed abalone on the half shell with ginger and lemon grass, and other yummy stuff. Also, the west side of Sydney Cove has really nice restaurants (http://darksite.docksidesydney.com/). I canâ€™t remember the one I went to, but definitively go there one evening for dinner. Not that expensive, and I highly recommend the Kangaroo and crocodile (no, they donâ€™t taste like chicken). Parting thoughts: I canâ€™t recommend hotel enough! Also, Sydney is a very expensive town (even by Washington DC standards), so plan ahead. The city has many many fabulous restaurants; some are really amazing, some are not, some are really expensive, some are not. Have a great time in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Only localization and some furniture”
Reviews.Author: EUROPEU
Reviews.Content: This moment I am still in Sir Stamford in my 5 th. day of stay. The hotel is located in a old but well mantained building in a terrific and wonderful place, just a 5 minutes walking till Circular Quay and from there to Darling Harbour or Zoo and in a 30 minutes slow walk we have St. Mary or St. Andrew Cathedrals , City Toer, Town Hall, Chinatown, e4tc All the ambiance is good, the rooms are big and with beautiful furniture. The breakfast is too poor for a 5 star hotel and for the price. Housekeeping in rooms is very bad, overall the bathroom more than once was badly washed and that was very visible in sanitary. Staff is polite but nothing more. Without interes to solve problems or to be helpfull. I had a flight booked with Quantas when the planes of this company were grounded and as foreigner and with some dificulties to phone and find the better solution for my trip I asked to staff suport but that suport in practical terms was inexistent. I was obliged to rent net in hotel and buy other plane ticket in other company and only after the purchase I have known that Jet Star granted discount to Quantas passangers. This , I think the hotel must inform their guests about the situation. Poor service.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harlin70
Reviews.Content: We took a suite for a weekend deal. The hotel is right near circular quay. Beautiful French furniture throughout. Our suite was lovely and very clean. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: NewmansBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We had booked a superior room with a king size bed online three months prior to our overnight stay and received email confirmation of these arrangements. However, when we checked in and went to our room on the 6th floor we had been allocated a room with two double beds. When I contacted the front desk to express my disappointment I was told that there were no rooms available with king size beds and that this was not guaranteed, even though I had written proof to the contrary. When I pressed the issue, miraculously a superior room with a king size bed became available on the 2nd floor with a view of the building next door. The upshot was that we elected to remain in the 6th floor room, which at least had a view of the botanic gardens, and sleep separately, even though we were on a couples trip to celebrate my birthday. When we returned to the room we were contacted by the front desk Manager and offered complementary breakfasts for the inconvenience, which went some way to appeasing our disappointment. The room itself was large and well appointed and the marble bathroom was stunning. The down side was the airconditioning rattled when placed on high which seemed to be the only setting that you could feel the airconditioning working. Therefore, it couldn't be left on the high setting to sleep. Overall we found the staff respectful and helpful even when we expressed strongly our dissatisfaction. We also liked the fact that they had a business centre with free computer and internet access which assisted with our web check-in for our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent- Worth every penny!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaramati
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to Sir Stamford to celebrate his birthday and I am so glad I chose this hotel!! Our room was absolutely amazing, huge in size, gorgeous views, and stunning old English style dÃ©cor however I will make a point that I am pretty sure we were upgraded from what I originally booked (and very very thankful for it!) We were also greeted in our room shortly after arriving with a birthday card and happy birthday wished from the staff member with a complimentary bottle of wine. I had previously rang to organise a card but did not expect the personal delivery nor the accompanying wine (again thank you so much to the hotel for making this occasion even more special!) The hotel itself its also beautifully old English themed, making it look very posh. The staff were very professional and always seem to be at the entrance ready to assist or simply welcome you back. The location is great, being right opposite part of the botanical gardens and a tiny 2 minute stroll to circular quay (opera house). The pool was small but that suited the intimate roof top location of it. room service was always very timely and tasted lovely. It was expensive but exactly what you would expect to pay for where you were so not overly priced. Bed were also amazingly comfy and soft! Loved every minute of it and definitely recommend for any romantic getaway or luxury holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, gorgeous building, right in the heart of Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: Hollydaze4
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay this week and could not fault the hotel on anything. Luxurious surroundings, fantastic service, great welcome and a wonderful send off. As an example of the excellent service, on our last day we checked out and left our bags for a couple of hours while we went for a last walk around the Opera House. On our return we were a bit tired and hot. Vikram, one of the staff, immediately saw this and took us into the lobby, sat us down, got us some iced water and said to relax while he organised our bags and a taxi. Taxi came, Vikram got our cases and loaded them up then opened the doors for us, made sure we were comfortable inside and wished us well on our journey. He was just one of the many wonderful staff on duty. He anticipated our needs and gave us all we needed without us having to request it. We didn't dine there, but did have a nightcap on a couple of occasions in The Bar. This is a beautiful, sophisticated space with great atmosphere, a hearty welcome and great staff. I now love this hotel and I hope that our first visit there is not our last! Oh and also, its just a few steps from Circular Quay and across the street from the Botanic Gardens. It is older and more gracious in style than many hotels and they made this a real plus. Bravo Sir Stamford - we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff are the key at Sir Stamford”
Reviews.Author: Adzaway
Reviews.Content: Had a brief 2 night weekend stay while attending a seminar on site...Sir Stamford ticked all the boxes. The decor is (what many have peviously described) - you'll either love it or tolerate it. Get over this detail and appreciate the professional staff, I couldn't fault them. Location couldn't be better, out the door, round the corner and you're at Circular Quay within minutes. Had a look at the gym (on the way to the pool), it seemed to have the standard equipment - if you're that way inclined. Don't expect to do laps in the pool - it's small, it's shallow - but it was OK for an early morning "wake me up" dip. I tried lunch in the bar - was OK. Breakfast seemed very dear, I took a walk around the corner. I'll not hesitate in staying here again - for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: naniksik
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and charming. It is an older hotel, but it is clean and the staff were very helpful. We stayed two nights and used a shuttle service for transportation to the hotel. It cost $14 per person each way. We bought our ticket in the airport. The location is perfect. As others have said, we walked to the Opera House, the Harbor and took a ferry to Manly. We walked through the Royal Botanic Gardens that are right across the street. We took a city tour on the Hop On, Hop Off bus and we didn't see any hotel that we would have preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MichelinStarred
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford Circular Quay has an excellent location just minutes from the opera house and Circular Quay and right across from the Botanical Gardens. While minutes away from all the excitement, it is relatively quiet and peaceful without throngs of tourists crowding it. The decor is old world royal with lots of gold and velvet but it's charming. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms well appointed. The staff means well, but doesn't always seem like they know what's going on. For some reason they thought we had two rooms reserved and had the wrong check out date. But after a few minutes confusion it was all figured out. And they did leave us a nice bottle of sparkling wine for our honeymoon. The infinity pool on the roof was gorgeous though weather permitted us from using it. Also while we were there, a wedding was being hosted in the hotel. We never heard any noise from the celebration nor were overwhelmed with people. My only complaint was the cost of breakfast. While most hotels charge ridiculous amounts; I was a bit shocked at the bill for $70 for two people for what amounted to scrambled eggs and sausages. I would definitely stay there again mainly for the incredible location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay but Great Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Flezzle
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and seeing all the high rankings given to the Stamford, my partner and I decided to book a 3 night stay for our weekend-away to Sydney and were extremely excited about our trip. However, it is unlikely that we would visit the Stamford again. First, we pre-requested a King Bed and we entered the room to find 2 doubles much to our dismay. We advised front desk, and the representative advised us that this was subject to availability. While this is a valid point and we could have accepted this if she had offered to check if there were any available King rooms for the next 2 nights, she instead told us there was nothing she could do, with an attitude that screamed "So Deal With It". Dejected, we went back up to the room, and upon discussion, we decided to follow up the matter and requested a search for available beds, and it was only then that they confirmed that they could move us to a King bed for the next 2 nights. I would now disclaimer that after this incident, the next list of cons may be extremely nit-picky. Please take my petty list with a grain of salt. The CONS - The shower in the first room was also not cleaned properly, and there was still facial scrub still smeared on the walls. The ice machine was broken on our level. We sought to order an "On-Demand" movie and the feature was not working for our TV - however we must commend the staff on their great efforts to try to fix this and troubleshoot it with the tech support people (but could not be resolved). Room-service food was average for the quality of the hotel (though the wedges were awesome). I booked the hotel (female) - but all documentation stated "Mr" and staff kept addressing my partner as me (I have a unisex name). The PROS - Apart from the original front desk representative, the staff were very helpful and friendly (particularly the Scottish frontdesk manager), huge rooms, the beds were extremely comfortable, the bathrooms were impressive and the location to Circular Quay and the Rocks was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SteveS14
Reviews.Content: Stumble to the world famous Opera House, or stroll to Circular Quay and catch a ferry to manly, or hit the many nightspots around the Rocks..this is a perfect location in a stylish older hotel that is as comfortable as your favourite coat! Clean rooms, super courteous staff that meet you on the road and take care of your luggage. A terrific bar, more like a gentlemen's club with comfy seats and try to stump the barman with cocktail requests. Classy and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and very handy location”
Reviews.Author: Mazla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is different to the shiny new ones but is a pleasant change. 5 mins walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House. Very easy to catch a train from the airport for only $15 rather than a taxi for $50. Rooms are large and comfortable. Breakfast good and room service great! Very friendly and helpful staff. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my style but very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramblinAmerican
Reviews.Content: When I was in Sydney last time I stayed at the Park Hyatt, but since they were undergoing renovations I decided to stay at the Sir Stamford, mainly because of the reviews on Trip Advisor. While I do think it was a lovely hotel, it was a bit reserved for my style and they seem to service an older, more opulent clientele than Iâ€™m used to hanging with. A couple of times I almost expected some of the guests to tell me to fetch their bags, which of course says far more about the guests than the staff. The staff were very helpful and friendly and were very quick to resolve the few problems I had with my room. The first problem was the safe was not working and so even after a change of batteries they had to send the electrician up to fix the safe, after that it worked fine but again these things happen. The other problem with the room was on the first night when I came back to the hotel the electronic key slot seemed to have gotten loose and wouldnâ€™t let me into the room. At first the staff member who was helping me assumed it was my mistake (I had, had a few beers so I canâ€™t really blame him) but once he realized it was actually the door problem and not a buzzed guest he called the electrician and had it fixed immediately. This is a very nice hotel but I am just not classy enough to feel comfortable staying in a place like this. I believe the next time Iâ€™m in Sydney Iâ€™ll probably head on back to the Park Hyatt which is more my style. But if I did want to do a romantic get away weekend I would probably choose the Sir Stamford, but not if I were traveling alone. Also, they had an excellent club sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for touring”
Reviews.Author: KMJS3
