Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Sir Stamford Circular Quay. Arrived at 8:30 am and they let us have our room with no extra charge. Fantastic to freshen up after a long flight from the US. Hint - consider getting a Sydney multipass ticket, which provides unlimited rides on Sydney transport ferries, trains, and buses. Being near Circular Quay it's easy to hop on a ferry to Darling Harbor, Manley, the zoo, etc. Fantastic views without booking a water based tour and free WiFi on the top deck.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic five star experience.”
Reviews.Author: HappiestTraveller
Reviews.Content: I found my accomodation on Wotif.com and wasn't really sure what to expect as it was very well priced. The Sir Stamford was a great place to stay. Location - was fantastic just a short walk down to the cafes/restaurants at Circular Quay, with awesome views of the Bridge and Luna Park, but even better the Opera House on your doorstep (go for a walk around in the evening - it's very special). The room was spacious and very comfortable - great beds and pillows. And the staff were always polite and very helpful. It was a lovely place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, beautiful room, delicious food.”
Reviews.Author: mformanda
Reviews.Content: As a birthday treat my mum and I had a girls night at the Sir Stamford and Opera (La Boheme). The room was clean, very generous, simple in elegance and the beds were so comfortable (important for my mum who suffers from nasty arthritis). The food from room service was delicious and the breakfast was one of the best. The staff were friendly, prompt and professional. Compared with a larger hotel (i.e. Intercontinental) - you get top notch service and attention to detail. Will be returning and recommending!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: goingsomewheresoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my partner. Arrived early at midday and left my bags - reception offered to call me when my room was ready but it probably wouldn't be until after 2pm - no problem. Pleasantly surprised to get a call 30 mins later advising that our room was ready. Originally we were booked into a standard room - which we were delighted with - it's big, comfortable and has extra touches that you don't expect in a hotel and our luggage was waiting for us. Around 9pm on the first night, I spoke to Robert on reception about a private (awkward!) matter - he handled it very discreetly and professionally before offering to move us to another room - which we were happy to do. He then delivered our new rooms passes and helped with the luggage - we were surprised to find that he had upgraded us to an executive suite which was wonderful. The rest of our stay was uneventful. The room and bathroom was spotless, the toiletries are high quality (love the lemon verbena soap), room service was quick, hot and tasty. Staff were always pleasant to deal with and the location is excellent too. We look forward to staying at the Sir Stamford next time we visit Sydney, and will be recommending to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Charlotte
Reviews.Content: This hotel faces the park that becomes the Royal Botanic Gardens and is 1 block away from Circular Quay so it's close to a lot of the tourist attractions. I used to live in Sydney so I know the area well. This is a quieter part of the downtown area, with cafes and restaurants that cater to the workers from the Financial district, and to tourists. For a younger crowd, I'd recommend getting a hotel closer to George St which has all the pubs. The staff were very polite and helpful and the rooms were clean. The furniture in the rooms are a bit faded and the decor is old world. Internet access was expensive but there are many cafes in the area that have free Wifi. The walls are a bit thin - one night we could hear a baby in the next room crying but the clientele are generally more conservative and older so there wasn't much noise in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Grace and Charm”
Reviews.Author: Rushie08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay on a number of occasions (3 at last count and twice more for functions happening within the next 6 months). The staff go that extra step to make your stay memorable - on our last visit chocolates were brought to our room "With the Compliments of the Manager". Entering the SS is like walking back in time to when everything happened at a gentle pace, with grace and style,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bassprincess
Reviews.Content: Great location in Circular Quay! Quiet but blocks away from train and bus stops. Short 3 blocks to Sydney opera house makes it easy to see the shows. Quiet hotel with sturdy doors and lots of daily free newspapers. Internet acess is expensive 50 dollars a day! Buy the Virgin mobile wireless modem $50 for 4 Gb data! 247 Pitt Street a long 20 min walk but you get to see the CBD and Westfield mall. Lots of cheeper eating places a 5 min walk away from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: HolidayMice
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a very central location. Nice view of Botanic gardens. Service understated but very good. Spacious room and comfortable bed. Shower a disappointment - almost impossible to achieve consistent temperature and flow. No other concerns.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back for New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: KathleenJJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Sir Stamford last night for our visit to The Opera House to see "La Boheme". I cannot fault anything. Service was excellent, room on 10th floor was just lovely with breath taking views of the Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. We found the front desk staff very friendly and professional. I have travelled a lot and can honestly say your staff are top class. We had such a wonderful experience we have booked again for 3 nights Kathleen J

Reviews.Title: “Excellent traditional hotel in prime Circular Quay location.”
Reviews.Author: BostonQT
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights in a corner 1-br suite, and had a very comfortable stay. Service is excellent, and the staff is very professional and friendly -- concierges Vikram and Kiernan in particular were super-helpful, thanks! The hotel faces the Botanical Gardens and is 100 yards from Circular Quay. The hotel decor is traditional English, from the crackling fireplace in the wood-panelled lobby to the brocade and carved wood furniture in the clean sunny rooms. This is an excellent choice, particularly for visitors who seek old-fashioned charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, Rude Front office Manager.”
Reviews.Author: traveladdictlyns
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after Trip Advisor reviews, as part of our 6 weeks travelling around Australia/ holiday of a lifetime back in January 2011. I have been so busy but really wanted to write this review for quite some time. The hotel's location we thought was excellent, a 5 minute walk to Sydney Opera house and Circular Quay, and it is also great location for catching ferries over to Manly beach. The rooms are nice with lots of space and character, and the concierge staff were more than helpful, with plenty of great local knowledge. Our negative experience with the Front Desk Manager occurred after we had returned back to our room one afternoon after having spent thge day sighseeing. When we returned to our room we found a cockroach which was thankfully dead in our bathroom. Since we had no balcony attached to our room, we were confused as to how it had gotten into our bathroom. I called downstairs to reception to explain this, and they told me that they would ask the Front Desk Manager (Gabriel [--]) to come up to our room asap! After we had waited for 30 minutes, the Manager finally came to our room together with the Housekeeping Manager to investigatehe cockroach issue. The Front desk Manager was not at all apologetic, asking us, " Were we had been on Holiday before we arrived at the Sir Stampford?" Thus, giving us the implied impression that he felt that we had brought the cockroach into the room with us. We felt that he was very rude and very dismissive of the fact that we had a cockroach in our room and he also adopted a very patrionising attitude. Now I do travel alot, and would never have expected that type of response from someone who works in the hospitality industry as a Manager. The Front Desk Manager had however asked us to come and see him when we returned back to the hotel that evening to reesolve the cockroach issue. When we did return to thge hotel we asked for the Manager, but he lady on reception went away, came back and said that he was busy, but he had left us a voucher for 15 Aud for our inconvenience. We obviously felt that his compensatory offer was very derisory but were even more dissapointed by the fact that he didn't even have the decency to come and speak to us in person, which we obviously though was not a way to treat his guests. We were wanting to book the Hotel the following week after our trip to Fiji, but after the treatment of the Front Desk Manager we decided against this. Sydney was fantastic, and hopefully wish to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: M_Teacher_Traveller
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the hotel is really in a good location. It's just up the hill from Circular Quay (barely 10 minutes). From the quay, many places of interest are within walking distance, including Sydney Opera House, The Rocks and what's great is that the ferries depart to Manly Beach and Darling Harbor here. My husband and I decided to spend our honeymoon in Sydney and we started out at Blue Mountains which was beautiful! It was my turn to surprise my hubby for the city leg. To my dismay, there was no special treatment for honeymooners. I have specifically indicated that we were on our honeymoon in our hotel booking. It was clear, they may not have received the information because when we walked into the room, there was NOTHING! Not even a fruit basket, much less, a bottle of wine or rose petals on the bed. Therefore, I left an urgent message to the Hotel Manager. 2 days later, there was still NO RESPONSE. So, when I checked out, I told the Hotel Manager how disappointed I was. He informed me that they did not have our profile as honeymooners and asked if I mentioned this to the front desk receptionist when we checked in. Well, we did, and all the receptionist said was, "Congratulations!" So, clearly I'm disappointed because that was our one-and-only honeymoon and the hotel did dampen our mood. It didn't help that concierge sent us to a restaurant that was closed. He got the closing hour wrong so we had to spend on a pricey (80 AUD) meal at a nearby restaurant which we did not enjoy. Plus, don't order the breakfast. It's not worth the money. Even, our breakfast in bed was disappointing. Writing this makes me upset all over again at how horrid the honeymoon turned out to be. Luckily, my husband has a good sense of humour and we can laugh this experience off.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome back - service has returned.......”
Reviews.Author: Maracanz
Reviews.Content: In Sydney monthly for business and last time I stayed was a year ago and what a difference. Hotel was gleaming, fabulous girl on reception (sorry can't remember her name - recent graduate of Pims? college) very professional and helpful. Staff all great actually. Coffee great. Forgot how lovely and big the rooms are. Great sleep. Had to stay over a Saturday so invited a client and family with child (eeeekkkk) to high tea - my goodness what a treat - SUPERB!!!!!!!!!!!!! even gluten free for the picky wife. Everyone very impressed including me. Only improvements (if I had to be fussy) would be better reading light over bed and magnifying mirror in bathroom).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, old world luxury in the city”
Reviews.Author: YogaGirlAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sir Stamford over the weekend and had a fantastic time. It's superbly located close to Circular Quay, the Opera House, Botanic Gardens and Art Gallery - great for a morning walk or run! The service was excellent and the rooms very clean and generously proportioned - we stayed in a superior room and it was massive by Sydney standards. The buffet breakfast was fresh and had a good variety of healthy food options - and the dining room very pretty with sun streaming in during the morning. A great bar atmosphere in the hotel bar on the Friday night with a live piano player. One of the highlights for me was the open wood fire in the lobby - perfect tor a late night drink or while waiting for my husband to go out in the morning. The hotel is very traditional in style but beautifully kept. A little noise travelled into the room at night but nothing that was too troubling for me - even though I am a very light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and easy”
Reviews.Author: Tilly_May_Traveller
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great hotel near Circular Quay/Opera House, this is highly recommended. Room service was prompt and delicious, rooms tastefully furnished (homely), lovely harbour views, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: evking
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night in Executive Suite. Lovely room - 2 toilets, 2 tvs, comfy bed, very quiet. Breakfast was adequate but nothing special. Room service meal average. Staff friendly and efficient. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We did love Sir Stamford & we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: CharlieDylan
Reviews.Content: We arrived with leaking radiaror from the Hunter Valley. We were allowed to park the car in a convenient place so that the NRMA had easy access. The staff were so friendly, the room was very clean & comfortable & the breakfast delicious. Sir Stamford is an easy walk to the Opera House & the wonderful Sydney Harbour. Well done to the management & thank you for having us.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot for a Sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: Chricc
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel in suberb location. A short walk to the best part of Sydney, its harbour. I loved the old world ambiance combined with up to date facilities. The room was large and comfortable, great bathroom and I slept wonderfully well. The bar downstairs is a great place to hang out, with high tea a highlight. Friendly, helpful staff makes this a top spot and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: A block away from the iconic Sydney opera house, this old fashioned traditional hotel has a location that can't be beat. Spacious rooms with classic furniture and finishes. Service in the restaurant was a bit slow and breakfast was limited, so skip it and go down to the Quay. Liked the fireplace in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: Murofsua
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions for business - it's right in the heart of Sydney and so convenient. But this review is not for a business trip. On my visits I had noticed what Sir Stamford calls their "Romance and Seduction" package - bubbly, rose petals and such - I thought I would be perfect for my girlfriend's birthday. I wanted to be clear on the package and some special arrangements I wanted to make, so I called to speak to the hotel. It was after normal hours, but I ended up speaking to the Front Office Manager. Junio? - lovely guy anyway. He helped me book the package and make a booking for a limo to the Opera House. Ok, the Opera House is like a two minute walk, but the limo was for the girlfriend (honest). Checked in on the Friday night, had the hotel's Pre Opera Dinner special and headed off to the show. [Oh - one the way out noticed they had a great pianist/entertainer playing - but couldn't stay for that.] Saw our show at The Opera House, came back to our room with the scattered rose petals, chilled champagne and choc strawberries. Had a lovely night and morning - including breakfast in bed [well, breakfast is served to the room, we chose to eat it in bed :^) ] It was just the perfect stay - the hotel and their staff were faultless. (And I'm not just saying that because my girlfriend became my fiance that night too!)

Reviews.Title: “What a difference a decade makes.”
Reviews.Author: Lechiffre1
Reviews.Content: Some 13 years ago there was only one place to stay in Sydney that was 93 Macquarie then known as the Ritz Sydney. I stayed there regularly more than 30 times a Year. When it changed names about a decade ago so did the culture the nothing is too much trouble that I was accustomed too. It that was once a shining beacon to business travellers arriving Sydney is ordinary at best. I visited the hotel early July this Year for the first time in 5 years. To say I was disappointed would be like saying Alaska is cold in Winter. Everything is just slow and unprofessional. I have had better air-plane meals than the room service and generally speaking it felt like a Motel 6. The staff seemed out of their comfort zone and lacked coordination it was a fundamental problem throughout the hotel. The food was just ordinary service was lapsed and their was an arrogance that was not deserved. I told colleagues it was like the twilight zone. I understand that it is not a Ritz and that is not the measuring stick but how could a hotel fall so very far. The only positive was that I only endured 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - stayed in better 2 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: ARAC
Reviews.Content: We were shown to our room by the doorman/porter who was all smiles and hung around obviously wanting a tip. When we apologised and explained that as we'd only just landed we didn't have any change for a tip he left pretty sharpish without saying a word and didn't acknowledge us at any time for the rest of the time we stayed at the hotel. If he hadn't been so rude we'd have given him his tip the next day when we had change. The young porter we had the second time was much better. We did give him a tip but didn't feel under any pressure to do that and he was very gracious in accepting it. The room was small and there were damp patches on the wall and peeling wallpaper which is not what you expect from an allegedly 5-star hotel like that. The shower wasn't very good either but the bed and chairs were comfortable. It was supposed to have a harbour view and I suppose it did in so far as you could see a few square metres of a corner where some ferries turned round, but that was it! We did eat 2 evening meals at the restaurant, mainly because we had a discount voucher, but it was really good with friendly staff and I would recommend that. Basically, if we hadn't already made a non-refundable booking to stay in the hotel again at the end of our trip we wouldn't have stayed twice and we certainly wouldn't go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Our annual destination”
Reviews.Author: omega5
Reviews.Content: Every time I look for a place to stay in the city of Sydney, I am amazed at how far ahead of the pack this hotel is. The location is perfect for tourists and business travellers and the price is extremely reasonable. The quality of the hotel and furnishings are excellent and so it suits a romantic weekend as well. The building oozes quality and the staff are helpful, plus there's a pool with a lovely view.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMMatlin
Reviews.Content: If you want a 5 Star hotel with a personal feel in Sydney CBD, then this is the place for you! If you want a sleek, modern, marble foyer, glass tower and 1000 rooms - this is not the place to choose in Sydney. This hotel harks back to a previous era. Stayed in their first level of Suite (Executive Suite I think they call it), which was huge. Massive lounge, massive bedroom and amazing bathroom. The furnishings are 100% of an older style, but certainly not old! The lounge was full of beautiful, older style lounges, chairs and mahogany timber sideboards. I was certainly 100% happy with the environment and the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: lhreye
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fantastic. A wonderful outdoor heated pool and sun deck that overlooks the Sydney Harbour and Circular Quay is a must do for hotel residents. The restaurant offers excellent views of the Royal Botanic Gardens as you sip fine wine. This hotel is well located from the tourist attractions being just a 5 minute walk from the Sydney Opera House. This hotel is a lesson in history with a large private art collection and features antiques and wonderfully ornate crystal chandeliers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kanerva
Reviews.Content: Stayed almost a week at Sir Stamford. The hotel could not be better located. It's just a few steps away from Circular Quay and Opera House and the amazing view to the Harbour Bridge. All the ferries, busses, trains, free CAT-bus (#555) depart from there, the Rocks are within 5 minutes walking distance and shopping centers are easily reached either by walking or by the free buss. The hotel decor has old time grandeur. Fireplace warming the lobby on winter days. Service is excellent. Our room was 44 m2 with large bathroom (bath and shower separate) and own little balcony. Enough closet space, ironing facilities, coffee/tea, safe, minibar. There's a cute little heated pool on the roof + a gym. Internet is not free, but all the surrounding restaurants/cafes and even the ferries have free WiFi, so that was not a problem for us. I warmly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel AND the best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TXBoys
Reviews.Content: I was initially a bit concerned about the mixed reviews and prices that were a fair bit lower than other properties in Sydney, but couldn't beat the price on Orbitz, so we booked it. The place is amazing. We reserved a cityview room but were put in a harbour view. The room is immense and nicely appointed. The bathroom was gargantuan and all white marble and our little balcony looked east over the Botanical Gardens (we could also see the back of the opera house to the north). Public areas are very homey with an English Manor feel. It is a 2 minute walk to Circular Quay (where all the boats leave), the Opera House and Botanical Gardens. Also an easy 20-30 minute walk to Darlinghurst, Darling Harbour and Oxford Street.

Reviews.Title: “A high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: mary298516
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and had a "feel good" factor about it. It was in a good location. The room was nice and very clean and worked very well for us and our 5-year old. Ordered room service twice and service was prompt and food very good. Staff was extremely helpful. Have no hesitation to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but some room features beginning to look frayed around the edges”
Reviews.Author: paulbnz
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful 'old world' style hotel with tasteful decoration and furniture, including some nice antique or antique-style furnishings, great paintings and attractive wallpapers. The hotel is well positioned for getting to Circular Quay and the Botanic Gardens as well as a number of other attractions around Sydney. If you can get a high-level water-facing room you get great views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, etc. On this occasion I had a city-view room, which was fine but not as nice as the water-facing rooms I've had before. Overall though, the service was good and I enjoyed my stay. However, in my room some of the furniture was looking decidedly tired with scuffs and dents in some of the wooden furniture. Also, some of the light fittings were loose and some light bulbs not working. One wall plug was also loose. The buffet breakfast was adequate but could include more variety for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Sharnez
Reviews.Content: As my daughter is in University we visit sydney vey often and I have stayed in quite a few hotels and serviced apartments. Sir stamford is a cut above the rest. The decor in the room is in impeccable taste as are the very spacious bathrooms.The food is superlative and the staff are exceptionally friendly. We have going back again in october which is a testimony to the standards at Sir stamford

Reviews.Title: “Happy to stay here”
Reviews.Author: doogiehowser_md
Reviews.Content: Relocated here after ending up in a dive of a place. First time in Sydney, this hotel made up for it. Beautifully furnished, very classy. Good location. Great Breakfast. Will definately stay here again when in Sydney next.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well placed with a touch of old style grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Brinuk
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Sydney and looking for a good hotel within easy walking of Circular Quay then I would whole heartidly recomend the Sir Stamford. It is a very nice hotel, good rooms firendly staff, just across the road is the Botanical Gardens and about 200 yards from Circular Quay. The hotel is elegant with an old style grandeur, just what we were wanting.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming,Elegant, luxurious, cosy hotel on a Winters day”
Reviews.Author: Ozzietraveller5
Reviews.Content: We live in Sydney and normally stay at the Hilton, Sofitel, Jameson. However we have been disappointed in the impersonal treatment and experience of these big hotels, that seem to exude a lack of care and ownership with their transient staff. We loved our stay here and got a great deal for the night that included vallet parking and breakfast. The fire was so atmospheric in the lobby and we certainly felt at home. Check in was quick and welcoming, our room was on the 9th floor and had great views of the Botanical gardens and harbour. It was very spacious with a lounge, two toilets and big bedroom. We were reluctant to venture out on a cold rainy night as the hotel was so lovely. We had drinks in the bar, great Caprioskas and Caprihnas! Breakfast was sumptious and tasty. All in all a very pleasant experience aided with the friendly and helpful staff, contrasting so vividly with other hotels where the staff are either too oficious or too superior. We will be going back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Dark”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: Staff were very good and location was great but there it stops for me. My room was huge but very dark, in fact the whole hotel is pretty dim and faintly depressing. Some may call the place old world charm but it takes more than piping out classic music 24/7 in reception and a log fire to achieve this. For old world charm in this case, read tired and fading. I expect it was a lovely place once upon time, now it just feels like a fairly weary 3 star tourist hotel in a good location near the Quay and the botanic gardens. Didn't hate but didn't like it enough to return. And $25 for Wi-Fi connection is certainly old world but not charming.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, Location, but Not Much Else”
Reviews.Author: toolworker
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford is for travelers who prize elegance above other advantages and are willing to pay for it. We like location, view and value. It only had the first of these, so wasnâ€™t the best choice for us. We enjoyed the huge, comfortable (though dimly lit) room with large desk and plenty of chairs, and the sizable bathroom with two sinks and separate bathtub and shower stall. Itâ€™s not the most modern but not too far from it. The public spaces are small but elegant in classic style, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The location â€“ two blocks from ferries and Circular Quay â€“ is great, although the restaurants seem a bit pricier than in the more touristic The Rocks neighborhood nearby. We didnâ€™t like the street noise, considerable even in our 4th floor room facing Macquarie St., and not having a harbor view room (which, judging from the location, mightnâ€™t have been unobstructed even on the other side of the building). We skipped the buffet breakfast whose meager selection was dwarfed by the $35 price. (Get the full breakfast off the menu instead, for less than half that much.) After arriving, I checked out the Shangri-La, which offers a harbor view room with breakfast for less than the Sir Stamfordâ€™s standard room without. The Shangri-La is not too far from The Rocks, with more restaurant choices and still walkable to the ferries. If we hadnâ€™t prepaid as part of a package, we would have considered moving there. (P.S.: Not just for me, but if you find a review useful, please give a click. Some of us spend a lot of time doing these.)

Reviews.Title: “Just simply awesome - don't go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: welshwizardCanberra
Reviews.Content: My Lovely Lady and I spent two very happy days at Sir Stamford in mid-May. We are return guests having stayed here about 7 times before. Every visit has been special but this one was above all our experiences. It started off with a very welcoming greeting from Jennifer at Reception (with a trainee Catrina) who was a pleasure to deal with. We arrived at 9.30 am knowing that we could not check in until 3 but were told to check back at 1 pm. We left our cases and went off for a massage and lunch. Exactly on 1pm we returned and she was actually coding our door cards as we arrived. A very competent Concierge took us to a spectacular room on the 10th floor with every possible thing a hotel should supply. Then a surprise of a bottle of champagne for my ladys 60th birthday. Just that little extra touch which is greatly appreciated. We rested in the afternoon(early start that morning) then moved to the bar for drinks - an oasis in a mad world. Staff very caring but not obsequious. We did not eat in but we have done so before and the food was excellent. After dinner a night cap and so to bed to sleep the sleep of an innocent!. Thursday was much the same - sight seeing, lunch, rest, bar, night out and then another great sleep. Every time we entered or left we were greeted by someone. This hotel is located 5 minutes from a transport hub for buses ferries taxis and trains. You can get anywhere in New South Wales from here. You can come from the airport by train ($15) or taxi (about$40). Be aware that there is a short steep hill between the train station and the hotel - I am 67 and had no problem. This time we ate breakfast at Coco's opposite the station, and dinner at the Summit on the 47th floor a revolving restaurant, and Guilliames at the Opera House which is 5 mins walk away. The food at Sir Stamford is very good but after 7 visits we tried somewhere else. The hotel has many antiques so don't expect gleaming steel and bright lights. The ambiance is sensational. Again I say that the best part was the staff. Even the room maid told my lady how beautiful she was looking! You will be crazy to go to another hotel when this one offers so much. We are returning in Novembe.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Jaybly
Reviews.Content: WOW! This hotel was something special. Ok, it was not the cheapest, but as far as large hotels go this is the best we have stayed in. We booked the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and viewing the hotel website. We stayed in a fabulous room overlooking the Botanical Gardens with views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. We chose this area of Sydney as it was not right in the centre yet only five minutes walk to the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The staff were very attentive but not intrusive - nothing was too much trouble, we truly felt like valued guests. This stay was a stopover following our NZ trip. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were exceptional”
Reviews.Author: AndyNKath
Reviews.Content: This was my standout stay in Australia. The staff here went above and beyond for us. Wanting some good Indian food, we rang reception who then printed out a list of Indian restaurants for us in the area and then also let us know which ones would deliver if we wanted to eat in. Fantastic and unexpected. Really nice to have good service like this as it happens all to rarely. Rooms were really nice, clean and great location to explore Sydney from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great facilities, very helpful staff and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lilleabe
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here at the end of a 2 week stay in Australia. As a first timer to Sydney the location of the hotel could not have been more perfect. It was an easy (slightly uphill) walk from the station but absolutely perfect for the harbour, Opera House, Botanical gardens & the Rocks area. The open top sight seeing bus runs from a stop just 2-3 mins walk away. The hotel itself was elegant without being stuffy, the rooms were spacious and the bathroom huge. The staff on arrival could not have been more welcoming or helpful and knowing we had a limited time, they gave us great advice & help on where to go and what to see and even giving us timetables for the ferries. The roof top pool area was also a great place to relax for a couple of hours. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone doing a short break in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Sensational - Again!!”
Reviews.Author: flyaway01
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Sir Stamford Circular Quay previously and without hesitation booked this property again. The staff at this hotel, the facilities, rooms, decor and service provided are second to none!!! The room provided was huge - it very well appointed and offered a cosy and comfortable stay. After arriving late in the evening I was able to relax in the Lobby Bar where the staff were attentive and welcoming. Breakfast in the dining room was absolutely delicious and provided a wonderful variety of hot and cold dishes - the roasted tomatoes and scrambled eggs are to die for - seriously!!!! This hotel really knows how to look after its guests and the staff who work there are completely focused on going above and beyond in providing a professional and memorable experience for their guests. Highly Highly Recommended - again!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “1 yr wedding anniversary bliss”
Reviews.Author: nicko_jess
Reviews.Content: There's not one fault to be said of this fine boutique hotel, the location is stunning, the staff were very professional and helpful, and the room was very comfortable. We will be back same time next year, thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Easter special!”
Reviews.Author: Glynis031
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the last 10 days, for one night on each occasion, because the "Easter deal" included a king room, breakfast and valet parking for $260. With only one exception (more of that later), all staff were exceptionally pleasant and professional. Our room on each visit was spacious, well appointed and exceptionally quiet. On our first visit, we had a room service dinner, as I had arrived late, having flown straight through from Europe. The food was great, well priced, and delivered within a short time frame. The one downfall was the breakfast on our first visit, on a Saturday morning. We arrived at the breakfast room at 8.30 am and were asked to take a seat in the lobby as there were no tables available. After 10 minutes, we were ushered in to find tables so squashed together that it was almost impossible to walk around the buffet table. The staff were frantic and service was non-existent. The quality and variety of food were vastly inferior to the offerings at the Sheraton on the Park. When I asked about tea and coffee, I was gruffly directed to a table near the kitchen entry. The coffee and tea jugs were empty. Cereal bowls were not removed from our table. In fact, nothing was removed! Staff were quite obviously overwhelmed. I later heard a staff member at the check in counter mention that the hotel had been full the night before. Breakfast on our second visit was a vastly different experience, with excellent service, and well spaced tables. The variety of food, however, was not as one would expect from a 5 star establishment. I guess we would stay there again if they offered good deals because of the close proximity for performances at the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent way to unwind after a three week international trip”
Reviews.Author: Chrisch79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after returning to Australia from Europe, before returning home to Brisbane. The staff were all exceptionally polite, particularly those working in the concierge area. As I reserved the room over the phone, they offered me free breakfast in their restaurant the following morning, as well as complimentary parking should I be driving. The location is excellent - within walking distance from Circular Quay train station (the train directly from the airport takes about 20 minutes), and the Opera House is at the end of the street. In-room wi-fi, while a tab pricey, was very fast and was great after being overseas for so long with limited internet access. I had room service for dinner, and it was exceptionally tasty and quite reasonably priced - the portion size was also very generous.

Reviews.Title: “Specialllllll”
Reviews.Author: ozball
Reviews.Content: Sent my wife and Mother in Law to Sydney for a few days R & R at lodged them at the Sir Stamford in Circular Quay. The Hotel is ideally situated near the Opera House, Ferrie Terminals and public transport. The quality of the hotel was excellent with the staff being very professional in their dealing with them. I booked over the phone and added in a massage for them both which was arranged by the concierge. The were given early access to their room to freshen up befor embarking on a sightseeing trip. Their room weas clean and tidy and very comfortable and the decor of the hotel exceptional. We will be staying at the Sir Stamford when we visit Sydeny as a family.

Reviews.Title: “too short a stay”
Reviews.Author: injj27uk
Reviews.Content: lucky really we stayed here, almost didnt. one of only two hotels on our australian holiday that we wished we had arranged to stay longer, the location certainly made it easy to get to all the places we'd hoped to.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant start to the trip.”
Reviews.Author: BewleyK
Reviews.Content: We started our trip to Sydney here and we are glad we did. We had read the reviews and knew what we could expect so were delighted to have a large room on the top floor overlooking the Botanical Gardens. This meant we also overlooked the main road system but we didn't have any noise problems, maybe because we were on the top floor. We arrived early from the long haul flight to find the room wasn't ready (which we expected) but we used the showers in the gym and left our bags with the concierge after checking in. We spent the day walking around the city and came back around 4.30pm where the room was ready and the bags already waiting for us up there. The location of the hotel is brilliant. It's around the corner to circular quay, which is a great transport hub, and is minutes away from the Opera House. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as they were charging $35pp but around the corner, underneath the office blocks, there are a number of food courts and restaurants where there is plenty of choice. Having read the previous reviews before coming here we knew the decor would be dated but the decor in our room was in good condition. The bathroom was a bit dated but not tatty. The air con was noisy but we still managed to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok price for Sydney, needs updating. Until then, pay more, or less, to stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: traveller2007
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews here and was excited about my stay prior to meeting friends for travelling around the country. I was a bit disappointed with the general hotel greeting, on arrival tired from a long haul flight. Staff were helpful in that my room wasnt ready so gave me access to the fitness area in case I wanted a shower. My luggage was stored well and check in was smooth. A query about the mispricing of my reservation was quite helpfully, and in fairness I think the error was due to the e-booking system rather than the staff -although when I just wanted to log on to my email to find the correct reservation info to pass t them , I was told it would cost me $5 to use the business centre. Hmm...but as it was I didnt need to do so as the issue was resolved. But somehow overall. I had expected more. negatives: Didnt feel much pleasure in the staff, no feeling ot out-of the way of helpfulness. My first impressions of Sydney as a result were a bit negaitve and it was only aftr I had walked around and discovered people are quite nice beyond the hotel that I felt better. But maybe it was also my jetlag. However I did have a coffee at the Intercontinental next door..and what can I say? Sheer delight. Excellent staff, amazing courteous welcome, warm service. Same at the Shangri-La when I was lost and needed a map and directions. I know Sir Stamford costs less than they do, but not much less and I think for Sydney where it is all pricey I would pay more to get the extra " umph'". Room: The room was suppoed to have been ready at about 1pm, but I came back at about 5pm, and it had been assigned and my lugage taken up. The room itself was large with a small balcony but I had requested a harbour/gdns views and only got the view of trees/street (and the noise!) as was too low down for the former and too high up for the latter. I thought the hotel might have realised that..but anyway, no matter.\Overall it need soe updating - it just looked a bit tired out and instead of olde worlde charm it just felt like someone forget to modernise it in a city that is otherwise quite up to date. Lighting! - this was bad as someone else said - it took too long to swtich on every lamp and no over light made reading hard. Mini bar and others furniture was chipped. Some of the drawers felt *sticky* like they hadnt been cleaned properly. Clocks - both of the ones in the room had not been updated since whatever time change had taken place. 1 hr out. A poor oversight and a confusing one at a hotel when people are arriving from all across the world. Bathroom - THE worst of all YUK YUK YUK to the bath. There was no way I was getting into that dirty, marked, black bath much as I was desperate for a hot bath after my long haul flight.. I could NOT believe this was a top rated hotel and I was paying about 170 quid a night for it! I will attach photos after my trip. If it cant be cleaned than CHANGE THE BATH. It looks like it has had about 5 too many ears of people bathing in it, or else the cleaner isnt doing her job. Had I been paying 1/4 of the price I may have excused it but even then...it was soo offputing and didnt improve the second day. No Occitane products any more - shame. Lucky I had my own from my previous hotel visit in Asia where they do provide nice products. CLOSET - - the false celing of the clothing closet was broken and there were exposed wires - again I wll post photos, but it was pretty dangerous looking. By then I couldnt be bothered to complain or ask as was soo tired. RECEPTION e/switchboard - I rang to ask how much an itnernational call would be and they were unable to tell me. I asked at the front desk and it was the same. I know its not a business hote but i did expect some knowledge... I only stayed for 2 days in the end, as was meeting my friends early and was happy to move rather than stay the extra night. The hotel were very courteous about my changing my plans, so that was good. CHECKOUT- On the morning itself: I wasnt feeling well, had popped out to the shops to get somethings, came back and fell asleep. I woke up at 10.30 and was getting ready to check out when I thought I ought to double check if check out time was 11 or 12. I called reception at 10.50 asking if chck out was 12 or 11 and and they explained it was 11am. At 11.10 the phone rang - I missed it was was in the bathroom - but it was reception called me. I called them back to explain that I was on my way , down in 10 min.Now they knew I had called before asking the time, and then ahd called them back to explain I was coming down. But at 11.15 they had sent up the concierge to my room! ...as I opened my door to leave, he was there asking if I needed help. All rather ironic,font you think, in a hotel where the clocks arent even set to the right time? OVERALL - Maybe had I been older clientele Id have felt I was treated more respectfully. But as I am in my 30s I didnt.... As a single traveller d not need a double sink or huge room but had this....was it a less popular room? I felt rather shortchanged. I felt it was a pricey stay for what it was and it didnt have any warmth altough most of the staff were helpful. . I know Sydney is expensive but I wish I had either paid a bit more for the Shangri La or Intercontinental, the same price for the Westin (where I am staying next month when Im in Sydney again) or else not believed all these good reviews and stayed at a slightly cheaper hotel, although I know in Sydney thats it hard to find! It is a VERY pricey city to stay in. Overall, stay here for the excellent location (1 min walk to the Opera House and Gardens) but not for the service, quality of room, internet or phone facilities and definitely not if you want a soak in the bath!

Reviews.Title: “Great position near the quay, friendly staff & very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rastus66
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the hotel & found the staff to be friendly & professional. The ambience of the hotel is memorable & the room was large, quiet & comfortable. Proximity to circular quay & the rocks area made it very easy to access all the sights. We had a very enjoyable stay. Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- go for it if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: WoodyHerts
Reviews.Content: As per the previous comments the location is fantastic, The room was large and desk staff helpful. My main issue with the room was the terrible lighting- 4 separate lamps to turn on with very low watt bulbs - I needed a torch to find things in my bag after dark! I got a very good rate with ebookers for 5 nights and was happy being in the centre of things.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but”
Reviews.Author: WhiteSwan1111
Reviews.Content: In a fabulous postion without a doubt. Some lovely eateries close by but l did feel put off by an incident with one of the hotels staff. However the standard of the hotel and its position means l shall return. Take time to get out on the water!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: BrockleyKaz
Reviews.Content: Very good location, particulary to get to and from the airport on the train. Very large bathroom and good-sized room. Effective air-conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: yellows
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank everyone at the Sir Stamford for making the start of our holiday so perfect, we had 3 nights in Sydney as a stopover to New Zealand and staying at this hotel made sure we enjoyed every moment. We arrived at the hotel a 7am after flying for 26 hours, our room was not ready (as you would expect) but still we were provided with a room to shower and change and after this we felt refreshed and ready to explore. When we did check in later the room was lovely, the bed was so comfortable and all our luggage was in our room, this just sets you up for a great holiday. The hotel is in a perfect location just 1 minute walk to the ferry and a little further to the opera house but even so the hotel was very quiet for a city centre. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Location and Huge room”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBMWs
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from a 4 night stay at the Sir Stamford Circular Quay, booked on the internet directly on the hotel's web site and got a fantastic deal by booking and paying 60 days in advance. Travelled with my husband and 10 year old son, arrived very early Friday morning and although we couldn't get into our room (still occupied) we were offered a key to the gym where we could shower etc. Reception staff were warm and welcoming, our luggage was whisked away. We returned @ 11.30am and our room was all ready - brilliant. Two double beds with plenty of room for the three of us to walk around, very large bathroom with 2 sinks and separate toilet, separate shower and huge bath - no congestion trying to all get out in the mornings! That first afternoon after a little snooze we went down for High Tea - absolutely fantastic - really started our holiday with a bang! Sir Stamford is literally 3 mins walk from Circular Quay - perfect location. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “why charge for internet?”
Reviews.Author: rc24travel
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very good hotel in the Circular Quay area. The room and bathroom were spacious. Years ago it was standard to charge for internet, nowadays this is not the case. The Stamford does charge for internet. Would I stay here again? Likely not because of this issue.Tonight we're in our second accommodation since the Stamford, there are no charges for internet useage.

Reviews.Title: “Subtle elegance with a view...”
Reviews.Author: A53
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large enough to provide the full range of quality services but small enough to have a cosy feel. The service is unobtrusive but effective. I found the staff to be quite pleasant. The room I had was spacious and comfortable; and the view was simply sensational. The location places the traveller both very close to the main tourist drawcards (Circular Quay, the Harbour, The Rocks, the Opera House) and yet it is in the CBD, with walking-proximity to the legal and medical precincts in particular. It is very quiet, a quality I value. The Botanic Gardens are across the road (so the "dawn walk" is a great option). The gymnasium is fine and the outdoor pool, while small, is adequate. Parking is underneath and readily accessible; the parking rates are around $35 per day, which is reasonable for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SLLS021211
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Great rooms, friendly staff, couldn't ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for tourists”
Reviews.Author: travelh00
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here as the first stop on our 2.5 week trip to Australia. Most of the things I found annoying were actually consistently problematic in places we stayed throughout the country - expensive wifi, weak a/c, terrible tv - so I hesitate to ding Sir Stamford on those things and I will focus on the highlights: -- Very pleasant staff -- Free newspapers (nice to have to learn more about what is going on) -- Location, location, location While it might have been nice to get a feel for a more residential area in Sydney, this is the ultimate place to be for tourists with convenient access to the train and ferries. It was easy to take the train from the airport to the hotel and to explore other neighborhoods. We also took the ferries to Manly and Darling Harbor which was a great experience. One note for the hotel, if there is any way to add somewhere in the bathroom to stash toiletries I am sure it would be much appreciated. In a huge bathroom there was little counter space and no drawers.

Reviews.Title: “The best night ever!”
Reviews.Author: happyCanberra
Reviews.Content: We just had the most wonderful night, we celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary and had the Romance and Seduction package. Wow what a hotel, the staff were lovely, the food was excellent and the room was devine, they really went out of their way to make this a memorable occasion and we can't wait to find another excuse to do it all again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, charm, warmth, location make this a wonderful choice of hotels.”
Reviews.Author: willtjbeach
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and beatifully appointed. The fireplace, although not needed, added a real charm to the room. The bed was excellent with a good choice of pillows. We had a nice view of the botanical gardens across the street. The stafff was helpful and efficient. The hotel's location makes it very walkable to the gardens, the Opera House, the Circular Quay, and the Rocks. We had a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother to complain”
Reviews.Author: Roger9952
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have had several enjoyable stays at this hotel, but not this time !! The issue now so much the the terrible service we received in the restaurant, but more the fact that despite three separate written complaints to the hotel, WE HAVE BEEN COMPLETELY IGNORED. Our advice is that if you stay at the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay you may have an enjoyable stay, but if not, don't bother complaining because no one at the hotel actually cares about customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cliffw1
Reviews.Content: The location more than any other thing makes Sir Stamford an ideal place to stay in Sydney. Being so close to circular quay, the opera house, the botanical gardens etc makes you start off your day on a great note. Not sure about the quality of food there as we never had anything. Rooms were an excellent size with a really comfortable bed and the staff were always very nice. Had 5 days here in January, it was quite expensive but i would still stay here again as the location was so good... An added bonus was the small pool on the roof top which was a very nice way to relax after a busy days sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment but worth it if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Jordan1964
Reviews.Content: I stayed here late January 2011 and got a great deal through wotif.com.au for a suite. Whilst the suite was very large, it was in need of refurbishment with none of the "luxury" feel that you expect of a hotel of this reputation. My rooms overlooked a busy, and noisy, street. On the plus side, the staff were all very helpful and when I used room service it was extremely quick. However, the card-operated lifts were annoying - the left hand one only took cards intermittently meaning you had to go to the concierge to ask for the lift to be released for your floor. The main areas of the hotel had the feel of an old peoples home

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: MillyMolly6101
Reviews.Content: We visit Sydney often for work and usually chose stay in the standard business hotels. But in early Jan 2011 we visited Sydney for a friends wedding, so chose to stay at circular quay. We found the Sir Stamford to be an excellent hotel. We had a large, well appointed room. The linen was good quality and the room was beautifully presented. The staff were friendly and helpful. It is very well located to circular quay and the ferry terminals, and also the Opera house and a large range of cafes and restaurants. We will certainly be staying at the sir stamford on future visits!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Opera House and Harbour Bridge, with great service”
Reviews.Author: RoBertie
Reviews.Content: Sir Stamford is a block from the Sydney Opera House and across the street from the Royal Botanical Gardens in Circular Quay, which is a great location. The entire staff is friendly with a very knowledgeable and helpful concierge. It is in an older, historic building but the rooms are spacious and clean. The lobby and meeting areas are more English with a nice more formal bar. There is a rooftop pool and small workout room as well. Price was much better than others in this location of more recognizable brands. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, but wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: izzy83_11
Reviews.Content: Staff were all genuinely friendly and helpful, the location is excellent and beds and pillows are good. The rooms are a bit tired, as are the few machines in the gym and the photos of the swimming pool are seriously misleading (it's about half the size and a tad grim). If you need a travel adaptor, you have to pay $15 at the minibar (supplied free in every room in the hotel we came from) and to replace the small carton of milk for tea and coffee cost $4!! I've never before been in a hotel that charged for milk to make tea in your room.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a deal on hotel, don't expect to check in till 3pm!!!”
Reviews.Author: StewardessFl
Reviews.Content: Book through hotel website to get priority in getting first rooms available. We booked through a discount site and arrived at 8:30am. Were kindly told we'd get a room as soon as one came available, but as we read from other reviewers, that 's NOT the case. They kept giving us excuses each time we checked back with desk. Luckily, I'd read this situation on TA before booking, so we made plans to keep occupied till 3pm, but did check back just to see what they'd say. We did see others checking in ahead of us, several times. The opera house is right up the street. And there's a wonderful garden just across the street. It has lots of giant bats! (flying squirrels) You can easily kill several hours at this property, There's several exhibits and acres and acres of beauty. The hotel restaurant was empty, always, as the prices were crazy high. We did go for the Chocolate Implosion dessert someone wrote up. It was REALLY REALLY unique, but not the best tasting we'd ever had. They did dazzle us with their fruite/cheese/nut plate though. Introduced us to quince paste, popular in AU. It's like a solid honey (really a fruit). We found it in Whole Foods back home and serve it often, getting rave reviews. If you're coming back from a night opera show, the street is bleak with food options. But if you walk past hotel there's a Greek restaurant. Other than that, there's a jiffy store between hotel and opera house. Hotel is Very classy, and costumed doorman is over the top awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great old fashioned hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kirby319
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this hotel in any way. It is in the most perfect location in the city being close to Circular Quay, Opera House etc. We stayed on the 10th floor with fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. I would think that there are only a couple of floors high enough to enjoy these views so make sure you request a 10th floor room if one is available. The service here is first rate with the staff always being friendly and attentive without ever being intrusive. Would definitely stay here again for future stays in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 stars. Great concierges.”
Reviews.Author: foodsaurus
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford location cannot be beat. It's right in the heart of Circular Quay but set along a quiet street and across from gardens of which our room had a view. The best part were the two concierges we dealt with who were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not at Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: Harmes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not at Circular Quay but actually in Macquarie Street which leads to the Opera House so it is very central. I think the publicity says you have a view over the Sydney Harbour bridge but frankly we were on the 8th Floor and had to crane our necks to get even a partial view and it was only a small part. The hotel feels like a second tier hotel and in fact that is what it is. On our return trip we stayed at the Westin which was only fractionally more expensive and definitely at a higher level. Despite its location and status the hotel does have many plus points. As the room was delivered late we were upgraded and were given a lovely suite which had a decent sized living room and a bathroom which was genuinely made for two people with separate large sinks. The separate living room was handy as we were suffering from jet lag with a tendency to awake early in the morning. Service was excellent and the staff were very helpful. We found the prices of breakfasts and the bar exceptionally high and more expensive than the Westin but overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to be central but not in a large chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional values & service, outstanding accommodation and unbeatable location ... guess we liked it!”
Reviews.Author: samphireskipper
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three-night stopover at the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay en-route to New Zealand. Arriving exhausted from the UK at 7:30 a.m. we were greeted by the smiling face of Joey, the Head Concierge, who showed us to our magnificent room on the 10th floor with a sensational view of the Harbour Bridge & Opera House on one side and the Botanical Gardens on the other. The furnishings and fittings in our bedroom were of a very high standard, with the lobby area isolating us from any noise, ensuring that we slept well throughout our stay. Joey and the rest of the Concierge Team were extremely helpful, pleasant and professional throughout our stay and the service perfectly complemented the traditional, old-world style of the hotel. The location could not be improved upon for access to the all of the tourist attractions; we walked and used the ferries to go everywhere. The only issue I did not like was the hotelâ€™s policy of taking a 100 AUD â€˜depositâ€™ per night against meals, drinks, etc., but I guess that is a response to dishonest guests.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, old fashioned hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rachel_m29
Reviews.Content: The first obvious quality of this hotel is the location, at the historical Macquarie St, in front of the Botanical Gardens and only a few minutes away from the Opera and Circular Quay. It really is as good as it gets if you're a tourist in Sydney. There are also the large, elegant bedrooms and the beautiful common areas. And the beds are amazingly comfortable. But, better than these quite impressive qualities was the service, very attentive without being intrusive. The concierges were wonderful, especially Vickram (I hope this is how his name is spelled!). And the price wasn't as bad as the other hotels in the area, so I think it was a good value. The only bad thing that I can think of is the internet. There's no wifi in the rooms and the computers in the business center should be retired, in a museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MamaMD143
Reviews.Content: Location was amazing, the people were very friendly, and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDora
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly small and is very traditionally decorated - olde worlde style. The rooms and bathrooms are very spacious also. Front desk staff are very friendly and efficient. Biggest draw is location - perfect for the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Died and gone to heaven”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinBrighton
Reviews.Content: I decided to splurge and we were so happy we did. The staff were excellent and my wife was unwell on our arrival so I was happy we were able to get to our room earlier. I was not expecting also a room with a view of the harbour bridge and opera house. The room itself was excellent the bed was king size, a marble bathroom and all the mod cons. We ate at the bar as the restaurant was closed on Monday nights and had delicious food.We also used the pool. I would happily stay here again and being a short stroll to the Circular Quay and the Rocks its ideal, closer than any other hotel, I think to the opera house and across the road is the Botanic Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: honeylaw
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford is very well located across from the Botanical Gardens and a 5 -10 minute walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Rooms are large with couch and desk. Staff very friendly. We arrived at 7:00 a.m from Los Angeles, and they gave us our room early. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, preferring less expensive cafes in Circular Quay and the Rocks. From the airport we took the local train to Circular Quay (20 minutes) and then walked less than 10 minutes to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: 75sw
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sir Stamford based on location and review on TA...we weren't disappointed. Lovely entrance, lounge (very ornately decorated) and reception staff and located just by the botanical gardens and 3 mins walk from the Circular Quay train station which was perfect as we were arriving from the airport. Despite not claiming to be a hotel with a view of the Opera house etc, we were pleasantly surprised to see that our room (10th floor) had a view of some of the quay. Room was very nicely decorated although bathroom wasn't huge, it did have a shower/bath. I was ill one evening and the staff were great when my husband asked about room service and made some tomato soup for me especially. Room service was reasonably priced (for Sydney) and we also tried the bar which was actually quite nice. One of the highlights for me was the heated outdoor pool on the 5th floor. It's not huge but was lovely to be up there in the evening when it was dark as it is lit up with fairy lights and you see all the lights around you. Finally, to help the environment they offer you the chance to forego housekeeping for a day and in return offer you $5 (or maybe it was 10) off goods from the minibar which was a novel idea. Only negative was the fact that they charge for the use of the internet in the business centre, otherwise we really liked the hotel and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: GrahamA58
Reviews.Content: Sir Stamford has been going through a refit. The issue is their refit had failed to upgrade the sound proofing in the rooms above their function room. When all hell was breaking loose at a reception half a dozen complaints were to no avail to quell the din until after 11pm. It's a case of dollars ruling. A function returns many. A room rental less. Regardless I and my family paid for quiet stay. We got an unholy racket for hours and a similarly unpleasant night's sleep due to the stress induced.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, fantastic bar, Circular Quay around the corner.”
Reviews.Author: facg
Reviews.Content: Reception, concierge, bellhop were all very kind, courteous. Very fast check in and out. Classical English style. Nice bed. First night, after 23 hours flight, slept 16 hours non-stop. However, next night I could hear people next room, 1-2 AM. Very elegant and large bathroom. The hotel bar is fantastic, good menu, wine and service. If you are looking for location, this is the place. Circular Quay around the corner, walking distance to any point in CBD, buses, train and ferries close by, and a gorgeous park just in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, with great location”
Reviews.Author: piffity
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location a few minutes from the harbour and close to all the action in the CBD. Room was beautiful. What impressed us the most was the service. On our last day, we left our bags at the hotel after checking out and went out to shop, as we had a late flight. We called the hotel on our way back in a taxi to ask them to get the bags out, as we were planning to grab them and jump straight back in the cab to head to the airport. We pulled up in front of the hotel and had not got out of the taxi when the extremely helpful concierge (Dean?) saw us through the doors, came out to the taxi and told us he didn't want us to get wet from the rain. He and another staff member loaded up the taxi with our luggage, while we got to stay dry in the taxi. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: coco9nyc
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said: wonderful location. Walk out the door, turn left, and you're at the Opera House in a couple of minutes. (It's also pretty handy for the train from the airport, too.) Having said that, I've stayed in far nicer 5-star hotels. The place was perfectly pleasant, but it could do with a bit of refurbishment - it just felt a bit tired, tending towards shabby sometimes (though it was spotlessly clean and the service was great). But fixtures and fittings looked like they could use replacing soon. No real complaints other than the lack of good coffee in the room. It is Sydney, after all.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, 2 minutes from Opera House.”
Reviews.Author: Maur92
Reviews.Content: Beautiful bedrooms, very large. Excellent bar food and the convenience of being such a short distance from the Opera House. For where it is situated and the quality of the hotel, the room costs were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Sir Stamford”
Reviews.Author: CarolWellington
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights as a stop over in Sydney on our way home to New Zealand from Hong Kong. We booked a superior room over the internet on their web site. We got a room on the ninth floor overlooking the park. Room was large, bathroom was huge with both a bath and a toilet. The room had lovely furniture and was quiet. We loved the location and the staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants but did get a sandwich from room service which was fine and arrived promptly. Downsides - Low light in the room, trouble getting a consistent temperature of water out of the shower, we never did find the minibar which was in were told on checkout was in the dresser under the tv. The jug and coffee cups where in one bedside table and the room safe was in the other bedside table - strange location for these. The picture of the room on the website shows a sofa, low table and chairs in the superior room which ours didn't have - We had two chairs at the desk and one comfortable chair with a foot rest. We did enjoy our stay here and would stay again. Price was really very good for the location near the opera house and it felt very elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Give up the View get a great room”
Reviews.Author: moyaroo
Reviews.Content: In Sydney one has to pay a small fortune for a good view of the Opera House and or the Bridge, but one does not have to pay a fortune for a great hotel. The Sir Stamford is just across from the Botanical Gardens, up the street from the Opera House and around the bend from Circular Quay. We found our room to be superior to what we have seen at the big high rise hotels and for a fraction of the cost. From the moment we stepped into the hotel we knew that we had found a first class hotel with a great and attentive staff. Our room was large and well appointed with a bathroom better than most. The bed was comfortable, we slept well and woke up rested as the area is quiet as well as convenient. We would rate this one of the best hotels in Sydney and the best QPR (quality to price ratio) in town. The bar is elegant and well worth checking out even if staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliantly Located, if expensive.”
Reviews.Author: ExiledNorthamptonian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, thoriughly enjoyed the stay until check out, where I found the bill somewhat high (275 AUD) for just the room, no breakfast. On the plus side the room was spacious, with very nice, if slightly olde worlde, furnishings. The location, is 500 metres from the Opera House, with the Rocks and Circular key just a short walk away. My only complaint is the price. The staff were friendly and efficient, and as I've already said the location perfect for my stay in Sydney for a night at the Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and Over-Priced”
Reviews.Author: muzzamc
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night but never again. Hotel is in good location and very well decorated with antiques etc. Room comfortable, clean and large. TV old and not suitable for most programs with no chance to change format. To boil the jug to make a cup of tea I had to get jug from bedside cupboard, fill it in the bathroom, carry it into the bedroom/lounge area, move a lamp and then plug it in. Internet expensive (minimum charge $24.95) but efficient. Marble bathroom very posh but user unfriendly - nowhere to hang towel when showering, shower door was scraping away marble doorstep, towel medium/large and scratchy. Room service meal was efficient but not very good - greasy fried dim sims, cold chips, OK ribs. Breakfast was the biggest disappointment. $35 but you had to pay extra $6 for proper coffee. Scrambled eggs tough and rubbery, baked beans watery, bread stale, perc coffee served horrible, weak, and had probably stewed for 2 hours. Table uncomfortable because of huge centre table leg. A couple at an adjoining table order a poached egg each but the order came as two poached eggs on one plate. One person then had to wait while more eggs were poached. This is the third Stamford hotel I have stayed in and by far the worst. It definitely does not rate 5 stars - more like 4.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: 4rubylou
Reviews.Content: So glad we chose this hotel. The location is fabulous - close to all attractions and ferries. The hotel is decorated in traditional style with antiques and lovely paintings. The rooms are huge - with desk, lounge chairs and lovely big marble bathrooms. We had ordered pre-dinner canapes and sparkling wine for our arrival and they were delivered promptly and the canapes were delicious. The only gripe we had was with some noisy people in the next room but that wasn't the fault of the hotel. Concierge service was very good. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great location, stately rooms, helpful svc”
Reviews.Author: md_girl23
Reviews.Content: pros: conveniently situated within walking distance of circular quay, botanic gardens, rocks [i had only 2 nights in sydney]. concierge/staff were extremely helpful and responsive. comfortably appointed bedroom, large marble bathroom. potential cons: (i) concierge "steering" and don't try to save your $. (a) one concierge recommended a blue mountain tour (blue diamond tour, the only brochure in their lobby, <1yr husband-wife startup), saying the tour would be "flexible" since it would be a small group, you could ask about sites not listed on tour, would return to CQ around 6p, etc....so i asked about other sites listed in other tour brochures and was repeatedly told "i didn't want to go there," "lookouts/valleys all the same," too far, etc. when traveling i like to cover a lot of ground (esp when short stay), but i felt particularly rushed during this tour, particularly at the wildlife park, which was our last stop en route back to sydney "because the animals are more active" (even though the taronga zoo advises that animals are more active in the morning). when it seemed we might miss 4p+ ferry back to sydney (bc the other 2 ppl on the tour had spent >15 min making emergency pit stop), the husband said they couldn't drive us back to sydney even though the other couple's hotel would have been their next stop. when i repeatedly told the sir stamford concierge that the tour had in fact not been "flexible," they didn't seem to respond/care. so in short, it seems that the tour didn't live up to promises by sir stamford concierge (who likely reaped booking commission). (b) concierge booked SOH tour without applying the 20% discount voucher that they (and everyone else) has - so i ended up rebooking at the box office (which defeatus the purpose of trying to have concierge take care of this in first place). (ii) absolutely no maid cleaning/service during first of 2 nights -- room not cleaned/straightened, bed not made, tea/coffee not replenished, etc. -- unexpected for hotel of this stated caliber. (iii) $25/day for internet - connection dropped and couldn't be reinstated on day 2 (iv) would be nice to have phones next to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: FromtheEast
Reviews.Content: 9/10. A very pleasant stay, good large rooms, good service. A nice change to have a traditional hotel with antique furniture rather than modern concrete blocks and minimalist look. Perhaps a bit pricey in the bar and restaurant . Expensive internet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CazBUk
Reviews.Content: Sir Stamford is an elegant, traditional style hotel in a great location, within walking distance of the main sights in Sydney. Our room was very spacious, with a small balcony overlooking the Botanic Gardens, a sitting area with comfortable seating, a large desk, comfortable bed and great bathroom. Staff were friendly and heipful. Expensive internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHamnett
Reviews.Content: Right from the time we stepped under the canopy of the entrance and received such a warm welcome, our experience was very satisfying and pleasurable. The decor, furniture and paintwork reflects a very high standard of elegance. When checkling in , we requested a room with a balcony overlooking Circular Quay. This was gladly supplied and the view was great. All the staff were friendly and helpful, even down to the offer of an umbrella when stepping out in the light drizzle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: bluegoldhighlander
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently enjoyed a romantic weekend at the Sir Stamford Circular Quay and were impressed with the quality and service. I booked online and got a very good deal on a suite. The booking process was very easy and I liked the upgrade options you are given. The pre-dinner nibbles for $10pp delivered to the room was a nice option and one we enjoyed as they were very tasty! Our room was a suite on a corner with great views overlooking Circular Quay and the Rocks. The hotel is a very convenient walking distance to the Opera House, the Rocks, the train station, ferry terminal and many downtown restaurants. There is also a park across the street for morning walks. We were celebrating our anniversary so on checking in we asked the young concierge in a very impressive uniform for restaurant recommendations. He was very helpful and knowledgeable and made our booking for us as we sat in the cosy bar at the hotel and enjoyed tasty cocktails and the music of a piano player. The bar and front desk staff were also very professional and helpful. Our suite was very spacious with separate lounge, dressing room, double vanities and marble bathroom. The decor was very formal, traditional and attractive. Everything was very clean and the floor extremely quiet and peaceful. An excellent choice for romance!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: outandabout09_10
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our week long stay at this hotel; the room was spacious and clean, the pool very nice and the staff friendly and very helpful. Not all of the staff were equally knowledgeable. the price for email / internet was too high, the offered computer not very good. The bar was nice but we missed a breakfast possibility. I did not like it that the money for several days was charged to my creditcard right away , inspite of having booked and paid in advance. I got that money back later, but I did not like the gesture. a hotel of this high standard should not have such petty business behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flyaway01
Reviews.Content: I made the booking online and requested interconnecting rooms for a party of 5. At the time of check-in the interconnecting rooms were confirmed and upon arrival at the rooms I was more than impressed. The rooms were huge and the decor and facilities were first class.
