The Lobby area had a fire place and was furnished in old world charm which totally added to the atmosphere!!! The conceirge staff were attentive and took the initiative to check us in online for our flights when it was mentioned that we were flying out of Sydney later that evening!! The Bar was cosy and quaint with the staff being very courteous!!!! Sir Stamford is in a great location and only 5 minutes walk to the Opera House and Circular Quay. A sensational hotel in a great location with staff to match!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 5 star!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A sublime hospitality experience”
Reviews.Author: Moo628
Reviews.Content: It is a few years since we have parked our boots at the Sir Stamford in Circular quay and this time it exceeded even our loftiest expectations. The rooms here are beautifully decorated and equipped, the location is fabulous and the Bar and restaurant are great but this is not the reason we loved the hotel. It is the staff. They are all professional, friendly and approachable. Nothing is too much trouble and your happiness seems to be their priority which is a nice change from most other hotels I've stayed in Sydney (and there have been many). The hotel itself is cosy and elegant. Big enough to have all you want, including an open fire but small enough to provide intimacy.Could possibly have done without the three fire alarm evacuations in one night but the staff delt with it all very well, despite some very (understandably) grumpy guests. Bravo to the Sir Stamford. Don't change!.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a rich old grandmothers mansion”
Reviews.Author: traveldreamerSydney
Reviews.Content: This was a mystery 5 star deal. Was a bit disappointed when I saw what I got as I actually find some of that old world decor a bit creepy but there was a nice log fire and seating in the lobby. The smokey smell was pretty strong but I quite liked it but I found there was also like an old lady's house smell about the place. Loved the bathroom. We got the superior room - tried our luck at a free upgrade - it was offered for $30 extra - we declined. Not much of an outlook. City side view - a little noisy with ferry/bus noises during day and morning but quiet at night and the bed was comfy. Great location. Lots of places to eat. Staff very pleasant and friendly. Overall I enjoyed my stay and actually ended up liking some of the decor but I would be disappointed if I had paid any more than the mystery deal price.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a first class location. Old fashioned but will not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: ukealady
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford has a old fashioned grandeur which could be considered out dated by some. It is in an excellent location for walking to circular quay and the shopping areas of sydney. The rooms are large with magnificent bathrooms in marble and the beds are supremely comfortable. Our room overlooked the botanical gardens which are just across the road. We didn't try the restaurant, which we found expensive. The tea available in the bar was beautifully displayed with an impressive range of high quality leaves and the service was exempelary. The staff were helpful. The internet charges were very high and you will find cheaper alternatives just about anywhere which seems strange as many people like to keep in touch with family during stays away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: Location: Inner city, close to Opera House and main financial, commercial and government offices. Parking available for fee Style: Medium size hotel with about 120 quite large and well appointed rooms in a refurbished heritage building with new wing. Absolute five star. Expensive but offers internet specials. Breakfast: Excellent in all respects Internet: Both Wifi and LAN available for fee over AUD 12 per hour or AUD 25 per day. Charges for internet access are common in Australian hotels so it is best to buy a local dongle with prepaid use.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful and restful experience”
Reviews.Author: welshwizardCanberra
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this marvellous place before yet every time we stay here things surprise us. The friendliness of the staff, the size of the rooms, the location to the harbour, opera house, transport, the Bar, the Dining Room, all combine to make this place just way above the usual 5 star places you stay at. We ecpected that the check in would be at 3 and sure enough we dropped our cases in the morning and came back in the afternoon just in time to see our bags moving to theelevator. We had been upgraded to the 9th floor with views of the Bridge and most of the Harbour. A short walk down the hill brings you to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Plenty of places for meals and coffees etc. We ate in The Dining Room one evening and the food was brilliant. I am not big on desserts so the young waitress got me three ice cream scoops of different flavours. The Bar has an intimate atmosphere and the two "bar people" Andrew and magdalena were amazing in their service and friendliness. My lovely lady thinks this place is the best and I agree. Only one slightly annoying thing - as each train leaves the station 400 meters away it sounds its horn. You get used to it after a while and don't let that put you off staying at this great place.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location and huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: kygirl7
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel after reading reviews on this site, and it was fantastic. The rooms are unbelievably huge, and the beds were very comfortable. The best part about this hotel though is the location. After checking in, my friend and I started walking and in 3 minutes we were at the harbor with the Opera house directly in front of us. It was amazing! And the botanical gardens were directly across the street as well as the ferry's all within a 5 minute walking trip. The service was fantastic, I was over excited and asked a lot of questions but they were more than friendly. They even gave us a great tip on the best Chinese restaurant in Chinatown to go to. Overall I absolutely reccommend this hotel to anyone going to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Superdi
Reviews.Content: The first part of our stay in Sydney we stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday inn (see my review). We stayed at this hotel for five nights and it was fantastic. The room was the largest I have ever stayed in and very well appointed. The location is brilliant you are a two minute walk to circular quay and the ferry point. The service was excellent the staff were very attentive we could not have asked for better. Again with hotels of this nature be aware of bar costs and the room mini bar prices. There are shops in the area where you can purchase must cheaper. I enjoyed this hotel far more than the Old Sydney Holiday inn in every way. In my view there is just no comparison and the prices are about the same.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location but not without faults.....”
Reviews.Author: HPsauceNWEngland
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 10am, we were pleased to be able to check in early (as requested) and were delighted with our large room at the front, more like a suite, with fabulous bathroom, comfortable bed and settee etc. Location was brilliant - opposite the botanic gardens (very noisy bats!) and SO near the Opera House and waterfront. My husband used the small outdoor pool which looked nice. Our room had a (locked)door which interconnects with the next room - this meant that when the occupants were noisily arguing, repeatedly, we could hear every word. Quite annoying when trying to sleep. We ate in the restaurant once - very expensive, long wait, Pre Opera 'special offer' not made clear so we ended up paying for drinks which we would not have had if we had known the deal, and we were both ill within12 hours. That apart, we LOVED Sydney, would recommend going to the Opera as we did, taking a bus tour round the city, calling at The Rocks, Darling Harbour - going on the ferry - and the fantastic bridge too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mj02
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure about location when I initially booked hotel, but now that we've stayed there I must say that it was spot on. Straight down the road (5min) to Opera house. Around the corner (2min) Circular Quay, continue around Circular Quay to The Rocks (10min). Walked through city to Darlingharbour on one occassion to visit Aquarium and Wildlife World (20min walk). Glad we didn't stay in city centre it was way too busy. Being opposite Botanical Gardens and around Circular Quay made our time in Sydney feel much more relaxed and leisurely. The hotel itself is old world, as is obvious in the pictures. Not to my husbands taste, but all the same our room was huge..... two double beds (travelled with two young children), couch, armchair, coffee table, desk.... plenty of room for the kids to play. The bathroom was also large with separate shower and bath, but I must say it did feel more 4 star when it come to wear and tear. For us it was all worth it considering we paid less then $200 a night. Compared to other hotel prices in this area it was an absolute bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: mollywolly59
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel. The location could not be better. Our room was spacious, clean and looked over the botanical gardens. Peaceful, but so convenient. So pleased we chose to stay there and highly recommend to others who want convenience and tradition but not noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: 10LeagueBoots
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford was a great find in Sydney. The price was great, the room large, the staff friendly and helpful and the hotel was perfectly located one block from the Opera House and Botanical Garden. I could not have been happier with this Trip Adviser find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: elerem2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and used it as a base to explore some of Sydney's main attractions. The location is brilliant: walking distance to the Opera House, Botanical Gardens, the Rocks, Circular Quay and to buses to Bondi. The service was very good too. The rooms are a little dated but nice, and we thought $25 per day for internet was quite expensive when other hotels we've stayed at of this standard provide it free. A nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Cheap Rates and Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: Haylot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights following our wedding in March 2010. Overall we were very happy with the room and service. The staff were very good and we were sent up a bottle of complimentary champagne when they discovered it was our wedding night. The rooms were quite large and the furniture comfortable. There was an error on check our regarding the mini-bar, the staff simply deleted the charges and there was no issue or hold up to double check that we were telling the truth which was appreciated. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but the room service was tasty if a little expensive. The location is good, with a short walk to Circular Quay and the Botanic Gardens. I would recommend booking directly with Stamford, they have a best rate policy, and we stayed for two nights on the weekend for around $440 which is very good for that level of quality in Sydney. Overall I would definitely recommend the Sir Stamford to people, it is by far the best hotel I have stayed in in Sydney both location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel, well situated but be careful when booking”
Reviews.Author: JulieCManchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is about 5 minutes walk from the opera house, the rocks, the botanical gardens and the central ferry terminal. It has elegant decor and the rooms are very spacious. The smiling porter at the front door was always a welcome sight. We arrived early at the hotel and didn't expect our room to be ready, we just wanted to leave our bags and explore the city. The guy behind the reception advised that we should come back in a couple of hours and we might be able to acees our room. He did agree to take our bags. A couple of hours later (about 12pm) and he advised that our room was still not available but was being cleaned ,and reminded us that check in was 3pm. We advised that we were aware of this but it was him who had told us to return. As we had been travelling for nearly 24 hour by this point we decided to wait in the lounge while our room was cleaned. During our time sat there we saw several people arriving and being taken straight to their rooms At 3pm exactly we were given our room key. When booking we had selected options for a delux room with balcony and harbour view and had assumed that was why we had to wait, however we found that our room didn't have one. When I went to enquire about why this was, it was explained that all the balcony rooms had already been allocated and that no-one else was checking in today! I asked about why the room had a view of a 4 lane highway rather than the harbour but he pointed out that the river could be seen beyond this After questioning the receptionist further he reminded us that we had not booked the room with the hotel direct but via a well known online agent. We had therefore paid less for the room than some other guests, intimating that we should really expect a lesser service. We also spoke to an American couple whilst we were there who had booked through the same agent and were finding that they were also finding a lower level of service Because of our experience on the first day we didn't use any of the other hotel facilities If you are going to use this hotel then make sure you know exactly what you're getting, and read the small print or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: raybird
Reviews.Content: By Sydney's standards we obtained a reasonable deal by pre-booking at the Stamford website. This hotel is so well placed â€” all the ferries and just about every bus goes to Circular Quay, not to mention the trains. The carpeted rooms are very large with two comfortable (a little soft!) queen-size beds, good quality linen and special pillows are available. The air-con is quite brilliant â€” quiet and efficient. Â Â Â Â We have a huge marble bathroom with two basins. Â I like the â€˜Englishâ€™ entrance hall, with plenty of seating, newspapers etc. Â Â Just occasionally the neighbour's TV disturbs. Â The staff are mostly friendly and the management generous with toiletries but mean with wifi which is incredibly expensive. Â Â Â On the downside, as you would expect, laundry dining and telephone are pricey, but during the week there are plenty of places to eat around this splendid business district. Â The prices for all services do not seem to be printed anywhere and the hotel 'book' in the room is decidedly 'tatty' and in need of a facelift. Â Very discreet muzak is only found in the entrance lobby and lounge, and for once even this is not irritating. Â

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located boutique hotel for city vacation in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: WalkingTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford gave us just what we wanted during our March 2010 vacation in Sydney. Good service, uncrowded, traditional style furnishings, sizable 9th floor room, with high quality fixtures, marble bathroom, with 2 face bowls. Desk in main portion of room, with a separate vanity in the alcove outside of the bathroom area. Shower/toilet in separate room from vanities. Robes & slippers provided. Internet connection for a fee, but the numerous McDonald's in Sydney all have Wi-Fi, so go there, buy a coffee and connect if you must. Sir Stamford price was reasonable via Expedia for location and quality - US$212 per night. Location fantastic. Literally a 5 min leisurely walk door-to-door to Circular Quay transport station, to catch trains, buses and ferries to points near and far. Yet Sir Stamford location across the street from the Botanic Gardens makes it feel away from the hustle & bustle. 7 min walk to Opera House, which lived up to its reputation. Sir Stamford food was good, but not economical -- no worries, several cafe's and fast food places located within that 7 min walk perimeter. Many more choices of restaurants and pubs in The Rocks. Hotel let's you use their nicely appointed locker room /showers in their fitness center, if you arrive early in the morning from an overseas flight. We were prepared for this, with a change of clothes conveniently accessible in our luggage - so we showered dressed and headed out to see the city with friends. When we returned late in the afternoon, they simply handed us the keys to our now available room, our luggage already having been delivered. Great service! Yes, you can take the train from the airport .. two block walk to the Sir Stamford, although that second block is uphill! My suggestion -- get a shuttle, you can sign up for round trip. Sure you have to make multiple stops, but the airport is close, and it will drop you off at the door of your hotel. Typical fit adults will find walking to be the most rewarding way to see the many sites within reach of the Sir Stamford. 3 of the 4 in our party are early 50's and we all walked to the Rock's & Harbour Bridge 10 - 15 minutes, Darling Harbour 25 minutes, Shopping on George and Castleagh Streets - 10 -30 minutes depending upon where. Chinatown - 40 mins total - hint, break it up by checking out shops in the Queen Victoria Bldg. Botanic Garden starts right across the street, stroll for 60 - 90 mins, lots to see, or sit and enjoy the urban park atmosphere, then pop in to the adjacent Art Gallery of New South Wales. Catch the ferry to Manly Beach or to the Taronga Zoo. A bus runs to Bondi. Sir Stamford can hook you up with a nice, if expensive small group tour of the Blue Mountains - but cheaper options are available. We considered buying the all transport passes (bus, ferry, train) but walking worked out ok. Some friends stayed in Potts Point - a more diverse urban neighborhood, more economical, but further from most primary attractions. Weather worked out perfect for us, although some March days can be cooler than what we experienced, and on has above average rainfall. We had no rain, 77 -82 F temperatures. Polo's & shorts perfect for day time. Smart thing is to be flexible - length jack or sweater just in case. Crime didn't seem to be a significant tourist issue -- as always, exercise good judgment by not planning to take long walks down deserted streets late at night. Bottom line - Sydney is a marvelous city and the Sir Stamford is a perfectly located European style boutique hotel to have as your base.

Reviews.Title: “great room in a great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: time0ff
Reviews.Content: booked early for a discounted price, room only, great (big) family room, better location than we expected, nice little touches.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Location & Comfort !”
Reviews.Author: portygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sir Stamford for 6 nights over a hectic Feb/March weekend. Despite it requiring refurbishment in some areas it was a real haven & so comfortable. We got a great rate of less than $800 for the 6 nights. Even with the great rate my request for a high floor room with a view of Circular Quay was granted. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as the local options were more varied & numerous, but drinks in the bar were great. The concierge guys were so welcoming & helpful. The location is really spot on with easy access to all the major sites & the ferries of Circular Quay. We particularly enjoyed the easy access to the fabulous Botanic garden which you could just pop in & out of at the end of busy days. We had family members staying at the Grand Quay apt Hotel & although their views were unsurpassed we preferred the comfort & old world charm of the Sir Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Past its best but still worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Badger1UK
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid-morning so not surprisingly room wasn't ready. They kindly allowed us to freshen up at the 5th floor Fitness Centre and said they would call my mobile when we could check in. We killed an hour or so taking in the fabulous harbour views before they called which was appreciated. I had a very good corporate rate which included breakfast. The breakfast is not high class but is adequate. I did like the fact that there was a juice machine to press fresh oranges. The room was a junior suite which was well appointed and spacious. The only negative thing about it was the toilet cistern which (before you work out the knack of flushing in a certain way) would carry on recycling water into the pan, which on the first night was extremely irritating as it was noisy. The room maid service was poor and not thorough at all. The concierge guys on the other hand were fabulous throughout and very friendly. Overall I would come back here. It clearly needs a refresh as it is looking a bit tired and jaded but at the moment its location more than makes up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice former Ritz”
Reviews.Author: WaHoo84
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the US in Sydney on a Saturday morning and took the taxi from the airport $45 Aus. On arrival, our room was not ready and we were kindly taken to the fitness club so that we could shower, change clothes and use any of the facilities including the pool. We were refreshed and the consierge provided us a map and directions to the Opera House, the Gardens (which are like Golden Gate Park in SF) and the circular Quay. We went for a walk, ate lunch and were able to see the Rocks area (just a few blocks), the opera house, the gardens and many cafes and coffee shops. The location was perfect. We got a great deal (3 nights for less than $800) and the rooms were great. It clearly was a Ritz in the past- the bathrooms gave it away. In its current state, it no longer is quite the quality of Ritz. The carpet at the entry is red but worn, the carpets in the elevators are worn. The most obvious sign that they are frugal is the lack of ammenities in the bathroom-one small bar of soap for three days (despite the fact that we called several times for soap to be delivered. We met a firend in Sydney who does quite a bit of business there and he stated that since it was sold, many of the loyal staff have left for the PArk Hyatt becuase the current owner does not take care of the staff and the quality has diminished. It is a fine 4 star hotel but when you are there, you just long for the 5 star Ritz that it clearly was in the past. We spent 3 nights at the hotel. It was very nice, great location, nice desk staff. We just hope the owner will add the little touches back to make it a little more in keeping with its style and location.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: gjune
Reviews.Content: Very lovely quiet hotel. Splendid public rooms. Very spacious bedrooms with huge very comfortable beds. Marble bathrooms. Hotel offers everything one could want for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, comfort and great location”
Reviews.Author: bronnykay
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in this hotel for romantic getaways. The first time was in November 2008. We booked a fantastic deal on Wotif.com which included the best available suite with access to a private lounge on the 5th floor for pre dinner drinks and canapÃ©s as well as breakfast. It was very exclusive and an enormous treat for us. Sadly, I injured my back on that occasion and so we repeated the trip in order to complete our dinner harbour cruise with Captain Cook. That offer was not available when we returned 6 months later and is still not mentioned anywhere on their web site, which is a great pity. So instead when we returned we took the best available suite option without the private lounge or any meal inclusions. The first time the suite was larger with two televisions, but both were very spacious with walk in robes, powder room, balcony (albeit small) with a view to the harbour, and impeccable decor and facilities. Service was impeccable at all times, when I injured my back a doctor was quickly found even late on a Saturday night, and a wheelchair was provided, ramp placed and assistance given. The private lounge service was really excellent. We also went to the bar both times and service was great, the Friday night singer was brilliant and came around and spoke to all the patrons in her breaks. Decor is beautiful throughout, I was surprised to find it is actually a new building not a heritage building as it has been constructed faithfully to period specifications and furnished accordingly. Room service was above average. I suspect some of those who have made adverse comments were perhaps not given as good service due to being in standard rooms rather than suites. Location is nothing short of perfect. Close to circular Quay for ferries, trains or buses and ideally located within walking distance of the Opera House and restaurants in the Rocks. Stroll through the exquisite Botanic Gardens to the Art Gallery. We recommend the German SteakHouse for a fun night and hearty feed. Great reasonably priced breakfasts can be had at the Circular Quay 24 hours cafe. Our Captain Cook dinner harbour cruise deserves a special mention. Great food, sensational band for dancing, and a long cruise around the harbour made it a magical night to remember forever. Perfect for a special occasion, there were lots of anniversaries! We were lucky having a table near the dance floor. You can pay extra to have a window seat but it didnâ€™t matter really, we preferred being near the dancefloor. I recommend Stamford for your Sydney getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Terrrific Location”
Reviews.Author: MarchessadePolo
Reviews.Content: We loved the location & the staff was very helpful. Very large room was well maintained and overlooked the botanical gardens.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AnnNWEngland
Reviews.Content: Having read some very positive reviews we looked forward to staying at the Sir Stamford. Certainly the location is excellent with all the facilities of Circular Quay close at hand, the Botanic Gardens on the doorstep and ferries, trains and buses including the free CBD shuttles only two minutes away. And yes there is a hint of elegance with soft music playing and olde worlde furniture, paintings and artefacts in the public areas and doormen on hand to bow and scrape. However we were very unimpressed when reception claimed to have no knowledge of our reservation and continued to blame us for their mistake. They seemed to be doing us a big favour by eventually deigning to allocate a room. They were equally slow to sort out other difficulties and on departure tried to charge us for breakfasts we had not taken. Though elegant the public areas were a bit battered, the lifts rather smelly and creaky and remains of room service stayed uncollected in the corridors. Housekeeping was also hit and miss with supplies of tea and coffee and toiletries not always being replenished. Our room was an executive suite but had limited views, no balcony and the aircon was noisy. Even when switched off there was loud mechanical noise. The bedroom was more suited to a single executive than a couple with one side of the bed difficult to access because of the sloping roof. Bedroom lighting was dismal with no main light and just one table lamp. We did not use the restaurant other than for one breakfast that was ok but overpriced and noticed the dining chairs were far too low and unsuitable. The pool was small and baisc but ok if there was no one else wanting to use it. All in all we felt Sir Stamford did not offer value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff & service”
Reviews.Author: PMG_9
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted with a warm welcome, by the valet attendants, and asked if we would like valet parking, we chose to park ourselves. Very disappointed because we found that we could not access the reception area directly from the parking basement. Reception was friendly and efficient. Every effort was made to ensure our comfort. The room was large, clean and well layed out. Some may say the decor was dated, but my wife and I enjoy the Olde World elegance. Large functional bath room. Probably the biggest we have experienced, all the amenities you could need and plenty of hot water. The bar was warm and welcoming, and the restaurant equal to any we have experienced. Service was efficient and unobtrusive, the wait staff very welcoming and professional. The only downside to our room was the dated technology. Wi-Fi was available in the room, but at a surcharge!! All in all we both enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel for a relaxing weekend in Sydney, its location to all tourist venues, public transport and city centre was excellent. To all the staff at the Sir Stamford, Circular Quay, thank you Peter & Marilyn

Reviews.Title: “Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jen1230
Reviews.Content: I found the Stamford by recommendation from a friend. It was all that and more. The staff were extremely helpful, the rooms were spacious and the marble bathroom was 10 star. My room had a balcony overlooking The Domain. Traffic noise was almost non existant with a good view of harbour. One evening I had the delight of watching a cruise ship leave the harbour with a firework display. Location is about as good as it gets - minutes from Circular Quay ferries and trains. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3 minutes from the opera house at everyday prices”
Reviews.Author: WeAreTourists
Reviews.Content: Traditional elegant hotel with friendly staff. Stayed in 'delux room' 812 (by no means their most expensive) and had magnificent wide-ranging views over botanical gardens and the opera house. Room very large and comfortable, huge marble bathroom with the utterly essential double sink! 100yrds from the front door and you're right on the main harbourside and can get the ferries for touring the harbour, manley, bondi, etc. and lots of bars, restaurants. Visited by cockatoo's, parrots etc on the small balcony, and look out for the massive flying fox bats at twilight - thankfully they didn't land on the balcony. Didn't spend much time in the hotel during our 4 nights but all the public areas were very comfortable, nice antiques and paintings, wood lined: quite small but cosy with a lovely bar doing afternoon teas and cocktails. Couldn't imagine finding a better hotel in Sydney without spending Â£300+ per night at the park hyatt (that looked a bit 80s concreate to be honest). Other tips would be breakfast at the Rocks watching the cruise ships come in, Darling Harbour bit tacky, easy to see all the main stuff in about 3-4days as its very easy to get ferries or walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn35
Reviews.Content: Just finished spending five nights at this well located hotel. Large rooms with an outstanding helpful staff. One block to Circular Quey and its transportation center and many fine restaurants. Breakfast is not worth the cost, however many places to eat are close by. Had dinner at Alfredo Restaurant and Cafe Sydney both are very good, Took the Blue Diamond Tour to the Blue Mountains which was excellent. I cannot rate this company high enough for what they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: skb3840SpringLake_MI
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. Helped us find our way around. Rooms were of good size and very comfortable. Very close to the Opera House, Circular Quay and the Royal Botanical Gardens, busses, and ferrys.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MP5London
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week over Christmas with my boyfriend and loved it. Slightly pricey hotel but was worth it. Great big room, very clean and excellent location. It's opposite the botantical gardens and a very short walk from the Opera house, would recommend a drink or two at the Opera Bar. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot in Sydney's Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderingMoose
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford at Circular Quay is an AMAZING hotel! Just a 5 minute walk to The Opera House, and across the street from the beautiful Royal Botanic Gardens. The rooms are HUGE, and decorated very elegantly. The hotel also has a beautiful bar that serves excellent cocktails (although a little pricey). I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Sydney for a family”
Reviews.Author: Frenchpope101
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and loved the place. Right across from the botanical gardens where the bats are hanging during the day which was quite an attraction. About a 3 minute walk to the Opera House, Circle Quay so you can not be better located for access to running around outside or just going to see the sites!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: traveledall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Sir Stamford for a week in December. Outstanding location within an easy walk of the Opera House, Circular Quay (bus and ferry center), Botanic Gardens, Art Museum, and many other attractions. Beautiful room with very comfortable bed, table and chairs for in-room dining, nice bath. Would recommend asking for room overlooking Circular Quay. Sir Stamford is upscale, has great room service, and has a friendly staff. Limited on-site dining -- one restaurant, very pricey. We used room service meals quite a bit. Always generous, tasty, and prompt. Would definitely stay here again on another trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: kaja2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights upon arrival from the U.S. Booked through hotels.com and got a great rate. Elegant old hotel in a fabulous location. The opera house is about 3 blocks down the hill, botanic garden is across the street and circular quay 2 blocks away. We knew our room would not have a view, so were not disappointed. The room was huge, furnishings comfortable, though a bit "past their prime." Bathroom was spacious, all marble, with double vanity. Concierge was helpful and booked some day trips for us. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, misleading room descriptions”
Reviews.Author: wildflowerb
Reviews.Content: First things first. For location, you CANNOT go wrong with the Sir Stamford. It is 1 minute from Circular Quay, you can get the train from the airport and is within walking distance of Hyde Park, The Rocks and the Opera House. I booked this hotel 8 months in advance for New Years Eve for myself and my Mum. I am an agent and go by the room descriptions the hotel send to the wholesaler and also the hotel website itself. As the "Harbour View Room" with terraces were booked out, I booked a DELUXE HARBOUR VIEW ROOM instead as I could get a Juliet Balcony. The descriptions actually say " French doors open on to Juliet Balconies or Terrace, overlooking our beautiful Sydney Harbour and the Royal Botanic Gardens" . By Sydney Harbour, they actually mean Watson's Bay, NOT the part of the Harbour ( i.e. The bit that has the Bridge) any person I have actually asked would be expecting. At $700.00 a night,( yep you read that right and there was a minimum 3 night stay) we were disappointed as we hoped to be able to watch the fireworks from our Juliet Balcony. The hotel isn't even high enough to give you a "proper" harbour view of the bit with the bridge. Apparently if you stay in a superior King you may get a glimpse of Circular Quay according to the hotel website ( so strange as this is the lead in room type?). Even one of the boys on the desk described the description as slightly misleading. The repair man did not seem interested in making sure the lock on our Juliet Balcony doors actually locked without turning the knob 12 times to get it locked. I would like to mention that Jessica, concierge team leader and Robert who was on the front desk were exceptional. The marble bathrooms are massive, and so are the rooms. On the whole it is a beautiful hotel and you just cannot beat the location- we fell in love with the fact we were a minute from the facilities of Circular Quay. I have put 3 for value as I feel I paid for a room that wasn't correctly described. But for location it gets a 5 for value. I am just glad I didn't book this for a client, I was disappointed enough, I would have been heartbroken for any client. I am very careful when booking rooms for premium events ( and just in general) and had the description clearly said there was no view of Circular Quay, I would have booked a Superior Room instead and saved some money or spent an extra grand and stayed at Quay Grand Suites and got my own balcony on Circular Quay and 2 extra nights. Although, we had a great time, and I would definitely stay here again, I will be booking Quay Grand Suites, Shangri La, Intercontinental and Four Seasons for my clients over New Year as they actually do have views of the part of the Harbour that people are expecting. For other stays though this hotel will be up there for top located hotels and as long as you are not expecting to see the fireworks, you really should stay here just based on the location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, well situated, peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollydaction
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight on my way to a conference on the gold coast. I wanted a comfortable place to fight the first round of jet lag, while being close enough to the major sydney sights that I might get out and see the opera house, etc. This was a very comfortable hotel, the staff were all really friendly and helpful, and the decor was elegant. It was a couple of blocks from the train station so it was easy to get to & from the airport. It was also a very short walk to the waterfront and opera house, and the gardens were literally across the street. I was shocked to have to pay $25 a night for internet access (!!!) but it seemed that this was not unusual in Australia. Luckily it was a business trip and I could write it off, otherwise I would have been seriously annoyed. Also the fitness center was tiny. All in all though a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location - Huge Room - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BrilloAido
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November for 4 nights. Booked a Superior Room using 30 Day Advance Saver option on their web-site, which worked out at around $180 per night. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a bigger room, with terrace and harbour-bridge view. The room was huge, with lots of space for our cloths and luggage. The bathroom was large, with separate him-&-her sinks, - so no problems finding room to place toiletries. There was also an anti-room before entering the bathroom, which was handy to leave our luggage in. There was also an Iron & ironing-board (its annoying when there is not). The style is old-world/turn-of-the-century, which may not be to everyone taste. Other reviewers stated that their rooms were a bit tired/tatty, but we did find that to be the case. The hotel has a small outdoor pool. It only gets the sun early in the morning, though the pool itself is heated. It doesn't get used much, so we had it to ourselves mostly. There is also a gym with sauna, etc. Breakfast, for $35 was expensive and nothing to write home about. We only tried it the once, and with lots of cafÃ©'s around the corner, I wouldn't recommend it. The location was very central. Parking for $35 was a bit steep for what we're used to, though other hotels nearby of the same standard charge $50!! (partly why I opted for this hotel). I would definitely go back (and hope for an upgrade).

Reviews.Title: “Such a deal on the weekend”
Reviews.Author: pezworld
Reviews.Content: Granted, I think we got really lucky on Orbitz, but we knew we were in for something special when we booked it. However, we managed to score a terrace room (huge terrace rather than small balcony) that was rather huge. We felt pampered! The bathroom was also enormous and covered in marble. Staff were really friendly though I don't know why more than one soap was hard to come by (fluke, I imagine). Internet was overpriced, and parking was expensive, but everything else was such a value we didn't really care. And it in the most amazing location. A few steps to Circular Quay and five minutes walk to the Opera House. What a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: PatrickBristol
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed to be given a room on the second floor, at the back. We didn't expect to see the SOH as we had booked a city view but all we could see was the elevated section of road and trains at circular quay plus a tall block at close quarters. When we asked the gloomy receptionist if we could have a room higher up, he said that they were very busy. We had thought that as we had booked and paid in advance for 3 nights, we would qualify for a reasonable view. I'm afraid that the lack of a view coloured our view of this hotel. The room was spacious but rather drab and the carpet dirty. The bathroom was large and well equipped. There was no information about hotel/room facilities so I didn't find the pool until our last night, when I spoke to some people who had swimming costumes in their hands. The lounges would be nice if they had some windows but unfortunately they are internal and even the "roof-top" pool lacks a view. (The pool is in fact on the 5th floor and loses sun mid afternoon.) For a hotel in such a good location it seems ridiculous not to allow guests to enjoy the view unless they are lucky enough to get an upper floor room. The concierge was unable to give us any information about hop on buses although I did find the routes on the city map that he provided. he had no idea where the nearest stop was and offered no information about the free shuttle buses. The best thing about this hotel is its location; walking distance to most things that any tourist would want to see. Maybe try one of the other hotels at this end of Macquarie Street. Tip: There's free internet access at the nearby Custom House (the public library) and the deli under Circular Quay does good muffins and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Orewa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sir Stamford at Circular for 11 nights late November until early December. As our small granddaughter was with us, I found that the room allocated on the first night with two double beds was rather small for two people on one bed, but a most obliging young man on reception next day did find us a larger room on 4th floor where we had one king and one double bed with lots of room for a further 10-day stay. The room was lovely in every respect. Staff were always most helpful and pleasant, location was very central and with lots of lovely walks nearby. All in all we cannot fault this hotel and look forward to returning. We did get an excellent room rate through Hotel Club. Our daughter arrived the following week and was given a room close to our's on the same floor. I cannot understand some above reviews denigrating the hotel - cannot believe they stayed at the same place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful with old world charm.”
Reviews.Author: Dimarie40
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at the Sir Stamford. We had a delightful stay and would highly recommend it. The staff were extremely helpful and polite and nothing was too much trouble. We were given a harbourview suite on the top floor. We made our booking for a very good price through Hotelclub. Room was large and comfortable and very clean. Small balcony with a nice view across the park and onto the harbour. TV was the old box type but as we didn't visit Sydney to watch telly we couldn;t have cared less. It was hidden in a lovely timber cabinet so we couldn't even see it. Could not see the opera house or bridge from our room but we saw them while out and about. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as we prefer to visit the little cafes in the area. Great location close to Circular Quay and the Rocks. We very much like the old world charm this hotel provides. It was classy and quiet. Two things we very much value in our hotels. We will definitely be returning here on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful reservation staff”
Reviews.Author: will37_9
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our stay at the Sir Stamford was ruined by the assistant reservation manager. We arrived at 10.30 a.m. on a Saturday and we had already e-mailed for a request for an early check-in and rooms close together with our family members. We had an instant reply saying that we would be allocated rooms on the same floor but could not guarantee and early check-in. I was not allocated a room until 2.58 p.m. and we were not given rooms on the the same floor but on different floors. I had an appointment that I could not make because of the late check-in and there was no attempt made by the reservations person who was completely unconcerned. There was no one waiting for a room in the foyer in all the time were where there so it seems to be a policy that you do not get a check in before 300 p.m. at the earliest. We had no access to each floor and our stay was ruined by the complete indifference to their guests. The rooms were clean and the breakfast staff were very good. but I would not recommend the hotel as they seem to be very unfriendly and unhappy managerial staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location & lovely posh hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigal000
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 8th floor (room 815) in a spacious room (the size of a large lounge) with two double beds, couch & desk, huge marble bathroom, and a small balcony overlooking the harbour, Opera house & Botanical Gardens. I recommend requesting a high floor, for good views. I especially liked being able to open the balcony doors for fresh air, as I hate staying in hotel rooms where no windows open (like most other hotels in area). We booked directly through the hotel and paid an advance purchase rate which included full breakfast for the 3 of us. So we got a very good deal - our breakfast cost us about AUD$9 each instead of the standard price of $38. Definitely worth doing that - the delicious Bountiful breakfast includes cereals, yoghurt, fruit, pastries, toast, & hot buffet, as well as being able to order other freshly cooked hot breakfasts from the menu - I recommend the eggs benedict! The room was very clean. Staff were always very helpful & polite.Taxi from airport cost AUD$38 (20 minutes). If you arrive too early for checkin they let you use the showers etc in the gym/pool area & look after your bags so you can head out on the town. The roof top pool (heated) & gym were well used by my husband. If you are trying to decide to stay in Darling Harbour or The Rocks/Circular Quay, then Circular Quay is a far better choice as it is central to everything and has lovely views.It is just a few minutes walk from the hotel to the Opera House, The Botanical Gardens and The Rocks (& lots of harbourside restaurants) and the Harbour Bridge. You can walk across the Harbour Bridge for free (it is not necessary to do a guided tour unless you want to go to the very top). The Rocks has outdoor markets on Saturday & Sunday. You can also walk to/from Darling Harbour in about 15 minutes if you go the inland route (along George Street & up Margaret Street, then down the hill). The ferries, trains & buses also all leave a few minutes walk from this hotel. Buy tickets first at circular quay for most trips. Public transport is frequent & inexpensive in Sydney. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly (half hour) - beach & shops. We caught the train to Paramatta (half hour) - train stops right in huge shopping mall (get on at Circular Quay, then change at Central). We caught the bus from Circular Quay (no. 380 or 333) to Bondi beach (half hour) - lovely cliff top walk. There is also a free green shuttle bus (no.555) every few minutes circling the inner city, with stops including Circular Quay, Central train station, & Chinatown (from which it is short walk to Darling Harbour). Get off at Chinatown stop for Paddys market which is open Thursday - Sunday. Darling Harbour has lovely harbourside restaurants & a small shopping mall open late. The highlight though, since we are "Home & Away" tv fans, was catching the public bus (no. L90) from Wynyard (about 10 minutes walk from hotel) to Palm Beach where all the outdoor scenes are filmed on Mondays & Tuesdays. The bus trip takes about one&half hours but you see many lovely North Shore beaches on the way. Palm Beach is a small beautiful quiet beachside village. It has a windswept surf beach on one side and a quiet inlet on the other side. We visited the Home&Away "Surf Club" at the far end of the surf beach, and had a nice meal at the "Diner" cafe jutting out over the water at the jetty/wharf on the inlet beach. The surrounding bush covered rocky shores are very beautiful. We had a great holday in Sydney. This hotel is in a very posh, safe feeling street. I also recommend a Greek restaurant about 2 blocks up the steet - "Aesops". Feel free to contact me through trip advisor if you would like any more information.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy”
Reviews.Author: HILLS92
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this motel several times now with my business travel. The staff are very friendly. The Room service is a bit slow but worth the wait. The restaurant is very nice. It has a private personal feel. The rooms feel more at home than a normal Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: somersetbill
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to Circular Quay and, overall is very comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay apart from a two or three things: 1. We arrived early morning (around 9am) and the room wasn't ready (check in time is 3pm). The hotel did give us access to the gymn so that we could shower and they did store our cases in reception while we went out. But at 3pm the room still wasn't ready. At 3.30 I got a bit cross and the hotel told us we could have a better room - which we took. (I'm not sure if the room was any better - it had no view and no balcony - but it was huge.) I wonder if this is a constant problem with the hotel as there were suitcases in reception every morning. 2. The hotel is expensive and charge for every little extra such as power adaptors and for internet connection. (Why would I pay for internet connection when I can get it for free in the little cafe 100 yards away?) 3. The dining room in closed two nights a week.

Reviews.Title: “English style in Australia”
Reviews.Author: ozitravlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of the glowing TA reviews. Booked a Deluxe Room for two nights directly from the hotel website â€“ the â€œAdvance Saverâ€� package, full payment in advance, totally non-refundable. Arriving by cruise ship, were at the hotel about nine-ish on the Saturday morning. Did not expect to be able to get into a room straight away and indeed could not (as the hotel had been fully booked the night before), but the staff piled our many bags and bits and pieces in the lobby (along with those of some other cruise ship passengers) while we went uptown in search of shopping and lunch. (Front desk staff were pleasant and professional.) Able to get into a room eventually after one pm. It was described as a â€œHarbour Viewâ€� room, a bit of a stretch since it had only a partial glimpse of the water - above buildings and the Botanic Gardens. After the constraints of a cruise ship cabin for 30 days this seemed a vast room, the bathroom also with its double sinks and separate shower and toilet. (Did not like the fragrance of the toiletries supplied, however.) Nice to be able to open the Juliet balcony door for fresh air. Very comfortable room, had everything youâ€™d expect to find in this class of hotel, like robes, slippers, shoe cleaning service etc; but also an iron and ironing board, which isnâ€™t necessarily supplied. Did hear some road noise from the nearby Cahill Expressway. Also heard some noise from adjoining hotel room. Neither sufficiently loud to be bothersome.. One morning we had breakfast at the Sydney Cove Oyster Bar on the Quay, overlooking the water- recommend for food and ambience. (Lots of other attractive looking restaurants in this area.) Also tried the hotel buffet. Many have commented on the expense, but at $25 per person seems par for the course. Nice touch to have the facilities for squeezing fresh orange juice and making your own waffles. Reasonable selection, attractively presented. Staff seemed somewhat slow to bring fresh coffee, clear dirty plates. If you are planning on staying here post cruise, or plan to use public transport from the airport to the Quay, remember that it is a steep climb uphill from Circular Quay if you intend to lug suitcases. Overall, a pleasant place to stay, the very English hotel dÃ©cor is a change from modern minimalism. Donâ€™t understand the rave reviews, though.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: cgriffith_7
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for two nights - one night on the beginning of our trip, and one on the return. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel - it is a classic hotel, with tasteful furnishings, lovely lobby, and gigantic all-marble bathrooms with separate shower, oversized bathtub, and double sinks. Beds were very comfortable. Why we chose this hotel was because of the Tripadvisor ratings and its close proximity to the train station, ferries, Opera House, botanic garden, wonderful harbor restaurants, and a half block from the Hop-on Explorer Bus. While on that bus we drove past Darling Harbor, which appeared to cater more to the tourist crowd and to families (aquarium, monorail, etc.). We liked our location better - a little more quiet and right across the street from the botanic gardens. Staff were also very helpful. They were responsive to email questions before our stay, too, which is why the Hotel Intercontinental next door did not get our business. The only downside is what others have noted: no free internet. I think we paid $12 for an hour of internet - pretty pricey. But there wasn't a hotel we stayed at in New South Wales that didn't charge some fee for internet access. If I had to describe this hotel in two words, it would be classic elegance. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WILL DEFINITELY RETURN”
Reviews.Author: KatePerth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sir Stamford Circular Quay for two nights on our way to the US & Canada. I had never stayed down in the Circular Quay area before (always previously stayed near Haymarket) and was a little unsure as to whether I would like the location. Absolutely loved the hotel and location. The room was one of the biggest I have ever stayed in and was furnished beautifully. The bathroom was amazingly huge. All Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The bar was the perfect place for a pre or after dinner drink - again beautifully furnished. The rooftop pool area was small but adequate and a bbq was available. The hotel also featured some lovely rooms for conferences, meetings etc. The location was great, close to the ferry hub, heaps of restaurants and bars, the train, Opera House, the Rocks area and the wonderful "Aria" Restaurant run by celebrity chef, Matt Moran. I would have no hesitation in returning to this great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BannermanW
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford is perfectly located for the Opera House and Circular Quay. The service was excellent. The rooms are large and clean. We enjoyed the small roof top pool - a perfect refreshment after 24 hours of traveling. Our only disappointment was the buffet breakfast. As other reviewers have said, you will find better value and quality elsewhere. We booked thru Priceline at $195 per night which worked out well. Not cheap but you can not beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and Gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: julieanne
Reviews.Content: I booked this charming hotel through wotif.com and was a little worried in case our 'bargain price' meant we had a lesser room.Well, that was a waste of worries, as the hotel room we had here was a massive, antique-filled double room overlooking the botanical gardens. The bathroom was gorgeous too. Our welcome (much needed after a 22 hour flight from London) couldn't have been warmer or more helpful. While the fitness centre is a little on the small side, this is more than made up for by the adjacent outdoor terrace with recliners and even a bbq. The smallish open air rooftop pool is a perfect place for a refreshing dip, and you can see the Harbour Bridge (well, the edge of it) and Circular Quay from it. I recommend this hotel for its charming, helpful staff, lovely rooms (public and bedrooms) which have antiques as well as all mod cons, its smart bar and its perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: gurnall
Reviews.Content: Smaller than the typical chain big city hotels and feels a bit classier - if that matters (somewhat wasted on a scruff like me!). Very polite, professional staff. Arriving at 7am from the airport, there was no room available straight away (fair enough, I had not paid for an early check-in after all) but I was offered use of the facilities in the gym (shower etc) to freshen up which was all I actually needed before setting off for a day's sightseeing. My room was the biggest I have had in any hotel, clean and very well-equipped (including the essential safe, tea and coffee making tray and ironing board!). This was the cheapest "City View" room on the eighth floor. (Incidentally, despite the "Lowest Price Guarantee" on the hotel's own website, there was no mention there of the 3 nights for the price of 2 deal I got from hotels.com.) I could see much of the Bridge, a shell or two of the Opera House and the Museum of Contemporary Art out the window (no balcony) beyond nearer and less distinguished buildings - not altogether a picturesque view but I would not have paid extra for one. How much time do you spend looking out of a window anyway, especially in the winter when it gets dark early? The location is excellent: a very few minutes walk from the Circular Quay train, bus and (wonderful) ferry hub, the Opera House and (wonderful again) Royal Botanic Gardens. Easy walking distance to the Rocks, Harbour Bridge and even the City Centre along Macquarie Street. I did not eat in the hotel (seldom do in any hotel unless breakfast is included in the price). Overall, I think this is a very good hotel before taking price into account. For what I paid (and being used to UK hotel prices) it was an outstanding bargain.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in love”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTully
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed in. Gorgeous and classy with wonderful accommodating staff. So close to all the main attractions (literally a block walk from the Opera House and Circular Quay). I traveled with a young child who also loved it, especially the pool which was perfect for leasure at only 1m depth. Great for watching her swim without being to stressed about her in their alone. Such great value for money also. I will definitely never stay anywhere else again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: blueaudio
Reviews.Content: We originally looked at all the corporate brand hotels in Sydney, but found this on TripAdvisor and decided to try it based on the ratings and reviews. The location was absolutely perfect for us. We arrived on a long flight to Sydney from the U.S. and it was before check-in time, so we figured we might have to wait. They told us the room wasn't ready yet, but the front desk was very nice and we mentioned that it was our honeymoon so they said they would get the room ready as soon as possible. We hopped on a ferry over to Manly Beach for a few hours and came back to a surprise upgrade to a massive suite with 2 bathrooms and a doorbell in case you don't hear a knock on the door from the other room! It was a nice surprise, and all of the staff made us feel very welcome. As I mentioned, the location was really ideal because we could walk right down to the pier and the Opera House. We had dinner reservations at Aria Restaurant which is also right there on MacQuarie St, so it was really convenient. We also walked around the Royal Botanic Gardens. The only time we really needed to take a cab was when we wanted to go to Surry Hills to check out some restaurants there. Overall, this hotel is way better than any downtown, and we got a much better deal than paying for one of the corporate hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: ElvisPriscilla87
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very plush and luxurious. The rooms were absolutely beautiful and the staff exceptional. It was very clean and the furnishings were gorgeous. The room was also quiet and the bathroom was really lovely. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quality establishment with staff that actually care about their guests needs.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, from an experienced Australian Traveler”
Reviews.Author: millie-marie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sir Stamford in May of 2009 for my last few days before returning to the states. I checked in at around 8p.m. and was immediately taken care of, concierge even went to the pharmacy and filled a prescription for me. Even if I hadn't been a student and spent most of my travel time in Hostels/backpacking I am use to nice hotels and have stayed in many throughout the world, this ranks high amongst them. in addition to providing excellent ideas for things close by while it was raining. I have been to Sydney many times and Sir Stamford is simply one of the best hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Did not go above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Bluejello
Reviews.Content: I expect a five star luxury hotel to go above and beyond, but we didn't even get average. We booked the "Jet Lag Recovery Package" which according to the Sir Stamford website, "High Priority early check in (6:00 am)" and "High Priority late check out (6:00 pm)" and "Upgrade to the next room type." "Terms and conditions: The package is subject to availability." Our flight from Los Angeles landed at 6:10 am so we thought this package was perfect and my boyfriend called to make sure a room was available because I made a big fuss about wanting a shower after 22 hours of flying as soon as we got to the hotel. Upon check in at the desk, the gentleman (who looked barely 18) said our room would not be ready until 3:00 p.m. He was not aware of the "Jet Lag Recovery Package" on the website. He did not even try to look it up. He simply printed off a piece of paper and handed it to us to sign and said he would hold our luggage until 3:00 p.m. Where are we suppose to go at 6:00 in the morning? Where is this "high priority" that was mentioned on the website? When we insisted that such a package exists, he then asked us whether the website said it was a guarantee. We said we called about availability. He then said the only way to guarantee a room was to check in the night before to guarantee a room in the morning? Please explain to me how that sentence has any logic? So in order to get a room for the day that we want, we have to check in the day before? Can you imagine if all the hotels in all the world had such a policy? It doesn't make any sense, at least to anyone with a brain. When his colleague who was helping another guest check out overheard him speaking to us, he simply said do what you have to do to get them a room. Even the guest that was checking out offered us his room and said it can't possibly take that long to clean it since he only slept in it for one night. But thankfully, the other colleague was now able to assist us. He got on his computer and switched a few rooms around offered us a room on the second floor. His effort to get a us room was the type of service I had expected in the beginning. The room was nice and clean. The bathroom was gorgeous with a tub and separate shower and double sink vanity. There was also a separate water closet which I have never seen. The marble tiles in the bathroom were beautiful but made my feet cold from walking around barefoot. I didn't discover the slippers until too late. I did find the nice bathrobe. There were not enough hooks for the bath towels. Only one hook on the back of the door. There was a rod by the tub but that was too far to reach when getting out of the separate shower across the room. We did not have a nice view of the harbour or the gardens, just the back of another building. The room was quiet and still lovely nonetheless. We liked the fact that there were two wine glasses by the ice bucket. Speaking of wine, as a surprise, I ordered a gourmet gift basket and bottle of wine to be delivered to the hotel upon our arrival. When it did not arrive by the second day, I finally had to go to the front desk with my boyfriend to inquire about it. They did not know anything about it. Someone even checked a log book for deliveries but said they have no record of it. But she kindly offered to call the company for me. Disappointed that my surprise was ruined, we went back up to our room. Within a few minutes, a hotel staffer brought up the package and said they found it in the concierge room. I was very disappointed that it was not delivered and placed in our room ahead of time and that if I had not asked about it, it never would have been delivered. It makes me distrustful that if anyone needed anything important delivered to the hotel, that it would never make it to the person in a timely manner, if at all. I was also not impressed with the lack of a doorman. Every time when we arrived back at the hotel, there was no one to greet us whether it was in the morning or the evening. We always had to walk around the hotel lobby looking for a valet to hand the car keys off. I am used to someone walking straight up to our car as we drive up and open the door for me but this never happened at Sir Stamford. I attribute this to the "smallness" of the hotel which was the very reason that I chose Sir Stamford in the first place. I thought it would be nice to stay at a smaller, older, and charming hotel instead of a larger, modern chain hotel. I really thought the service would be more "intimate." I do have to say that when I called room service just once to get two forks so we could have dessert and drink our wine in the room, not even before I hung up the phone, someone was at the door with two forks. That was the fastest room service ever in any hotel that I have experienced! I really didn't think the hotel staff went above and beyond to provide a five star quality stay. There were many little things that they could have done immediately such as the check in process and the delivery of the wine that would have made our stay there wonderful. Small gestures really do count but unfortunately, we did not experience any of that.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: seagullrob
Reviews.Content: We (father and son) chose this hotel due to (1) its proximity to the Sydney Opera House for a Ben Folds concert (we didnâ€™t want to walk too far afterwards), (2) the deal available on one of those last minute hotel sites for the type of room we wanted (about half price), and (3) the good reviews on Trip Advisor. Ben Folds was extraordinary, and the support act, Oh Mercy, were good too. The Sir Stamford lived up to the reviews, with a large comfortable twin room and bathroom, tea/coffee making, room safe, mini bar, internet access, CD player, in-house movies, gym and roof-top pool. The staff were friendly and helpful and we had a bit of a view of Circular Quay from our tiny balcony. The location was the best â€“ the Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay, the Rocks and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. We had breakfast by the Harbour near the Opera House overlooking the Bridge, and dinner at the Rocks, all within easy walking distance. It only took us 10 minutes to walk to the Opera House. The Sydney Harbour Bridge climb deserves a special mention â€“ it was expensive, but was really impressive. Highly recommended. If the deal was right, and we needed to be in this general area, weâ€™d readily stay here again, without any hesitation whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great service, and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RedEyedTreeFrog
Reviews.Content: A truly excellent location, close to all transportation and a few steps away from the lovely botanical gardens and the Opera House. Lovely rooms, very clean and a magnificent bathroom. Our room had a balcony and was quite large. Extremely comfortable beds. The service and concierge staff was the best, all very friendly and accommodating. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone I know traveling to Sydney and if I go back, I will stay there again. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pocketz77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful it was beautiful and the staff was very helpful. I would only stay by circular quay. From this location everything was easy to get to. I read the reviews and choose the hotel after reading them. There was one thing never mentioned. The hotel is by a hill. Going to the quay was great because you are going down hill but after a long day of exploring and walking, coming back and facing that hill was a challenge. You can not beat the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JWSFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very elegant and extremely comfortable. The location was excellent and, after travelling through Sydney, would not stay in any other area than the Circular Quay. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and my wife and I enjoyed our stay. Directly across the street was the Botanical Garden and anyone staying at the hotel should wander over there to see the trees filled with flying foxes and the flocks of cockatoos. If you bring some treats, the cockatoos will eat out of your hand. There are plenty of restaurants in walking distance. The Opera House and Circular Quay are 5 minutes walk and the Rocks is 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: 2ys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a total gem. We had been disappointed by 5 star hotels in Sydney before and after reading reviews on Tripadvisor decided to give Sir Stamford a go. From the booking staff (including a confirmation call in which they remembered that it was a girls trip and wished us well for our first stage in the Hunter Valley) through to checkout the staff were amazing. The rooms were great (two very comfrotable double beds in the twin rooms) with such a fabulous oldy world charm to them. The location is perfect - a short walk to shopping and an even shorter walk to the Quay but non of the hustle bustle noise you expect of Sydney. In fact the only noise to be prepared for is from the hall (who orders breakfast for 5 am for goodness sake!) or through the interconnecting doors and even that wasnt too bad. The fact that this hotel thrilled 6 prettty picky princesses says it all - as does the fact that we all have plans to go back with our familys. The way the interconnecting rooms were set up made us all think it will be perfect for a getaway with the kids. The value for money is fantistic with two interconnecting twin rooms costing the same as a single room in most other hotels around. I highly recommend a swim in the rooftop pool (we went at sunset and it was MAGIC) and the room service coffee was the best we had on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: seaview088
Reviews.Content: This is one of my old favourite hotels - like slipping on a pair of comfy slippers. After a long day in Sydney it's such a delight to return to the peaceful surrounds of the Sir Stamford Hotel. The rooms are large and comfortably furnished and the service is in keeping with a 5 star hotel. With a central location, the Sir Stamford is well positioned for guests to walk to most places within Sydney's CBD and to access public transport for others. This is just an all round good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid. The others can only try to emulate this establishment.”
Reviews.Author: zarathustraperth
Reviews.Content: We've just been spoilt. Spoilt so badly that the thud back too home life has left bruises. The quality of staff, decor and location, place the Sir Stamford CQ at the pinnacle of excellence in Sydney. If your ideal is concrete and glass suspended well above the heart of this city, immune to the gentle breezes and vibrant sounds, (when desired), then this hotel is not for you. However, if you wish to experience Manhatten service, grand English country house decor coupled with a gentlemans club style bar and food that is fresh and well prepared then please do yourself a favour and base yourself here. Myself and three family journied home after ten days of memorable experience but agreed there was none better than our two nights at SSCQ.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DocAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: We had a wondeful week at the Sir Stamford and highly recommend it to others. The rooms are large including the bathrooms. The staff always nice and accomodating. The only issue was that our climate system was always putting out hot air. So, we had to keep our balcony door open the whole time to cool off the room. This wasn't so bad except for the noise from the road. The resturant at the hotel is fairly pricey--so we ate all our meals out. If you would like free coffee and tea delivered to your room in the morning--make sure to ask for a wake-up call. It was a great way to start the day. We ate breakfast at Pancakes on the Rocks, Mrabella--which is in the business building right behind the Sir Stamford and Central Q. The pancakes were great but our consistent favorite was Mirabella. Reasonable priced food that was very good. Sydney is a great city even in the winter. Everyone is very nice the food is wonderful and there are many interesting sites to see.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed in (and there's been a few)”
Reviews.Author: feles06
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days in Sydney, for pleasure and chose the Sir Stamford for the availability and room rate. I was a little dubious as other reviews had said the hotel was looking 'tired'. However, we were thrilled with the whole experience. Perhaps there has been some redecoration since the earlier reviews. Our room was huge with lounge furniture and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was also spacious with twin basins, separate shower (good pressure),separate toilet enclosure (in the bathroom), plenty of mirrors and for the first time in my life, decent lighting in the bathroom. Really enjoyed the Olde Worlde decor and excellent service provided by the bar staff. Minor gripe is that a more extensive wine list would be apprediated. Hotel close to CBD shopping and Circular Quay for transport - bus, train and ferry. Our preferred hotel from now on whenever we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: midlands1time
Reviews.Content: I wanted to add my review to the others,as I based my stay at the Sir Stamford on the recommendations of Tripadvisor. My Husband and I arrived at 7am after long flight from UK. The Reception staff and Concierge were very welcoming and, informed us that a room would be available within the hour. we were delighted, as Check in time was not until 2pm. I did send an e-mail prior to arrival advising of our early arrival was was informed that they would do their best, but could not guarantee a room availability at that hour. We felt very fortunate in our choice of Hotels and our stay was wonderful. The room was lovely, with views over the harbour. Thank you everyone who takes the time to add feedback on Tripadviser, as I was planning my trip, I was overwhelmed with choices. It is these sort of comments which can sway the balance.

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maddison Clare
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels. It is a small boutique hotel and the service is wonderful. The rooms are large and although the furnishings are probably in need or replacement, the style is plush and tasteful. Breakfast is wonderful and the quality of foos great. The hotel is close to Circular Quay and a short walk to Martin PIace.I love this hotel and much prefer it to the large impersonal hotels usually found in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location - fantastic breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: yummymummyWellington
Reviews.Content: Myself and my 2 children aged 12 and 17 stayed here for one night en route to the Uk from NZ. The Hotel was easy to find from Circular Quay Station - btw from the airport it is probably cheaper and quicker to use a taxi as the train cost us $40 and took about 45mins, we got a taxi back to the airport the next day and it cost the same. It is very impressive when you walk in and the staff welcomed us straight away - the concierge took our bags off us and showed us to reception to check in. I booked this a week before and the rate included breakfast the next day. We were shown to our room and were told how to work everything. The room was spacious and nicely decorated - not modern style, more old fashioned and grand. The children were very impressed. Breakfast the next day was wonderful! It was called the 'bountiful' breakfast - there was so much to choose from and you were attended to at all times. The food was fresh and hot, the cooked breakfast wasn't left to congeal and was replenished frequently. Unusual freshly squeezed juices were available, pastries, different types of bread, fresh tea and coffee. It was amazing and a great start to a day of sight seeing. I must say the the decor in this hotel was impressive, the staff were attentive and helpful and the room extremely comfortable. It was close to all amenities and across the road from the botanic gardens, a short walk to the opera house and the harbour bridge. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for an indulgent weekend”
Reviews.Author: pigandtoad
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights and were highly impressed with all aspects of the hotel, the room was huge, clean comfortable and the service was excellent. We booked a winter snuggler package via Wotif and got a good rate. On the day we arrived I asked them to book a restaurant for a special dinner with views of the harbour (for that night!) The receptionist called around several restaurants and booked us a table with lovely views at Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant.”
Reviews.Author: JonnySLondon
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a great location for the Opera House, Circular Quay and the CBD. The style is "old fashioned", but I mean that in a good way. We had one of the cheaper rooms but it was large and the bathroom was spacious too. Service was excellent throughout. The only thing wrong was that housekeeping didn't automatically replace the milk used for tea and coffee on two of the four days we stayed there but it only took a call to reception and replacements were brought up to the room within a couple of minutes.
