I did think that the selection of cocktails available in the bar seemed rather unappealing, but maybe that's just me.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Plexiaw
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place! We stayed for 3 nights in May. We arrived at 7am and stopped by to drop off our luggage, but the service was great as they let us have our room immediately! Location was the best, 1 block up the hill from the Circular Quay train station, opera house, botantical gardens - great place to anchor for touring the CBD. Rooms were top notch, comfortable, with a nice balcony overlooking the harbor. Receptionists were helpful and accommodating. We typically like chain-hotels where we know what we'll get, but couldn't have been more pleased with this boutique hotel. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: AussieAtLarge
Reviews.Content: After much agonising I opted for the Sir Stamford as a special retreat for my girlfriend on her birthday. It was the right choice. We were immediately upgraded on check-in and had a magnificent room on Level 9 that afforded a 180 degree view from the Botanic Gardens to The Rocks from the balcony. The staff were all exceptional, the high tea and breakfast were miles above average and the whole place exudes a warmth and charm. It feels like a grand European B&B right in the middle of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Heritage Property and Views”
Reviews.Author: utkarshmorarka
Reviews.Content: We were staying at another location for one night before we shifted to the Sir Stamford Plaza. there was a last minute cancellantion and the reception staff, when they found out we were on our honey moon, quickly switched things around to give us the best room available at short notice. The rom afforded a view of both, the Opera house and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The service was excellent and worth every penny that we spent at this extravagant hotel. Walking distance from everything a tourist wants to see in Sydney, this is the ideal spot for Honeymooners with deep pockets, ask for room number 911, it has got the best view from the balcony by far

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for 2 nights for friend birthday”
Reviews.Author: uptonuponsevern
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great service, 10 min walk to opera hse, great rooms with a good selection of food, only spent two nights to celebrate friend birthday & would have loved to have stayed longer. within a short walk to all the main attractions in sydney city centre, very professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Old world view of the Opera House”
Reviews.Author: TheQueenslander
Reviews.Content: Sir Stamford on Circular Quay was specifically selected for a 70th birthday celebration and it fitted the bill perfectly. The hotel building combines the heritage Health Department building and a 1970's wing - not much to look at from the outside, but has spacious rooms decked in old-world furnishings. If reproduction french-polished furniture, plush upholstery and wallpaper are your thing, this hotel will fit the bill. Higher floors offer views of Sydney Harbour (not the Bridge) and Opera House, over the top of the Botanic Gardens which is across the road. Its timber-panelled foyer, dining, bar and library all follow the theme of european old-world and offer a comfortable retreat from the very busy Circular Quay area which is only the next street away. Easy stroll downhill to the Opera House, 10 minutes to the art galleries and Rocks area meant that touring by foot was easy. This area is perfect for those who want to see the Bridge, Opera House and easily access the ferries and harbour tours. Further away however, is Darling Harbour, Chinatown and the CBD shopping area, which was better accessed using buses, ferries and monorail. Breakfast was laid out as an opulent buffet, but offered a standard Aussie cooked breakfast in addition to a selection of cold meats, cereal, fruit and pastries. No asian brekkie dishes here, nor on-hand chefs to cook up your favourite omelette. Ours was included in tariff, which made it all the more enjoyable. The piano bar in the older section is atmospheric with it panelling, Steinway and oil paintings; it offers a fussy tea experience, makes an almost acceptable coffee and good for a drink after a night out. Not cheap though. Neither is their internet facility. We enjoyed their small 5th-floor rooftop pool and sauna; the gym is well kitted out and the outdoor terrace pleasant enough. The extensive use of energy-saver lightbulbs in every fixture and lamp detracts from the room atmosphere, giving everyone a pallid grey fluro glow - but hey, it's poignant to point out that we were staying here during Earth Hour. The hotel also smells old. Its warmth is to be found in its old world plushness and from the friendly service we experienced from all the staff (especially in the bar). Definitely not for the aficionados of minimalist decor, nor for those who expect pristine spaces from their 5 star hotels. Whilst not an overly opulent experience, nor particularly extensive in facility, Sir Stamford can be recommended for location, pleasant hospitality and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: RanDReigate
Reviews.Content: Stayed only for 1-night (alas) on way back home from New Zealand. What a great find. Opera House, Circular Quay and The Rocks all within few minutes. Staff were the best we have come across in a long time. Room was good size and overlooked the park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, unbeatable location.”
Reviews.Author: SKCTokyo
Reviews.Content: Sydney has the best airport-downtown connection I've ever seen anywhere in the world. I'm not prone to using public transportation (given the security risks), but the train from the international terminal to Circular Quay, the hub of downtown, takes 20 minutes, it's inexpensive, and faster than a taxi. The Sir Stamford is a 5-minute walk from the train station, if you know the way, or can find someone who does. The hotel is also just across the street from the Botanical Gardens and close to the museums. The location is perfect. The lobby, rooms and general ambiance are excellent. The staff, however, while enthusiastically friendly, are minimally knowledgeable about Sydney and in some cases, about the hotel itself. Witness the concierge guy who didn't know that the hotel restaurant right behind him wasn't open. But, counter that with the concierge who realizing that she had not gotten a required signature, ran a few hundred meters (in high heels) to catch up with me and get it. If I gave five-star ratings, this hotel would probably get it. Keep in mind that 20 minutes on the train and five minutes to the hotel from the international terminal is reason enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - just 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay & the Opera House”
Reviews.Author: Birds29
Reviews.Content: We had booked their jet lag recovery programme as we were arriving at Sydney Airport at 7.00 am. When we arrived at 8.30am, we were told our room was not ready and were asked to wait in the lounge for 10 minutes. Within a few minutes we were shown to our room, which was large with a settee, armchair, coffee table and desk. The bathroom was huge, with 2 wash bowls and a shower big enought to have a party in! Our room also had a small balcony which overlooked Circular Quay. Whilst we were there, the cruise liner Queen Victoria was moored there and in view from our room. The continental breakfast was adequate, but there was a not a lot of choice compared to other hotels. The concierge staff were helpful in recommending places to visit and eat. The botanic gardens are just across the road from hotel and well worth a visit, if only to see the giant veggie bats, hanging from the trees. Although we didn't swim in the heated swimming pool, we did relax on the loungers around the pool late one afternoon. The Sir Stamford is a relatively small hotel, furnished very much in a 'colonial' style with beautiful flower arrangements. We noticed from some of the other reviews that guests have complained about the 'hill'. In our opinion, it was a gentle slope up from Circular Quay to the hotel. We are in our 60's and not that athletic and we didn't find it a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Old world luxury”
Reviews.Author: Roverwestmidlands
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and have good views. Beautifully appointed. Excellent location, (especially if you are going to the Sydney opera house).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay except for 1 thing - the hike up the hill!”
Reviews.Author: Ginger54
Reviews.Content: 4 of us arrived at the Sir Stamford for our 1-night pre-cruise stay after traveling for nearly 24 hours from the USA. Even though it was only 1030AM, 3 out of 4 of our rooms were ready, which was SUCH a relief. We took our luggage to our rooms, washed our faces and headed out to look for food and to do some sightseeing. The wonderful Chief Concierge Kieran told us about the AMP Plaza food hall 2 blocks away with many food choices. It was a brilliant suggestion! We could all have what we wanted to eat and for a very reasonable price! So fortified, we headed out to do some shopping and sightseeing before collapsing. The Sir Stamford is across the street from the Sydney Botanical Gardens (which we visited the next morning) and is up a steep hill from the Opera House, the CBD, the Rocks and Circluar Quay. To paraphrase what another Trip Advisor reviewer said in their review : "the walk up and down the street from the Sir Stamford to the Circluar Quay area is very steep and so not good for someone with walking difficulties. " I would absolutely agree with that. 3 out of 4 of our group were age 75+ and all of them complained about the 'hike" back up the hill to the hotel. If we all went to Sydney again, I would book us in to the Marriott Circluar Quay or somewhere else down the hill on the flat area surrounding Circular Quay. The hotel itself, the former Ritz Carlton, is very comfortable and does not seem to be showing its age. We all had king-bedded rooms that had a sitting areas with sofa, easy chair and coffee table. My corner room was larger than the other ladies' and had a tiny French balcony and a huge marble bathroom with separate shower & tub, while their rooms all had a shower/tub combination. The bathrobes, wall safe, slippers and tons of pillows were welcome additions. The bed was extremely comfortable and I got a great night's sleep. The TV was in an armoire but worked fine and the water temperature & pressure in the shower were fine. The air conditioning was very welcoming and worked perfectly. We did not have the breakfast buffet because it was not included in the price of our room and was very expensive. The staff was SO wonderful - informative, helpful, accommodating. Very, very good staff. I would stay there again just for the staff!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Cinder53
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Sir Stamford Hotel in late January 2009. I got the room via Priceline for a bargain, hoping it would at least be livable. I have to say, it was an excellent boutique hotel. We arrived bleary eyed at 8:00a.m., understanding that it was unlikely our room would be ready. They welcomed us, and said our room was ready immediately. After showers, and a cup of coffee, we were able to get on with sightseeing, a little less jet lagged. The room was large and spacious, with a marble bathroom with separate shower and tub and double sinks. Most importantly, the hotel was a BRIEF walk (less than 5 minutes) from the Ferries and Opera House, so it was in a great location, directly across the street from the Botanic Gardens. There was a nice pub-like bar, that we used for light snacks, but I don't think their big dining room was open. There was a small rooftop pool, but I didn't use it, with so much to do. Staff was professional and helpful, guiding us toward things to do. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I would use them again anytime I travel to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel like a King!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IT_Dude666
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the New Years Eve period, was a bit pricy but you feel like Royalty. The staff were very corteous. Loved the room - the plush Sofa and the Marble bathroom - exquisite. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with agreat location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay prior to a cruise. The location is excellent, about two short blocks from the warf. The room and bath are very large with a separate shower and small balcony. The furnishings are a little dated, but comfortable. The concierge and staff were extremely helpful. The buffet breakfast was excellent. One of the best we have ever had. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mark_From_Melbourne1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Stamford Grand in Glenelg we figured this would be a nice hotel but we were amazed at how nice it is. It's a relatively small hotel but the service was amazing and the location is ideal. On check-in the concierge carried our bags to our room and very politely explained all of the features of the hotel and then the room itself. We had an 8th floor room with a small step-on balcony. Features like the marble bathroom give an idea of the age of the property but it is all in excellent condition. The only thing I could critique at all would be the TV - it's probably time they started to use LCD tv sets and the reception was a little substandard. But maybe I'm just too used to digital tv? The concierge were always happy to help with maps, directions and suggestions. In fact, when booking I mentioned we were going to Acer arena the night we arrived and at check-in they gave us train routes there and a map of the venue and surrounding area. Service was excellent. Location is also excellent - 2 minutes from Circular Quay Ferry and Train Station, 2 minutes from the Opera House, and a short walk to the Rocks and Harbour Bridge. The only common feature of Sydney that's a bit removed is Darling Harbour (which is full of restaurants and bars). A taxi from Darling Harbour to the hotel was only $17 though and there are train options to get there if you prefer. Overall - we loved our stay at Sir Stamford and will certainly make it our #1 choice for any return visits to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: Raithscotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in January 09, a fantastic location to explore the Sydney Harbour. Very easy to get to from the airport and only a short walk from the train station. We were upgraded to a room with a bigger balcony which was nice, and it was only a few metres from the pool, we have a kid so that was perfect. At night we ordered room service as our son was feeling the effects of traveling all day. We waited 45 minutes and called down to reception to ask where our meals were. The receptionist apologised and said that the order was misplaced and we would not have to pay for it. The order was now "being rushed" after another 30 minute wait our food arrived. At breakfast in the morning i ordered omelette and when it came i was the wrong one, the guy next to me had ordered one as well and it was wrong as well. I thought it was my Scottish accent but the other guy was Australian. The pool is small but good for a refreshing dip and the rooms are of a good standard and clean. On check out they tried to charge for our in room dining fiasco, so it is well worth double checking your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margoireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, excellent staff so helpful and polite.The rooms are very spacious and the breakfasts are excellent. It is very central just a short walk to the Opera House and the Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: bilkoa
Reviews.Content: The Sir Stamford is a lovely property, close to Circular Quay and all the cafes and restaurants, also very close to the Opera House. If you walk to keep fit then the Hotel is right beside the Botanic Gardens where you can easily do a morning walk. Breakfasts were good although a little expensive. The rooms are large with a gorgeous spacious marble bathroom. Furnishings are in keeping with the style of the property, lots of big, soft lounges, antique fittings and a quiet, plush atmosphere. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and did me a great favour”
Reviews.Author: MrSamuels
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you this. I stumbled across the Stamford when I needed a room in Sydney on short notice a few months ago. Accidentally got booked on the third floor which has its own luxurious central lounge. Loved it. Next stay in Sydney, I naturally booked at the Stamford, third floor. Loved it. They even let a business colleague come in for a breakfast meeting in the third floor lounge at a nominal charge. How classy did I feel !! Today, I needed to hold a one hour meeting in Sydney with two lawyers. I don't have an office there, so I called the Stamford and explained that I had stayed with them a couple of times and maybe could they let me use the third floor lounge for a small meeting. They were fantastic. I would happily have paid a couple of hundred bucks for such a nice venue for an hour. Because I was a returning guest, they let me use it for the price of the coffee we drank. Now, I don't want to imply that you can stay at the Stamford and then be assured free facilities on business trips. But I do have to say that they were friendly, flexible, accomodating and made me proud that I have become a regular in such a short time. As if I'd consider staying elsewhere after this great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: ghanno
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The hotel is not that close to the shopping part of the CBD. Rather, it is at East Circular Quay which is near the Opera House, Domain and Museum of Contemporary Art (MCA). It would be about a ten minute walk to Hyde Park, which is closer to the very centre. ROOM: We stayed in a standard room with a queen size bed which was very comfortable. The interior decoration of the room reflects the â€˜old world charmâ€™ of the entire hotel. As such, it can look a little tired. Our room also had a very small balcony which looked out onto the buildings next door which was quite nice. There is a TV although it isnâ€™t flat screen and there are not as many channels available but there are movies on-demand, including several recent releases. The marble bathroom is quite spacious and they provide products such as shampoo, conditioner, moisturiser, body gel and soaps. One of the wonderful things about this hotel is that they provided bathrobes and slippers â€“ something thatâ€™s not found at every hotel. There is in-room broadband internet access if you have your own computer but itâ€™s only possible to purchase it at a cost of $29 for a 24-hour period. SERVICE: When we arrived at 11.30am, our room was already ready. The concierge at the hotel was particularly helpful and everyone was generally really friendly. I was impressed with the prompt, efficient and polite service. AMENITIES: There is a very small gym on the fifth floor (which is hard to find) and the equipment is not very modern at all. There is also a sauna and an outdoor swimming pool with a quaint little courtyard area. IN-ROOM DINING: The meal we ordered arrived within 16 minutes which was quite prompt and the food was of generally good quality. The menu is also somewhat more affordable than most other five star hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Wanted: The Grey Lady on Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: Marfak
Reviews.Content: I have been to Sydney four times and have always stayed at the Marriott on Circular Quay. (See my prior review.) On this trip, I was looking at three weeks in-and-out of Sydney and I was taking my wife. She likes older hotels, and the Marriott was over $100 more than the Sir Stamford, so based on the generally good reviews and my own visual inspection from a prior trip, that's where we stayed. It was a good choice. This hotel was formerly the Ritz Carlton. It is located on Macquarie Street in the Circular Quay area and is walking distance to the ferries, the Opera House, the park, and The Rocks. Great location. The hotel itself is smaller and greying. It has all of the wood wainscotting and panelling and paintings and charm of an old English hotel. The rooms are very large and well-furnished. The bathrooms are also large with lots of marble. Service is casual and friendly. We upgraded to the Executive Floor and enjoyed the breakfasts and the afternoon pre-dinner nosh. Even on nights when they had a full house it was quiet. There is a restaurant on premisis (we did not eat there) and a bar called The Bar with a piano player on most nights. The Concierge was very helpful with restaurant and tour recommendations. Having said this, the hotel is greying and could use a refurbishment. I noticed several occurrences of peeling plaster, or a stain on the carpet, or a crack in the wall. Nothing major, but it was there. This keeps it from being a five star property, in my view, and some folks who are perfectionists might find it very off-putting. But when you add everything up (location, price, service, size of the rooms, furnishings) this is a solid four star hotel. We would definitely stay there again if in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel and excellent concierge”
Reviews.Author: lanzainsight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a 10 night stay in September, due to my daughter getting married in Sydney.Arrived early evening with daughter and now son-in-law in tow, check-in went smoothly and we spent a couple of hours in the bar catching up. Hotel bar quite dark, but felt comfortable and sophisticated. The hotel room was large with plenty of sitting area, also a very large bathroom with separate shower. We enjoyed the view over the Botanical Gardens and views of harbour and the busy roads in front didn't disturb us. We were visited by cockatoos and watched the Ibis nesting in the trees opposite from our small balcony. We found the concierge staff excellent and they helped us book a show, find our way around and were excellent pleasant and helpful, especially when we were leaving and trying to find our way out of Sydney. All staff, especially at front desk area were friendly and pleasant. We liked the old style of the hotel, it didn't feel like just another box. The public areas weren't enormous but were elegant and comfortable. The hotel swimming pool isn't very big nor is the patio area around it but few people seemed to use this facility as there is just so much to do and see in Sydney. Breakfasts in the main dining room were more than adequate but the chef did seem to have some problems with the concept of 'over easy' fried eggs but I mostly had the wonderful omelettes that they could whip up. We thought the breakfasts were quite good and generally the service, although perhaps not experienced as could have been, were friendly and helpful. Only one day did one of the restaurant manager(s) try to rush out and close down the buffet rather promptly. The bar food was quite good too. Overall all an excellent stay and we appreciated the chocolate dipped strawberries left in our room the first evening. Room cleaned by the invisible maids, although a turn down service not offered, it didn't bother us in the slightest. We didn't use the internet so can't comment on this aspect. Highly recommend front desk and concierge. Perhaps the only down side was although in a very central location near circular quay, the walk up and down the street which leads to quay is very steep and so not good for someone with walking difficulties. Would we stay again, well if we ever make it to wonderful australia again and sydney, the answer is a definite yes.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: katesjourneys
Reviews.Content: Terrific location across from a lovely, large garden. Only a few blocks from excellent restaurants, ferries and shops at The Rocks. Easy walk to the Opera House. Very helpful, friendly, yet professional staff. Lovely rooms, elegant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: psq063
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sir Stamford for three nights and took the Quay lounge package. Our whole experience was absolutely fantastic and I would not hesitate in returning. We booked a package which included a room on the quay floor with access to the quay lounge and the extras that come with it and we were not disappointed. The hotel is of yesteryear in style but not dated and not worn. The carpets in the rooms are fresh and the decor clean. The feel of the hotel is intimate and welcoming- you don't feel like "just another number" The hotel is right across from the gardens, a minute or so to the Opera House and coming out of the hotel turn right, gown down the hill and you're in Circular Quay ready to catch a ferry. Valet parking was a breeze and the helpful staff showed us the facilities of our room upon check in. The room was large with an enormous bathroom- the shower with it;'s own light (only down point of the whole room was a tiny shelf in the shower) double sinks, seperate toilet (ability to shut its door) and bath, Balcony overlooking the back or Circular Quay- double doors- Bliss! The bed was comfortable and we had a pillow menu to choose from. We took advantage of the free pre dinner drinks and canapes in the quay lounge and enjoyed both. Staff members were in attendance but kept their distance enough so we were comfortable. Breakfast was served in the Quay lounge- tables set with white linen, china and cutlery. An attending staff member (who was just lovely) bought out breakfast plates for us featuring fresh juices, fruit salad and cheese or quiche or other delights. We were able to self serve coffee, tea, juice, toast and pastries from the side buffets of the lounge. Then were able to order cooked breakfast (or cereals) from the menu. The best part about this was meals arrived piping hot- as opposed to normal hotel buffets. We dined in the bar one night which has lovely old world charm. The wedges with sweet chilli sauce, guacamole and sour cream were delicious are were the fries and aioli. The cocktails were delicious too. The concierge got us a booking at an acclaimed (though disappointing) restaurant at last minute. The staff were all generally welcoming and kind- each greeting us as we entered and left the hotel. Getting a taxi, or our car from valet never took too long. Our room keys stopped working in the lift twice but the issue was quickly attended to by staff. Our only slightly disappointing experience was breakfast on our last day- a Saturday. We had a different staff member attending who was constantly sniffing throughout our breakfast and who was quite noisy getting cutlery and plates out for other guests (or was she putting them away? not sure) It just hindered the relaxing breakfast experience slightly with clanging and sniffing! I would not hesitate in recommending the hotel- and would definitely take advantage of the quay lounge facilities again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok.”
Reviews.Author: Ria_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in July & paid $180 service was good, room was huge but it annoyed me that there wasn't a plug for my laptop near the bed or that to use the iron you ended up standing in the most awkward position & the water pressure was pretty rubbish. I also noted that there was a used shower cap on the back of the bathroom door that was there for my entire stay but otherwise it was clean. However it was perfectly adequate if not instantly forgettable but vastly better than other places I've stayed for more money. Yes I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Closest and Best Hotel to Opera House”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel009
Reviews.Content: For service, comfort, location, and amenities, this is one of the best hotels we've stayed in. Two short blocks to the Opera House. Full concierge service which was absolutely fantastic. Older hotel with upgraded rooms. Part of a small SE Asia chain named after the Sir Stamford Raffles of Singapore fame. Superb on-site dining, as well as an upscale classic mahogany fixtured English club bar. Stay out of touristy Darling Harbor. This place is only a down hill short walk to the the ferries and tour buses which will get your anywhere you want to go in the Sydney area. Can't recommend more highly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our requirements at NYE”
Reviews.Author: bonjovirock
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit late writing this but we stayed at the Sir Stamford for 5 nights over New Year's Eve 2007. We chose the hotel since it was honestly the only one that could offer us two room for 4 adults at a price over NYE that didn't break the bank (although it came pretty close)! We were a little unsure what to expect having looked at the website but I have to say that it does not do the hotel justice. But, I'm getting ahead of myself... We arrived pretty bleary eyed very early in the morning after flying straight through from the UK. Our rooms were not yet available (we were not suprised by this since it is such a busy time of year). However, we were offered a pass key which allowed us to take our luggage up the gym where we could make full use of the showers/hairdryers etc and change our clothing. This was wonderful and allowed us to head out into the morning sunshine to enjoy our first day in Sydney feeling very refreshed. Our luggage was left in storage and when we returned later in the afternoon to check in our bags had already been placed in our rooms. The reception staff were lovely and seemed genuinely pleased to welcome guests to the hotel. Our 2 rooms on the 5th (I think!) floor (one twin and one King) were an unexpected delight. Both were spacious and airy, with sitting area, desk and double doors opening onto a Juliet balcony. We were at the back of the hotel but had a pleasant view to Circular Quay. The bed was extremely comfortable, with a cotton sheet and duvet. Tea and coffee making facilities were provided in the room along with a safe. The bathroom consisted of two sinks, a bath tub and a shower cubicle, all in marble finishings. There were bathrobes, slippers and an abundance of towels. The room was very clean, not at all worn and all linens were clean and fresh. We used the wireless internet (fee) and it worked very well. We did not eat at the hotel but the restaurant always looked busy at breakfast time. We did frequent the bar for a night cap once or twice. This is in the oldest part of the hotel and well worth a look. Concierge was very helpful and managed to arrange car hire for a day at the VERY last minute on a public holiday. The gym was small but useful for an indoor run or basic workout. The pool was also small but better than nothing in our opinion. For our particular visit over New Year the hotel had a perfect location. Just one block from Circular Quay and opposite the Botanical Gardens (where we spent NYE). In summary, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and it completely met our needs for this particular occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, old world hotel in excellent location; splendid staff”
Reviews.Author: JohnEO
Reviews.Content: This is a superb, elegant, oldy world hotel at a great location at Circular Quay, near to the Rocks. Expensive but value for money given the quality and location of this hotel. We booked online and got a good deal. Right from the friendly welcome from the staff on arrival, we had a great 2-day whistle-stop stay. Check-in was a breeze. Our heavy luggage was whisked up to our deluxe room by a friendly, customer-oriented (elderly) bellman who delighted in showing us all the 7th floor roomâ€™s facilities down to the splendid view of the harbour (and opera house), and the handy golf-size umbrella in the cupboard. The room was spacious with a lounge settee and chair, desk, broadband, and a large bathroom with two basins and appointed in Carrera marble. The bed was comfortable, large, and not too soft. Every time we passed a staff member, we received a friendly smile and solicitation. Even arranged late evening room cleaning while we went to dinner, after we forgot to take off the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign on the door! We did not try the elegant restaurant for dinner â€“ but breakfast offered good, wholesome, hot and cold food with a wide variety of choices, including good back bacon (not the cheap streaky/fatty stuff offered by US hotels). We also did not have time to use the swimming pool. In the 2 days we spent there, we visited the New South Wales Parliament (personalized tour, even though they had just closed!), the Barracks Museum (showing convict archaeology and history), St Maryâ€™s Cathedral, and the outside of the Opera House (really one of the greatest twentieth century buildings in the world!) Had dinner outside at the East China restaurant on the Quay with a great view of the bridge at sunset. (Some of the best Chinese food weâ€™ve had + a good wine list.) Second day (Good Friday) was overcast and cooler; we visited the grounds of Government House (the House was closed) and then did the tour of the Opera House (a must) and the ferry to Manly, enjoying great views of the Bridge and the Opera House on the way (Get a seat at the stern.) Manly is a favourite short-range destination for Sydney folks on holidays. At Manly, we visited Oceanworld to see the sharks and other exotic fish in a glass tunnel. Despite fearing it would be cheesy, it was a real eye opener, and not at all cheesy. (You can even don a diving suit and check out the fish on a more personal basis. We were told the sharks didnâ€™t bite, but didnâ€™t want to take the risk!) Back to Sydney, then spent a couple of hours just walking up and down George Street and around the Rocks. Wonderful. When you check out, do check your bill carefully to ensure you are not charged for the inclusive breakfast and broadband, if itâ€™s supposed to be included in your package. The hotel sorted it out â€“eventually. One more tip: if you take the shuttle back to the airport, be sure to leave yourself plenty of time and confirm 24 hours in advance. The shuttle arrived at the hotel on time but after picking up other passengers and what seemed like a complete tour of Sydney, arrived at the airport half an hour late.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: quin-i-bog
Reviews.Content: Despite booking for 5 nights, our stay at the Sir Stamford lasted less than 4 hours! We had asked for an early check-in (and had an email confirmation of the request) but when we arrived at 7am after an overnight flight we were told that no rooms were available and check-in was 3pm. We asked them to make a room available as soon as possible and the receptionist just looked at us and repeated "check in is 3pm". We said OK, we would wait in the Quay lounge (we were paying for the privilidge) but were told - no you can't use the lounge until tomorrow. When we asked why, the receptionist said "because lounge access doesn't start until the next morning after you check-in"!! On insisting that we were going to the lounge the receptionist made a call to the manager who graciously said that we could wait in the lounge! We sat in the windowless room and had coffee but after 3 hours and no news on the progress of the room, we went back to reception. A different clerk said that there was no such thing as priority cleaning and check in was still 3pm! He also said that he was going to charge my card not only 5 x $400 AUD upfront for our stay, but also $500 for "extras we might charge". Have you ever stayed in a hotel that charged you the entire cost of the stay plus extra before you've even checked in? I refused permission to make these charges and he very bluntly told me that this was company policy. I told him how rude I thought he was and his response was a very smarmy "thank you madame". In fact that's all he'd say to anything else I said! When it became clear that we could not check-in until we paid $2500 we decided to leave. I asked to see the manager and the rude clerk said "I am the manager and I have nothing more to say to you!" He then said "even if you leave I'm charging you for 1 night" (which he in fact did) - so it cost us $400 NOT to stay at the Sir Stamford! We went straight to the Shangri-La. checked into a really nice suite and had a fantastic 5 night stay at the lovely Shangri-La. Please don't book the Sir Stamford - I can't tell you what the rooms are like because all we saw was the lounge (which was old fashoned and windowless) but their customer service is non-existant and the staff are rude beyond belief. Also be prepared to have your card charged for the entire stay as soon as you check-in! Dreadful people, don't bother!

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Lovingagoodholiday
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Sir Stamford Circular Quay and we enjoyed it just as much as the first. The staff are extremely well presented and friendly; and check-in is done very quickly without any difficulty. We again chose the Quay floor which has all the rooms situated around a large sitting room. Canapes and drinks are served in the evening, and breakfast is also served there. It is like having a personal dining room for your floor. The hotel is beautifully furnished throughout with paintings and luxurious carpets etc. The Quay rooms are very large, and include a king bed, lounge suite plus chairs and a balcony. The bathrooms are spacious and marble tiled. There is a separate shower/bath/toilet with lovely fluffy towels and nice toiletries. It is conveniently located near Circular Quay, Opera House and the Rocks. The main shopping area around Centrepoint is a pleasant 15 minute walk and from there you can catch a monorail to Darling Harbour. Check your room rate for included valet parking; otherwise it's an extra $30 and I'm not sure if it's daily or for the length of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our 5 week trip.”
Reviews.Author: eaborden
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. It is an easy block to Circular Quay across from the botanical gardens and yet removed from any noise. The hotel has a lot of old world charm, antique furnishings and paintings and a very courteous, caring staff. We had everything we could ask for in a hotel and would most certainly stay there again. It was like coming home at the end of the day. Try to book a room with an inclusive breakfast - the best we had on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Brandonfel
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. The hotel needs to be closed for major renovation. The rooms also need renovation. The heating in my room did not work well. The pool is smaller than a bath tub. The exercise facilities are very small. All in all, the stay was nothing special. However for the money there are many better options in the area. My real gripe with the hotel is that I was over charged. I had 2 gift certificates. I used both while I was at the hotel, but forgot to write on the receipts that I was using gift certificates. Upon checking out of the hotel, I saw an extra $100 on my bill, but when I explained to the front desk that I had used 2 gift certificates they agreed to correct my bill. However, a months latter when I was home, my credit card was charged the additional $100. I sent an email to the hotel and their corporate office, however neither has had the courtesy to respond in the last 2 months. I would not stay at the hotel again because if you look at the property you can see it used to be a grand dame when it was part of the Ritz Carlton chain, but as the hotel began to deteriorate the Ritz choose to abandon the property since obviously the owners of the hotel choose not to upgrade. If you want to stay at a hotel that used to be nice this is the place for you. I used to work in the travel industry and can assure you that when a Ritz Carlton drops a hotel it is a sign that the hotel is going down hill. If you are looking for hotel that is top notch than this is not the place for you. This hotel is better situated for someone who doesnâ€™t feel comfortable at a true 5 star property. I would not say here again.

Reviews.Title: “Getting old”
Reviews.Author: aerotraveller
Reviews.Content: Few hotels would permit less than 3 night bookings over new years so we grabbed a two night reservation at this very well located hotel, just behind the opera house. The hotel is clean and the beds have luxury sheets and duvets but the carpets are worn, and the feeling is also worn. Yes, its clean and well located but incredibly overpriced. No restaurant to eat a light snack or a la carte breakfast, so we went next door to the very attractive intercontinental. Time for a face lift for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Mado69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb for 5 days on a 3 city visit of Oz. Dubious at first as the hotels web site made it look stuffy, however the staff were very friendly and helpful, even without a tip. Hotel. This hotel has one of the best locations i imagine you could get in Syndey, it really is only 2 minutes walk from circular Quay, the Opera House, the Bridge, the Ferrys, bars, resturants etc. We never once caught a cab in Sydney, from this location you can get anywhere using public transport and, wait for it, your feet. As i said the staff were great, the entrance hall and lounge where the lifts are is imposing. The rooms were large with comfy beds, Only con was we had an ajoinoing door to the next room which meant we could hear them occasionally, and i suppose they could hear us. Must admit we didnt eat here as we went out every night, however there were lots of other guests eating. We used the bar every night when we got back, it seemed very old british colonial which we loved, and we used to finish the evening off with a few glasses of port or brandy and their cheese board. Yes there are many cheaper hotels in sydney, yes some of them are near circular quay, however for a few extra bucks its worth coming hear if your a couple and want somewhere romantic to stay and also be close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Very 'English' - instant appeal”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneKiwi
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sir Stanford via Wotif for our final night in Sydney (the previous 3 nights we stayed at the Sheraton at the Park, but the 4th night there was going to be too expensive due to demand). We paid A$280 for a Quay Lounge room (3rd floor, canapes, breakfast included). The Sir Stanford continually promotes itself as saying its own website will offer the best online deals, but in comparing Wotif with the company website, found that for the same thing the company website was circa A$50 more expensive). Maybe just an oversight on this occasion but I was not arguing with it. My wife took an instant liking to the room - very English like, nice curtains, juliette balcony, white marble bathroom, lovely bed etc. And spacious. Some negatives, that hopefully management (if they read these reviews) can work on for the benefit of guests:- 1. As we were only coming from the Sheraton up the road, we checked in circa 12.15pm - room was apparently not ready, but were advised to come back about 2pm. I explained that as we were leaving quite early the next morning we would appreciate a room as soon as possible, and the front desk girl confirmed with me what my mobile number was and that she would phone as soon as the room was going to be ready. I did not receive any phone call but when we returned to the hotel at 1.45pm, our room was ready and baggage was already there. So the promised phone call did not eventuate - poor service in my book. 2. Drinks and canapes provided on Level 3 between 5 and 8pm. The alcohol range was fine. The nibbles - absolutely pitiful. The service by staff - terrible. Non existant I would say. You are provided with a plate of small delicate morsels - three each, on a plate which is brought out of their back room. That is it. I did ask for another plate - and was told sorry, only one per couple. There was no food at all once you had your little plate - not even nuts. Initially the service was okay - we came into the Quay Lounge, sat down and were offered drinks and the small plate. We stayed maybe an hour, and watched as other guests came, and had to help themselves to drinks as no staff member was around (there would have been a maximum of two in the back room, but heaven knows what they were doing). I waited for about 15 minutes before helping myself to a top up of my wine glass. Compared to the drinks and canapes we had the previous three nights at the Sheraton on the Park - the Sir Stanford gets a total of 1 for 'the English feel' - the Sheraton blows them out of the water in terms of food and service in scoring a 10 by comparison. We did not stay for breakfast as we left at 6am so cannot comment on the quality of the breakfast food and service. The hotel itself is in a brilliant situation (better than Darling Harbour hotels) as it is on the doorstep to the Opera House and the beautiful Botanic Gardens. It is also an easy ten minute walk to The Rocks. If you want to catch a ferry or train - at most, a three minute walk away. Best part for us was taking a walk at dusk through the Botanic gardens and having the lorikeets and cockatoos land on your arms and shoulders searching for food. Although they have signs up to not feed the birds, take an apple or two as it will make a wonderful picture with these darlings sitting on you feeding away (but also take a few tissues as they do have a tendancy to go to the 'toilet' whilst posing wonderfully for the camera!). In summary, Sir Stanford, great location and lovely room. But poor marks for front desk (promising to phone then not delivering) and limited food and non existent service at the Quay Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steff_in_italy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the Opera house. I stayed here for two nights and it was very nice. My room was very comfortable and it provided me with a great view of the city. I booked directly through the hotel website and booked the weekend deal for $315 per night which included one free movie, popcorn, free breakfast & a $40 coupon to use in the bar. When I arrived at the hotel a door man greeted me and I was checked in and walked promptly up to my room. I found this hotel to be distinctive and comfortable . The staff was very helpful and provided me with great service. I dined at the bar and found the appetizers to be ok, I paid $18 for 3 scoops of ice cream. The bar had a great atmosphere but it was a bit over priced. I liked this hotel and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: keza123
Reviews.Content: Just spent a Friday night at this lovely hotel. This was the first time we have stayed in 5 star and we weren't disappointed. The room was large with great bathroom facilities. The bed was very comfortable. The only bad comment would have to be the temperature. It was the middle of winter but we found the room was very stuffy even though I put the airconditioning down to it's lowest temperature 16C. The staff were extremely friendly. We visited the bar before going out for dinner. There were bar staff wandering around the area ready to take your order when needed. We were also given complimentary nuts/snack mix which was refilled when ever necessary. Once again the only bad comment was the temperature. It was so very hot and stuffy which was a shame as we would have loved to stay longer to listen to the singer/pianist that was just setting up. Breakfast was included in our package which we ate in the dining room. It was a lovely way to finish our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room was out of this world. shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: proppy
Reviews.Content: I hope things have changed since I stayed! The room was out of this world. Amazing but the staff were so rude and unhelpful. terrible. I do hope they have sorted that out. The hotel itself is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: josh909
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sir Stamford the night we were married before heading off overseas the next day. I highly rate this hotel - the room was pristine and was huge with a balcony overlooking the park. The staff were friendly and accommodating - our request for a late check out was no problem and little things like having champagne chilled on ice for our return were also taken care of. Whilst normally I have no need to find hotel accommodation in Sydney, I would have no hesitation in recommending this establishment to friends or family visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 star”
Reviews.Author: PerthGoldplate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the at end of April 2007 at Sir Stamford Circular Quay celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary. The hotel is lovely with a wonderful worldly aspect to the public areas. The bar, as has been noted in other reviews, did have a certain old library feel about it, which we enjoyed. We stayed in a deluxe king room on the 9th floor that came with its own Juliette balcony, providing a lovely view of the Opera House. The room was large, clean and comfortable with a dream bed. Equipped with a large, impressive marble bathroom with separate basins, shower, bathtub and closed off toilet. As you stepped from the lift you got the feeling you were stepping into a well furnished NY apartment. Given its calibre of reputation, location and indeed price, we were disappointed though with the selection for breakfast that could be best described as sparse. There was just the usual selection as a million other hotel buffets around the world, eg no selection of eggs or a chef to cook something a-la carte as one might expect to find at a hotel aimed at the premium traveller. Further as it was our 10th wedding anniversary, which they knew as they congratulated us upon arrival, there was nothing special in the room (not a chocolate nor bottle of bubbly in sight). Concierge - James and Chris excellent, helpful, nothing too difficult - very knowledgeable. Disappointed with Jimmy - assisted us at checkout - called us a taxi to take us to the domestic airport - half way through our trip we noticed meter was not on - asked driver why - he said Jimmy arranged for him to take us to airport for $45.00! NO negotiation was made between us and Jimmy. Driver then called Jimmy at hotel and confirmed the price, though we denied and argued - but what were we to do half way into the trip ask the driver to dump us and our luggage at the side of the road? We were later informed by locals that the fare can be between $25 to $30 depending on traffic. It took us all of 20 mins! Be aware! One very interesting aspect was, if you requested your room not to be serviced or cleaned that day, a 20% discount voucher for food in the hotelâ€™s restaurants was left on your pillow. Nice idea. Overall we enjoyed our stay and the hotel. We would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CalBear70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the excellent reviews by the reviewers on this site for three nights prior to our cruise. We arrived at about 9 am in the morning and a room was not yet available but they offered us the use of their shower facilities in their gym and pool area. I felt pretty grungy after 14.5 hour flight and exiting the airport. After brushing my teeth and taking a shower, I felt much better. They brought up our luggage so I could change and took it back after we decided to leave and explore the city. They sent us up a tea service so we could refresh ourselves. The staff and concierge couldn't have been nicer. When we returned, our room was ready and the uggage placed in the room. The hotel is small and quiet. It's not stuffy and in an ideal location up l block from Circular Quay. The rooms are a good size and the bath and dressing area are larger than normal. Everything was clean and tidy. There is a electric teapot for heating water and teabags and coffee powder in the room. There was no internet access that I could determine in the hotel but I didn't ask. The hotel is very close to the Opera House and Botanical Gardens. We could walk to many attractions or catch the buses. Circular Quay is a main transit terminal for bus and ferry. One block away is the NSW State Library where visitors can use free internet for 15 minutes. We loved our stay at Sir Stamford and highly recommend it based on our experience. (We are very particular.) The young staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly good enough...”
Reviews.Author: MozLondonEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner at the Sir Stamford on the third leg of a three centre Australian trip and whilst the accommodation in Melbourne & Cairns had been more than adequate, this place was a major let down. The room we were allocated hadn't been cleaned properly with litter still in the bins and unwashed coffee cups & drinks cans on the table (the 'compensation' for this comprised a derisory four chocolates and a note saying 'sorry' from the management !) The conceriege was either unable (or unwilling) to make any restaurant reservations on our behalf and the bar was distinctly unwelcoming. So dispiriting was the whole experience we actually aborted our stay by several nights and flew back to London. As a regular business traveller I can claim a certain familiary with the quality of service one can expect from four & five star hotels and this one didn't come close. I can only hope that in the time that has elapsed since our stay things have improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great city!”
Reviews.Author: Plitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sir Stamford for a week and it was marvelous. Our room was spacious with a great king size bed and a comfortable bathroom. We had a juliet balcony overlooking Circular Quay and we enjoyed seeing the cruise ships docking across the quay. The Opera House is a five minute walk and the Botanical Gardens are right outside the front door. All the staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel matched the best rate we found on various websites. One thing to be aware of if you have a back or knee problem is that Albert Street which leads from the hotel to the quay is very steep. Can't say enough good things about Sydney. If you like being on the water get a ferry pass. We went on the ferry every day, walked around and had lunch in Mosman, Watson's Bay, Darling Harbor and of course Manly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old world charm and comfort”
Reviews.Author: ragout
Reviews.Content: Our room didn't quite have the view of the Opera House we had envisioned when we purchased a View Room but we did look over McQuarrie Park and if we stepped onto the Juliet balcony we could see the Opera House. But......for the price we paid we felt we got good value. The Deluxe King was large and the bed so comfortable. Black out curtains. Very quiet. Nice to be able to open a window to enjoy the Sydney air. The entrance hall with closet was spacious and the bathroom with shower/tub was large enough. It also had a seperate toilet room. The Concierge - Chris had incredible dining recommendations and was so helpful and thoughtful the whole time we were there - 3 days. We loved the outdoor pool which seemed to get lots of use as the temps were ripe for sunning and swimming. Must say parts of it looked a bit like it was an after thought by the standard of chaise and cushion covering. But it was perfect for us. The location is just up the hill from the Circular Quay. It looks like some rooms may not have much of a view, So check carefully when you book. For the price, the comfort, the charming old world elegance of the hotel's public areas and rooms, we were very happy with our package. One would need to pay more for a really hot view! Quay at Circular Quay? the Marriot high up? the Holiday Inn (Old one)? might be good possiblities for view hotels but I would think one would pay more this privilege. We would go back to the Stamford at Circ Quay any day.

Reviews.Title: “A little stuffy.....”
Reviews.Author: puffpuff
Reviews.Content: This is a very traditional hotel, with rather formal public rooms and a very stuffy bar, which really wasn't inviting at all. The decor was rather tired in places. Having said that, the bedrooms were very comfortable, with really large beds and it was all very clean. Although it is in a very central location, it isn't close enough or high enough to have decent views of the harbour or opera house, which is a great shame. However, it is only about 4 minutes walk to the opera house from the hotel, and only slightly longer to some great restaurants. They were extremely accommodating about an early check-in. We arrived at the hotel at around 08.00 from an overnight flight, and were offered access to the leisure facilities to shower and change, while they promised to prioritise our room. By the time we had finished, they came to tell us that our room was ready. Although we didn't use the gym facilities ourselves, we did see them first-hand, and thought they were very small and inadequate, both in terms of the equipment and the showers/changing rooms. Two people would have been a crowd! Although tea and coffee making facilities are provided in-room, the milk was in the fridge and "charged" as being part of the mini-bar. We came across this elsewhere in our travels in Australia, and it seemed annoyingly penny-pinching. As it was also long-life milk and therefore not that nice, we simply asked housekeeping to provide a jug of fresh milk. This they did, but with some reluctance. The overall experience was fine, but it was far from the best hotel we stayed in along the way.

Reviews.Title: “tranquil haven”
Reviews.Author: highbank
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Sir Stamford hotel and were delighted with its position, quality and value for money for a city hotel. The hotel is very convenient for Circular Quay, just a couple of minutes walk and very pleasantly situated opposite the botanical gardens. The staff are very welcoming and after a busy hot day, walking into the hotel's cool, tranquil atmosphere is bliss! Our standard room was large with sofa and desk, tea making facilities etc. The bathroom was marble, large with high quality fittings. For breakfast there was a wide choice of fruit, cereals, bacon, eggs etc. Towards the end of our stay we realised that you could actually order omelettes, fried eggs etc but noone had told us that. My only criticism was that the coffee was in my opinion poor compared to the general standard in Sydney cafes. In general we found the hotel very quiet ,although we did have the windows closed at night. On one occasion we could hear noise from another room but that was all. I would definitely recommend the hotel and return if we visit Sydney again - we loved the city, it is a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Great location just in front the botanic garden”
Reviews.Author: orangetanger
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights in Sydney in the Stamford Hotel in September 2006. Very good location on Macquarie street. If you want to be in an elegant hotel, near the opera, the botanic garden and the Rocks, don't hesitate. Good breakfast. Nice lobby with beautiful antics and carpets. Like an english club. Service not very present. Prefer superior rooms rather than luxury rooms, smaller. Try also the junior suite if you can afford.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Davidius
Reviews.Content: Near-perfect location, a few steps from Circular Quay and its ferries/restaurants. Formerly the Ritz Carlton, the furnishings remain the same. Rooms are spacious and well equipped. Expensive rack rates but good packages (Quay Escapes) are available which include full breakfast in the dining room. The staff try to keep up the standards of the Ritz Carlton but don't all come up to the challenge. The service at breakfast was at times bizarre--coffee and tea ordered but didn't come at the first time of asking; shortage of butter; a toaster that burns; rather frightend uncommunicative waitresses. Despite these idiosyncracies, this is as good a place to stay as any in Sydney, if you want quiet luxury at a reasonable(for Sydney!) price.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous,elegant,stylish - A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a prime position just minutes from the Opera House, Circular Quay and The Rocks area. It is housed in a beautiful National Trust Heritage building with nine or ten floors. The foyer and lobby area are gorgeous with lovely 18th century Georgian antique furniture. The hotel has a distinctive ambience and oozes with charm and character. The art work within the hotel is also very impressive. Our room 905 which was booked through wotif.com.au at a cheap rate was absolutely wonderful. It was very spacious with a king size bed, small table and chairs, lamps, mini bar, coffee and tea facilities, trouser press, with a comfortable lounge chair and ottoman. The best thing was our huge balcony which had stunning views of the Harbour Bridge, Sydney Harbour and the Botanical Gardens. I was very ecstatic, as I had booked this hotel for a surprise for my husbandâ€™s birthday. Most of our time except for dinner was spent just sitting on the outdoor table and chairs taking in the spectacular view, and at night it truly was magical. We noticed the room next door to ours (911) had a bigger balcony and they would actually get the same view but with the Opera House added in as a bonus. (Fabulous room for New Years Eve.) The bathroom was marble and had two separate vanity units and excellent makeup mirror. Fluffy white bathrobes and slippers were also supplied. The hotel has an outdoor swimming pool and a good size deck area with sauna and gym supplied. We had dinner in the restaurant which had a lovely atmosphere, but we were hugely disappointed with the service. We waited 40 minutes for our bottle of wine, and another hour for our entrÃ©e; the main took approx the same amount of time. I was furious and complained bitterly, as to me they had ruined my husbandâ€™s birthday. They did say they had a conference downstairs, and there was a problem with the kitchen. Regardless, I thought this to be unacceptable, they later apologized and offered to refund part of our meal. Overall, apart for the misfortune of our dinner fiasco, I thought this hotel to be wonderful. If I was visiting Sydney, this hotel would suit me perfectly. I have given this hotel a 5 star rating for its position, ambience, atmosphere and our fantastic spacious balcony with stunning views. Oops, I almost forgot to mention the lovely touch of â€œromance and seductionâ€� CD playing when you opened your door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful with a bit of snootiness”
Reviews.Author: mmed
Reviews.Content: Across from the botanic gardens in the best section to explore Sydney. Rooms were what you would expect--marble baths, robes, slippers, music on when you come in. The little balconies were a treat too. Breakfast was great and their bar area was cozy and had great ambiance. Dinner at their restaurant was not so hot and we had some problems with our room. We booked on their internet and emailed several times to request a room with one bed. We had no response and assumed that a high end hotel had just taken care of it. That was not the case and when we got there they could not move us. We were told that that was just the way it went by the first couple of people we talked to. We also found out that they had overbooked the hotel by 5% and were actually hoping someone might not check in. We finally found someone sympathetic who moved us for 2 nights to the host floor to make up for it. All in all, we loved it here but found some of the staff snooty and not willing to help. The other half of the staff though went above and beyond.
